Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Rizzonator
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week in late April here with my wife and toddler. This facility is top notch. The pool/waterpark areas are amazing for kids. The baby pool has a very large Tarp blocking direct sun which was perfect. The are was great for kids of any age. Resort itself is also super clean. We stayed in Building 28 ( 2824 ) which overlooked the pool area. We will be coming back, most likely for 2 weeks the next time. The once complaint we had was they originally mentioned they had full cribs which turns out the be Pack and Plays. We ended up renting one from Kingdom Strollers ( Matt is who i dealt with and was great cooridinating with the resort) If you have young children, the were great in accomodating an early check in, however we never did get the voice mail from them saying room was ready at 12:30, we showed back up at 4....oh well Nothing bad to say...amazing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: cabtrin
Reviews.Content: This resort is great forfamilies with small children. We stayed here with our 6 month old and 2 & 1/2 year old girls and they loved the pools. Great for a week spent visiting Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay for families with children.”
Reviews.Author: dolcemamma
Reviews.Content: This was out first time back in years and this time we brought our grandson 3. After a long flight we got to check in early and got the area and building we requested. We went right to the pool and my grandson loved the huge pirate ship with slides in the pool, that is all he wanted to do more than Disney!!! Plenty of other fun things do do also, miniture golf, an area to play ball, or kick a soccer ball around a game room too! Our room was clean and well maintained, had everything we needed. Good food area near the pool, only wish they had an actual Market Place like most Marriott timeshares. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Children”
Reviews.Author: Ruralgrl
Reviews.Content: Just completed a week stay in April. The exterior facility is very well maintained and clean. We stayed in a first floor unit, in what they deemed newly renovated, however after seeing the inside I believe it was not the case. Everything was clean, but dated. The constant noise of water running through the interior wall from five floors above day and night was unacceptable. Showers, toliets, and sinks. Constant. Interrupted our sleep every night. The priate pool was a big hit for children, and the lrage pool with the slide was very busy with kids as well. We enjoyed dinner at the cafe, simple fare but yummy, bar drinks were a little pricey. This certainly is a family resort with not allot of things for couples to do. We asked for foam pillows and they delivered several for our use. Teen night activites starting at 9:00 p.m. and ending at 10:00 p.m. caused allot of night noise, running in the walkway outside our door until 11:00 p.m. Although the resort cannot control the actions of teens, perhaps starting the activity a little eariler might be useful. Activites around the priate pool (bingo, family triva) were announced via a microphone, disruptive for those of us not participating. We moved to the other pool.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: redjet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harbour Lake the last week of March and what a nice resort it is. We stayed in a building that was recently renovated and thought the furnishings were very nice. Our screened in porch did not have a great view, but it was better than the rooms facing the pool or highway. The resort is small but had two great kids pools and activities. We were on the second floor and our room was quiet with no bugs. Would definently stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: funky_m70
Reviews.Content: Second stay here and it's got better, staff all say hello and make you feel welcome which is noticeable when you move to another hotel. The pools are great and stay open late which is perfect after a day at the parks. The location is perfect for shopping, parks, restaurants and the road is quiet so there's no issues getting here or out. The only problem is the neighbours who seem to have no concept of keeping quiet even at 0530 when they're obviously leaving, maybe this is due to thin walls or adjoining room doors. Would stop here again if the chance arises.

Reviews.Title: “Love coming here”
Reviews.Author: broncoalum97
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of March 2012. We had already been to this place in May 2011 & had an enjoyable stay, so we wanted to come back to Harbour Lake for this trip. It was myself, my husband, my 4 yr old daughter, 1 1/2 yr old son & a girlfriend of mine. Both times we have had new towels in our rooms almost every day if not each day. We don't need it cleaned, we want to not worry about being gone so they can clean it, we're on vacation. Love that most everything is provided, we just have to supply food. You can also order Pizza Hut from the Marriott Cypress resort across the road. We had a 2 room suite, which worked for us & we needed a pack n play which was already set up when we got there. We've only used the smaller of the 2 pools since we have young children, but have used the Putt-putt golf, use of games to check out. They have activities for all ages each day, so it's very family friendly. I love that there is security to enter the grounds, you must have a pass in order to get in, so I feel very safe there. We will definately be back again, no complaints here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: ArmyDoc80
Reviews.Content: Stayed a few days in Jan 2012. Nice, clean room. Great pools. Close proximity to Orlando main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: cpdr1
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our timeshare week and stayed here for our kids spring break. This gated resort is excellent for kids (ours are 7 and 5) and they loved it. The resort has two pools both of which can accomodate all ages. The rooms are decent size, very clean, and everything working with no problems. With some of the complaints i've read below It seems that some of you don't know: MOST hotels/timeshares that have a full kitchen DO NOT have maid service included in your stay- you have to pay extra. Perfectly fine with us. The staff were polite and upon check in they offer you free gifts- of course we know that's including a timeshare presentation- which we never bothered with. After settling in go to either publix or superwalmart and get your groceries there. Trust me you'll save alot of $ just by eating breakfast and lunch at the resort. If you can buy your Disney or Universal tickets elsewhere they charge roughly $10 - 20 more a person. We have a triple A membership so we bought all of our tickets at a AAA office. The only reason I gave this resort a 4/5 was I requested an updated room on the top floor. They gave us a room farthest away from the pools and the room wasn't an updated one that I've seen pictures of. I guess they give those rooms to the property owners which I understand. That's ok the room they gave us was just fine. Another minus was their pullout bed/couch mattress was springy and uncomfortable. Although the kids didn't seem to mind since they were pooped out at bedtime. Oh their fitness center was great- have everything covered. If you haven't taken any family pictures take advantage of their photographer. You get a free 5X7 (included with your stay) but for a little more you get professional pics that you will cherish (excellent backgrounds and reasonable prices too). We had a great time and wouldn't hesitate going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great family rental”
Reviews.Author: ParrotheadMomATL
Reviews.Content: We spent spring break here and loved it. The unit wasn't huge but the layout was nice with a king in the master and 2 queens in the second bedroom. Cable, Internet, flatscreen TVs, all very nice. There was a bar and "booth" seating which gave us plenty of room during meals. There were activities for the kids every day, and the two pools were great with a waterside and 2 small waterparks. They had mini golf, ping pong, foosball, cornhole toss, soccer, basketball, rec room with games - plenty to do! The fitness center was very nice with new equipment. They have gas grills available. It is easy to get around from here, as Sea World is right around the corner. Disney is about 10-15min drive. There is a Publix just about 3 miles away on Central Fla Blvd, and a CVS with a Minute Clinic about 2 miles away. It was so crowded around Orlando that we hung out at the resort several days and nobody got bored! The pools and other activity areas are all located close together so the kids could easily make their way around but have us close by. Overall a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Fam.”
Reviews.Author: DBRDanielIsland_SC
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place for the family. Pool is awsome for kids and adults. Lots to do and close to all the Orlando attractions. Staff can't help enough!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Vacation”
Reviews.Author: walesinc
Reviews.Content: The family (2 adults and a 4 year old) visited this resort during the last week of March. We booked a one bedroom villa (bldg 21 1st floor close to the pools and the reception area), I think that’s the building's #.The villa was very nice and modern (2 flat screen TV’s, nice kitchen e.t.c). The staff was very nice and courteous they had 2 pools which were always busy my daughter loved both pools. The on site food was decent but there are many places to eat around "international drive". The resort was not too far from the parks "Disney" about 15 mins (i think you do need a car if you stay at this resort. All in all it was a very good vacation. N.B The resort has a very nice gym (decent size).

Reviews.Title: “Fun for Kids - not as grand as others”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie D
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over February vacation. We have also stayed at the Marriott Grande Vista and the Marriott Cypress Harbour. The Harbour Lake was nice. There was a lot for the kids to do (ages 10 and 12). The activities are all centrally located. However, the rooms and the property were not as grand as the other Marriott Vacation Clubs we have stayed at in Orlando. Would probably choose to go back to Cypress Harbour or Grande Vista before coming back here.

Reviews.Title: “Do not recommend this hotel and will not go back again.”
Reviews.Author: SduNyc
Reviews.Content: I am a fan of the Marriott Hotel. This was the first time that I stayed at the Marriott Resort. I was so disappointed. First, I didn't know the hotel does not provide house keeping service. I think they should have informed the guess during the booking process. Second, the studio room is too small. Since it's a resort, I would expect the room is bigger than a regular hotel room. I traveled with my kids and my husband. My kids needed to sleep on a sofa bed. However, their services were good. I had an issue with the our clothes. The resort provides washer and dryer machine on the same floor for free. There was the problem with the dryer that our clothes came out with some machine oils and all of our clothes were messed up. So, we reported to the front desk and they took care it for us. Although some clothes came back still weren't cleaned, I received $100 credit from the hotel and I think it's reasonable. Overall, the hotel was okay and the pools were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fun for ALL!”
Reviews.Author: momof2boys17
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Harbour Lake about 4-5 times over the last few years. We are FL residents but visit the Orlando area often. I can't believe I forgot to review this hotel! It's a really nice place, only ONCE have I ever had an issue here, and that was last July when we were visiting for my son's 8th birthday, there was a HUGE rainstorm (typical for Florida of course) and we were up on the top floor. When we got back to our room there was water pouring into the kitchen area from the door (you walk into the kitchen when you arrive in your room) apparently there was no seal around the door. I used all of the room towels to clean up and had housekeeping send up additional towels. That was it. Aside from that- our stays have always been pleasant. The hotel is clean, the staff is friendly. The pools are great, kids love going down the slide and running around in the water area on the other side of the pool getting splashed by the big bucket of water that fills up - just like they have at the Nick Hotel, but no green water/fake slime. I'd rather bring my kids to this hotel anyway. I read someone complain that they asked for 2 luggage carts to be sent to their room and then were told they do not have any at the facility. Yes, they do. We use them all the time. We've never requested that someone else bring them to us though, we've always gone down the elevator to the first floor and retrieved them ourselves. But yes, they do have them. I don't know any hotel that does not! I would definitely return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly”
Reviews.Author: darlenesfamily
Reviews.Content: This resort was great! We were there in August 2011. My 15 and 12 yr old loved the pools. There were plenty of activities to keep them busy throughout the day. The evening shows were awesome and for the whole family. The room was great, I asked in advance for an updated room after reading the reviews on trip advisor. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT A++++++”
Reviews.Author: TA14
Reviews.Content: OK I read all of the reviews and when I read some I was afraid of what we'd find. The place was wonderful. Not a cockroach in sight. LOL The place was clean, staff was friendly, pools were awesome, food was good, drinks were good, room was ample. Unless you only have two people get at least a 1 or 2 bedroom. We stayed in a studio and could have used more space. The pool area was amazing for kids. My 4 year old son with with us and he LOVED it. We were at the parks and he wanted to go back to the pool. So close to all the parks. Didn't hassle us about timeshare. Even though it is a timeshare type resort, the towels were changed out and new toiletries were put in the bathroom every day. She even took dirty dishes away and put clean ones in the cupboard. We would definitely go back. Also, for the reviews about cockroaches, it's Florida, there are going to be bugs. Don't leave food laying around your room if you don't want to attract visitors. LOL We didn't see a bug and everything was clean. That's all. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for families”
Reviews.Author: A_Trini
Reviews.Content: Marriott's Harbour lake is just wonderful for families with small children. The adventure themed pool and waterslide is fun, fun, fun!

Reviews.Title: “Pools are great but.....”
Reviews.Author: SueCurry
Reviews.Content: This property is very kid friendly. And the pools and pool staff are amazing! Our granddaughter had a great time on the Pirate Ship. The pools are very crowded and to get a lounge chair you must be at the pool before 9 AM. Let's talk rooms--we own 4 timeshares and never have I seen rooms that need updated so badly. Two of many complaints--no luggage racks(after I was told they would send 2 up?)--then they told us they don't have any in the facility AND no roll away beds! Very noisy at night and early morning. Guests were not very considerate of other guests. Great for families with children if you don't want them to get any sleep! Not such a "Magical" experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Family with Small Kids”
Reviews.Author: Rima P
Reviews.Content: We love this place - have been there two different times. The pools are great, the rooms are spacious, and the staff is really friendly. Only 15 minutes to Magic Kingdom, but really, the pools are enough to keep the kids occupied.

Reviews.Title: “Disney with the Grandkids”
Reviews.Author: Nancy19468
Reviews.Content: My 3 year old grandaughter said it all when we pulled in to register-"Daddy this place is awesom, when can we get out of the car?" As grandparents we were able to spend a week with our son's family in a place that was great for the three grandchildren and had the convenience of kitchen facilities, washer and dryer and a great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for young families”
Reviews.Author: Karen&Martin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful for families with young children. It has a plethora of activities for children, including game rooms, a small playground, organized games and 2 pools which have slides and sprinklers perfect for children (and adults, too). The rooms are very comfortable, and again perfect for a family. We stayed in a two bedroom, two bath room with full kitchen. The kitchen was well laid out and set up and we made our own breakfast during our stay. If you want to, the kitchen is more than sufficient to cook every meal there. We decided, however, to have dinner out. The rooms are not the most modern, but they are relatively so, and most importantly, they are clean. The staff is friendly and helpful. The price was more than reasonable for the room and service provided. We had no complaints and would feel comfortable recommending this hotel to anyone, particularly, as said, families with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Reminded us of Key West!”
Reviews.Author: Ionagrad
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with our college aged daughter spent a week at this Marriott resort through an exchange via Interval International. Our accommodations consisted of a two bedroom, two bath unit on the fifth floor in one of the newer buildings. It was clean, quiet and well equipped. There were two pools with entertainment at the larger one. Pretty walkway along the lake and a short drive to WDW. We would love to vacation there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Younger Families”
Reviews.Author: lenp1139
Reviews.Content: We spent the week with our son's family which included a 4 year old and a one year old. The 4 year old loved the pirate ship with the water slide. The staff was very helpful and the activities were great for the smaller set. We also liked the pier. While the fishing poles supplied were not the best, they were adequate for the 4 year old to catch a couple of small fish which were promptly fed to the grey herron that seemed to think that he owned the right to all fish caught. The one draw back was that we were on the north west side which is close to Interstate 4 and the road noise distracted from full use of the screened in porch.

Reviews.Title: “Enough Said!”
Reviews.Author: Never A
Reviews.Content: While checking in I asked the front desk clerk if I could request an updated/renovated room. She stated they don't update rooms. I explained to her I had read reviews on trip advisor and from most management response to guest complaints is that they never asked or advised what they wanted. So, I asked for an updated room and I was told by the front desk clerk that they don't do that. I then asked the clerk could I do a walk thru of a room so I could make the determination if the room was accommodating for my families needs. She stated she needed to get the manager. As soon as the manager came out he greeted me and went in on me while I was standing at the front desk with my family. This is what the manager name TOM said, " OUR UPDATED /RENOVATED ROOMS ARE FOR OUR OWNERS ONLY AND NOT OUR GUEST and if you don't like it you can go somewhere else." Enough said! How rude was that? I politely advised him that nowhere on the website does it state that owners of the resort only get a renovated room because if it did I would have gone somewhere else. He became even more rude and loud and the front desk clerks were laughing while he was talking to me. First, the front clerk stated she would get the manager because she wasn't sure if I could do a walk through, we had already established I wasn't getting an updated room. Why he confronted me with that part I wasn't sure. The manager was misguided by the front desk clerks information. The manager Tom was very rude and didn't even consider what I had to say he just started to attack. So if you are going to this resort please remember that the renovated rooms are for the OWNERS!!! Even though we were charged $227 a night. We will not be going back to this less than average resort with roaches and termites flying everywhere on the playground.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: jjb02171
Reviews.Content: all in all this is a wonderful place for families. MY guess is the bad reviews are expecting the service/amenities you get in a MArriott hotel but this is a MArriott Time share and it is fantastic. Rooms: We stayed in a two bedroom unit. It was very spacious for our family of five. Nice size lving room with a flat screen TV and a fully stocked kitchen. The room was what youd expect from a Marriott Time share. Other reviews complained about bugs and noise but we did not experince this at all. As a matter of fact we did not hear our "neighbors" the entire time we were there. We had families staying on either side of us and not once did I hear a TV, or talking, yelling, crying from anyone. Pool: The pools were fantastic. The pirate ship pool is great for young kids, it kept my three entertained for hours. For oldere kids there is another deeper pool with a pretty good sized water slide. Lots of kids playing with balls, floats, etc which they don't allow at all resort pools. There was either a DJ or music playing from the speakers. They also have a splash park with water dumping from large buckets, spraying everywhere, etc. Activities. Seemed like there was something going on every hour of the day from 9:00 AM until 9:00 PM. Ice Cream sunday parties, soccer/flag football games, magicians, DJ's, dancing, etc. Some small charges for some activites but it was a couple bucks at most. They also have an area with pool tables, basketball courts, fooz ball table and mini golf. All of this is free including the mini golf. Signs say mini golf costs $5 but we played several times and were never charged. Resort Grounds: Everything was very well maintained and nice. Other reviews complain about particuluar buildings but we were in the building furthest away from the pools and it was at most a five minute walk. If you are going to cook in a lot then I would recomend asking for a room near the gas grills that are available in certain locations. One annoyance is what seemed like the constant use of gas powered blowers to clean the grounds. You hear them quite often throughout the day and once they were even in the pool area when it was in use. This prompted me to complain to a manager about the excessive noise levels when guests are trying to relax. Food/Bars. Poor. Drinks were fine but very limited food choices that were over priced and not at all good. This is the only reason I did not give 5 stars. You cannot get a nice meal here. It's basically burgers and some fried food options. All in all I would stay here again. Great placer for families. We visited MArriott Cypress Harbour and Sheraton Vistana and I would choose Harbour lakes over either location. HArbour Lakes is small and it's a five minute walk to anywhere in the resort. The other two locations I mentioned were enormous. There had to be at least fifty buildings which to me means long walks or getting in a car if you want to go to a certain pool or restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not the best Marriott...”
Reviews.Author: Lynnhark52
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice resort and the rooms were clean and spacious, BUT this isn't the nicest Marriott resort we have been to. In fact, it seemed like the one right across the street may have been nicer (but we never visited). We were told we had one of the youngest rooms facing the lake. It was nice and clean but it was facing a man-made lake facing the street. The rooms had flat screen TVs and the bedrooms even had a bluray player in them. The doors were all outside corridors, like a motel, which made it very noisy. The pools were very nice but on the cooler side, which seemed odd because they were suppose to be heated. The only thing I did not like was there was no marketplace. When we thought about ordering a pizza we would have gone across the street to the other Marriott to pick it up. They did have many activities for the kids (which we didn't do because our daughter is 4). If you are going just to spend your time at the parks and just need a place to lay your head, it's very nice, but if you are expecting the Marriott high standards it's not. I am use to the Marriott's gorgeous grounds with music playing everywhere and it was missing that.

Reviews.Title: “Average, when compared to others”
Reviews.Author: LargefamilyYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We have stopped at numerous Marriott resorts and also Sheraton and Westgate resorts, so we have a fair idea of what quality to expect. The check-in was very quick, but spoilt by the speil that we needed to pick up a free packup at the ticketing desk.....a load of free coupons that I also saw in Walmart, but it was a key way to try and start selling us park tickets. The rooms are fine, though no big jacuzzi bath that all the other resorts have. The kitchen was well equiped and as a whole the place was comfortable, clean and had great TVs with HD channels. Parking was tight, but then it was spring break and the place was busy. The pools were good, in fact exceptional if you had kids with you. We didn't and missed an adult pool or somewhere that you could swim without being splashed or bombed by kids. You could say that it was us not fully researching the place I guess. There are 2 pools, but both geared for kids. The grounds were well kept, and there was a choice of 3 BBqs to use in the evening. Like I say, if you have kids with you this place will be hard to beat, but they don't really cater for just adult parties. The bar at the pool was good, and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families-not for the 60+ crowd”
Reviews.Author: MMB101
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week here with our daughter, son-in-law and 4 year old granddaughter. The villas are very nice with a large kitchen, living room/dining area and 2 good size bedrooms. The only draw back was that there are outdoor corridors, like a motel. Our daughter said that their bedroom was noisy because the window was along the corridor and she could hear doors opening & closing at night from people entering their villas. We did not spend much time at the resort since we were going to Disney World each day. By Thursday, I needed a break and stayed back with my granddaughter. She loved the zero entry pool and water fountain play area. There are 2 pools and the one with the pirate ship was really too much for a 4 year old since the older kids were not paying attention to any little ones. I personally did not find that pool area relaxing so we went over to the other pool which fortunately was not as crowded with kids. Next time I'll stay across the street at the other Marriott resort (Cypress???).

Reviews.Title: “Harbour Lake...a grand resort!”
Reviews.Author: EjwEsq
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harbour Lake in a 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite, with kitchen, DR and LR, with in-suite laundry. This was one of the best vacation decisions we have ever made. While our view was nothing to write home about, this resort had all the amenities you need and expect when travelling with a family (2 adults, a 14 year old boy and 9 year old girl). The resort is centrally located to Universal and Disney, and very close (almost walking distance) to Sea World. On site, there are a couple of nicely themed, clean pools, mini-golf, tennis and basketball on a sport court. Our experience was excellent, and could not be happier with the resort. As I mentioned to my wife the day we left, "there's no real need to stay on Disney property with a resort like this nearby".

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous resort for young children!”
Reviews.Author: CopperBoyBJCM
Reviews.Content: Our two and eight year olds had a wonderful vacation at this resort. The bar, restaurant & Starbucks on site are great and reasonable. Plenty of fun drinks for kids and adults. Between the water slides, pools, and hourly activities, the kids were entertained all week. A magic show, movie night, bingo, mini golf, ping pong, and shell painting were among the highlights. They have everything covered here for families! The rooms are spacious and well equipped. However, they are dated and starting to see their age. We requested a renovated room at check-in and were told we would be placed in a newly renovated 2 bedroom unit. However, building 14 has not been renovated. Aside from that, our stay was fabulous. We would gladly return next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation of a Lifetime!”
Reviews.Author: capegirlonthego
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here every October for 6 years because it's the best resort we've ever enjoyed. Every place is spotless, activities are fun and continuous! My husband and I get plenty of relaxation and my daughter participates in all the poolside parties, contests and activities. We love it here! We wish we owned our timeshare unit right here, instead we exchange into every year. Service is attentive, food is great (although a bit overpriced-we figure it's worth it to eat by the pool). Both pools are sparkling all the time. At the Pirate Plunge, there is a pool attendant (Joanne) who we see just about every year and we love her. She keeps everyone safe by keeping order and enforcing the rules in a positive way. She runs a tight ship without detracting from the atmosphere. We love going to the pool when she's there. We highly recommend this resort. There is no better place to stay in the Disney Area.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place”
Reviews.Author: Guesswho8thecake
Reviews.Content: We traded our timeshare options to use this place. The hotel was decent, clean but did look older inside the rooms. There are two pools. One has a water slide and spouting play area for the kids. The spouting area water was pretty cold, but the rest was heated. The second pool area has a pirate ship for the kids to play on, this pool was wonderful and one of the highlights of our trip! The water was heated and the perfect temperature, there were features for both my 6 year old and my 2 year old so they both could play and have fun. My only complaint is as a timeshare exchange guest I felt like the messaging to me was that I was a bother to the hotel because I wouldn't purchase a Marriott timeshare while I was there. We know there is no housekeeping with timeshare guests, but this was overly emphasized to us. Immediately upon check in we were told we would receive a "free gift," went to claim it and it was a disposable bag to use at the grocery store, and when claiming it I was told the gift is usually only for the Marriott owners. Of course I was asked to attend their 90 minute timeshare sales pitch, which I declined. Their users manual in the room points out that pool towels are "checked out" to each guest and if not returned incur a $10 fee, should you need extra bedding there is an extra fee, garbage removed = extra fee, any additional cleaning = extra free etc. etc. Instructions on the thermostat said to leave it set to 78 degrees. Even though all this was stated it was not enforced and we incurred no extra charges, but again, it's like the message they want to send is "we know you bought a time share ans chose to stay with us, but it's just not enough." We stayed in a studio room with a queen bed and pull out couch. The pull out couch was not made before hand and about as comfortable to lay on as a bed of nails. I would think in a timeshare where they know families are staying they could at least throw the mattress cover and sheets on the pull out after each guest leaves. I was a little disappointed also that this hotel has no shuttle bus service to any of the Disney Parks, it clearly looked like just about every guest was going to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay @ Marriott Harbour Lake”
Reviews.Author: linesman10
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 with 2 kids ages 3 and 6 stayed there March 11 to 18 th. Very nice and clean resort. Not a large resort by any means. All the buildings are central to the 2 pools and activity areas. The pools are great for younger kids - lots to keep them busy. Centrally located to Sea World, Universal and the Disney Parks as well as Vineland Outlet Mall/Lake Beuna Vista Outlet and many restaurants and grocery stores. We ate a couple times at the pub by the Pirate Ship Pool - not gourmet - but was quick and served the purpose. We had a 1 bedroom suite - large and comfy king size bed - the kids pull out couch was large and comfortable. Everything was in working order and the condo was clean and orderly. Mind you the kitchen and bathroom did not have granite counter tops - that everyone seems to have to have these days - this was not a big deal for us as we were hardly ever in the room. We have stayed the past couple years at Sheraton Vistana Villages and also the Sheraton Vistana Resort - and this was on par with those resorts. Harbour Lake not as big as either of the Sheraton properties but as nice. Would recommend Harbour Lake for families with little kids.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly - Great Value - Spacious Suites”
Reviews.Author: Curt909
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in a 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite on the 6th floor overlooking the pool. The unit was beautifully furnished and spotlessly clean. Every possible amenity was provided from corkscrews (they got a workout) to dishwasher detergent. Flat screen TVs in all rooms, nice screened balcony, wall safe for valuables. Security was excellend as was the entire staff. Great location for all theme park activities but in a quiet setting.

Reviews.Title: “THE Best Family Vacation Resort!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MommaBirdMichigan
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5...a 6 yr old and 3 yr old twins. We stayed the end of Feb-begining of March. This property was absolutely IDEAL for a family with young children! The pool areas were fantastic. The property amenities and scheduled activities kept our boys busy from the time they woke up until they crashed at the end of the day. Definately purchase the family pass for the putt-putt course. It is a steal if you have kiddos whom like to mini-golf. The location cannot be beat. You are a stone's-throw away from everything. They also have a trolley pick-up location just outside their parking lot. The trolley runs up-and-down International Drive. We rented a 2bdrm villa and it was fantastic! The beds were very comfortable. The kitchen was equipped with everything we needed for preparring meals for a week. The washer and dryer was very helpful as well. These are timeshare rentals so you don't get full housekeeping daily like at a hotel. However, we had cleaning staff come 'tidy' our villa and swap out used towels on a daily basis. We had a minor medical issue while at the pool one afternoon and the staff at the front desk and the Loss Prevention dept were very helpful and concerned for my son's safety. They even gave us a follow up call to check on him. If you are a family with young children you will NOT be disappointed with staying at Harbour Lake!

Reviews.Title: “Roaches?”
Reviews.Author: JMEL30
Reviews.Content: We stayed February break. Found 2 roaches crawling around, the last one, crawling on the ceiling, was found by my kids who freaked out. Upon returning home and opening my suitcase, what to my surprise do I find but one more little "friend" who ran like lightning and tried to hide under my couch. Fortunately I was able to get it. We called about the pests. They offered to come in when we were out and either put boron powder or some sort of spray but they couldn't guarantee residue flying around. Not what I want my kids to breath in. While we were there they decided to power wash the halls. It was not only loud BUT the water leaked under our door and we had to put towels down to prevent it flooding into our room. Our toilets both got clogged during our stay not by our doing. They need better cookware in the cupboards, Nothing non-stick. During our stay my son had an accident at the pool and got a cut under his chin on the ledge. He had to go and get the gash glued at a local hospital. Next day they called and asked if we needed anything. What that meant was did I need "bandaids" in the words of the caller, but didn't seem overly concerned about the accident nor did anyone call to get any facts. The room was nice (minus the roaches and the incredibly loud bathroom fan that was stupidly connected to the light so unless you wanted to be in dim light in the bathroom you had to put on the main light with the super noisy fan) the people were nice, the gym (no free weights only machines but lots of treadmills) and pool were okay, the pool bar was good (the guys who worked there were very nice) and there was decent stuff to do and my kids had fun but I would never stay here again. Don't bother with your "free gift" that you have to pick up at the concierge desk (right behind you) after you check in. It's just flyers for local places, a coupon for free mini-golf, a "free" family photo (where they try to sell you a whole package to "remember your vacation") and the usual spiel/hard sell to get you to take a timeshare tour ("We only have a few spots left so sign up right away!") Oddly enough, most places offer you Disney tickets to waste your vacation on their sales tour, these guys offered one $75 Disney gift card. Try as we might, we couldn't finagle tickets out of them, so no tour for us. We have Disney annual passes but the family we stayed with doesn't so we offered for us to go with them if they gave them Disney passes. No luck. I say odd because you have people at 7-11's offering Disney passes for time share tours down on Irlo Bronson. If you plan to do Disney there are better choices as far as location. It was a 12-15 minute drive and no bus service.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: DSJLH
Reviews.Content: My family and I just finishing up our vacation at the Marriott Harbour Lake and I must say, we were a bit disappointed. Based upon the excellent reviews this place received, we expected something different. We have vacationed in the Orlando area for the past four years staying at various Marriott or Sheraton properties. This one just doesn't compare. What we found disappointing with this resort was the lack of an site grocery/convenience store and the lack of places to get a good bite to eat or an iced coffee. There was only one restaurant and it happened to only have outdoor seating. The food was mediocre at best. The rooms were a little "dated" compared to other resorts. There was no maid service/towel exchange. I just washed my towels my self. Also, two days before we were leaving, my husband found a cockroach in our room. We called the front desk to report the finding and they said that someone would call us to come and treat the room, but there was never any follow up and no one contacted us. What we did like about the resort was the pool areas which kept our 3 year old very entertained. However, I think he would have been entertained at any hotel with a pool. We did have a nice vacation, but we will not be returning to Harbour Lake when we return to Orlando next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Sun in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: cbhnewhampshire
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff, beautiful room (2965) and fantastic stuff for kids to do! From the pools, to the arcade it was so much fun. Concierge helped many times with great dining out choices and for Pizza delivery, we took a shine to Flippers and their flatbread pizza. Upscale choice was Vitos Chophouse, we did take out and it was a 10 all the way! Would stay here again over the Grande Vista. Which is nice, but just too spread out and rooms are a bit stodgy in decor. You will not be disappointed here.

Reviews.Title: “Best family vacation we've ever taken.”
Reviews.Author: pags27
Reviews.Content: We have a 6, 4, and 1 year old and this is the second time we've stayed at Marriott Harbour Lake. The pools were phenomenal for the kids, it was tough to get them out for lunch or dinner! The hotel is 10 minutes to Disney, so we alternated every other day with parks and pool at the hotel. The kids participated in several hotel-run activities during the week, the staff was very, very friendly and helpful. We will most definitely be staying again at Harbour Lake when we get back to Orlando!! Highly recommend for families with young children!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value.”
Reviews.Author: MN7674
Reviews.Content: We stayed feb 24 for a week. First we were placed in building 15 right next to the highway. The room was old and dated plus the highway noise was loud inside with the doors closed. We had requested building 13 or 28 and a renovated room but were told when we arrived that those were for the owners when the resort is full. We arrIved late at night and they didn't have anything else available so we stayed the night and asked to be moved in the morning. The manager was very pleasant and moved us to a top floor in building 12. It was 200% nicer and quieter than where we were. It really made our trip. Building 12 is connected to 13 and right around the corner from the pool. I really think the only building I would avoid would be 15 and probably 14 too. The 2 bedroom was huge, had everything we needed. The resort is very well kept. Close to hwy 4 and a quick trip to Disney. Well worth the $$ saved compared to staying on Disney in a 2 bedroom for $700/night

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: pkeller714
Reviews.Content: This was a great location for our family to have fun, relax and feel safe. The rooms were extremely clean and had all the pots,pans, dishes, glassware and washer dryer to make life easy. There was also daily activities for kids like karaoke night, italian night, magician, etc to keep them happy and all in one place. Seaworld literally 5 minutes, WDW was about 12 minutes. Just great

Reviews.Title: “nice but not excelent”
Reviews.Author: Rushrushrush
Reviews.Content: the air condition didnt worked for 4 day. was too hot. it tooked some times till they fixed

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family place”
Reviews.Author: seaandy334
Reviews.Content: Daily organized activities for the kids all day long with prizes and tokens, various areas of the pools for all ages of kids as well as jacuzzis for the adults, a fantastic water slide, miniature golf course, superb rooms, very nice staff.....what more can you want. The only place that we have returned to with our 2 boys ages 7 and 9. Easy location to access. Get a 1 bedroom and the kids have their own TV in the living room. Food is surprisingly good if you don't want to cook in your kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of fun!”
Reviews.Author: Keenun B
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 2 or 3 times. We have always enjoyed the night time activities like Karaoke and we find that the staff is friendly and fun. we like sitting in the chairs down by the water and just walking around looking at the ducks. The putt putt course is pretty cool and the little kids seemed to like the Pirate area. My 8 year old loves the bigger water slide. I do like that there are 2 large pool areas. The food (by the pool) is not bad and the rooms are very spacious! They have lots of planned activities for the kids and that's always helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: locksofcurls
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. Our suite was huge and beautifully decorated! We traveled with our two kids in their early 20's and there was enough room for all of us to be comfortable and not feel like we had no space. The pool area was clean and had the most charming pool staff! The only surprising part was that the elevator area looked tired and needed some paint and polishing. The programming was great, but more geared to people with young families. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for families. But very pushy timeshare representatives that will annoy you.”
Reviews.Author: YClement
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my family feb 9-18th. We found our room to be small but comfortable. A negative I can say is they were doing construction on the bridge for the entrance so it did not look very nice from the outside. Otherwise the hotel is very nice. Perfect for kids.my children loved the pool and the pirate ship.The staff was very nice. One thing I would say that upset me was I found the people in the lobby that sell the tickets for the park extremely pushy. They called many times wanting us to go to a timeshare presentation. On our first day they called four times.We went because they gave us 75 dollars off the park admittance but instead of a hour and a half it turned out to be over two and a half hours. Not worth it at all.i found that to be very annoying. We found them to be very rude and pushy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for kids”
Reviews.Author: Jamie N
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel Jan 29-Feb 5. The pool areas are a lot of fun. The staff was friendly and helpful. My only complaint would be the maid service. We are accustom to timeshare stays where you get your one cleaning for your week stay, but can exchange your towels. My husband approached a maid with our dirty towels to exchange them, and she guarded her cart and pushed it away. We then found out that the timeshare charges to exchange your towels. We have been exchanging our timeshare for 11 years through II and never came across this before. So just be aware this timeshare charges for towel exchange and if you wanted the any maid service be ready to pay for that also. Honestly the rest of the experience was great, I just get irritated when places try and nickel and dime you.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not the best”
Reviews.Author: ld5472
Reviews.Content: Over the past 5 years I have stayed at 4 of the Marriott Vacation Resorts in Orlando. Although this one was good, it's not the best. We stayed here fo more than a week and had another family joing us part way through. The first few nights we checked into a beautiful, new one bedroom lockoff which was clean and updated. When the other family arrived we moved into a two bedroom across the resort. This unit was far from the first. It was older, outdated and not so pretty, but it was spacious and clean and nothing to complain about. We did have some trouble with the door locking on our 2nd unit, but maitnance was helpful. The resort isn't huge, so really either place we stayed was cose enough to the pools and amenities. The grounds were pretty, but not beautiful like other marriott resorts. There was not a ton of landscaping and our unit being on the end had a clear view of the highway. So to this point I was satisfied, but not exctatic. So although I wasn't overly impressed with the resort itself I have to say that the ammenities were amazing. If you have kids this is the place to go. So many activities for the kids, everyday. Playground, activity room and fun fun pool areas. The pools were so entertaining with the pirate ships, waterslides and water spray area. Each week there was an itinerary with ample orginized activities for the kids to do. I'm telling you we could have skiped Disney all together and my kids would have been more than happy. I wasn't a huge fan of the bar/take out eatiery, but it's timeshare and most times that's what you get. The fact that this resort was so geared toward kids meant 2 things to me...1) if you have kids it's worth giving up some of the luxuries you may find at other resorts for the amount of stuff to entertain the kids...2) If you don't have kids keep looking because this is certainly a family friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for Families”
Reviews.Author: VEGO
Reviews.Content: First the Pros: This is a fantastic location for families. The amenities for kids are wonderful! The location is near everything, and the grounds are lovely. It is an aesthetically pleasing vacation time share. The Cons: We are a "senior couple" looking for a quiet spot to read a book near the pool...not to be found (see above). The apartment was spacious, the walls thin to the apartment next door with kids up early in the morning. The furniture is "flash finished" and beginning to show wear. The layout was set so the bath could be shared by those sleeping on the sofa in the living room as well as by those in the bedroom. The quickest route to the bedroom was through the bathroom! The ultimate "turn off" was the charge of twenty cents a minute to use the computer and printer with a minimum of five minutes!!! Come on that's chintzy!!! (There was wifi in the apartment, which I used, but needed a printer and had to pay.) Have I stayed at more luxurious time shares? YES! Would this be just fine for a family, YES!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the spacious rooms and the pools - family friendly yet relaxing for those travelling without children”
Reviews.Author: ecrescia
Reviews.Content: I was there with my 3 kids, 2 of my sisters and 2 nieces. This hotel was like a home to us, we had a 2 bedroom suite, with 2 very spacious rooms, huge living room and fully equipped kitchen. Everything is like you see in the hotel photos or better. The swimming pools are beautiful, and there is plenty of room for the kids to play. Location was great to go to the parks. Free parking right outside our room building. Once you check in and get your room key, you are very independent and don't really feel like staying in a hotel. Home away from home / vacation rental experience.

Reviews.Title: “Above my expectations! Kid Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: RDUHM
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here with our two kids for 5 days to just get away. The hotel and the staff are wonderful. Our kids age 3 and 5 loved the pools here on property. They have a staff here that you can leave your kids with. They absolutely loved it. I want to thank Staci for taking such great care of our kids, they had a ball. She had a fun spirit and our kids had a new best friend before they left. Thank you Marriott Harbour Lake!

Reviews.Title: “Nice facilities, but recession has hit this property”
Reviews.Author: trieditout
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this facility about 3 years ago. We revisited this property in January, 2012. The pools and rooms are still in good shape. Not so many activities were available for kids. Staff at front desk are not as helpful as they were in the past. If you have a Pirate Sundae cup, your kids will no longer get free refills. Instead your kid may opt to trade it in for one free Sundae. Activities staff are still very kid friendly. Not as many activities are available each day for young kids. Some of the staff at the front desk do not speak English very well and don't know how to answer basic questions.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful pools with good location.”
Reviews.Author: HartleyIA
Reviews.Content: This is a good location to reach all the parks. It is located very near Sea World and is an easy drive with close interstate access to the other parks. We stayed in the 2 bed 2 bath with 3 adults and 2 children. The condo has PLENTY of room, a large common area and has a nice sized patio. One bedroom has a king the other two full sized beds and a pullout bed in sofa. The unit was very clean with a few minor flaws from wear and tear. (chipped paint on bath faucet, drawers that didn't pull even) but nothing major. The unit includes a washer/dryer and a couple of starter boxes of detergent, dishwasher detergent, dish soap and bath amenities. If you are traveling with children they are going to LOVE the pool area. A pirate ship with mini slides for small kids and a larger slide for the big kids. There is also a water fort that is great fun. The water was heated. There are some good sized hot tub too for the adults. The grounds are very well kept and there were activities if you were interested. The staff was friendly and helpful with any request we had. My only complaint was there was no mini store on site to get that forgotten gallon milk or loaf bread without having to leave the resort. There is a grocery a couple of miles away. Overall this is great resort for families and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Good Location & Dependable Quality”
Reviews.Author: pick6king
Reviews.Content: This review will be fairly short, as my comments are in line with consensus. This is a great hotel. The location is terrific for those visiting the theme parks. The property and the resorts are clean. The property is secure. We really didn't spend much time in the room or making use of the resort's facilities and features. I like these highly-reviewed Orlando Marriott hotels because I can book them without any further legwork and know what we're getting. Unless you're looking for something very specific, you should not be disappointed by this hotel and you should not have to do much due diligence before making your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Best family resort period!”
Reviews.Author: ChristineC55
Reviews.Content: WOW is all I could say when I walked in the door to our hotel room here! This place was perfect for my husband and I and our 3 children! It was clean, had an open floor plan, modern decor, and a great view of the lake! We used our my father-in-laws time share discount which I was told meant we did not have room service, but that was not a problem. It was kind of nice not having to stuff our valuables in a safe everyday. Room service was an additional charge but we were given free laundry detergent and extra towels so we were fine. There is a washer and dryer (very small ones but still) right in the apartment! When you walk in you are in the kitchen, which can see into the living room. To the right there was a bathroom which led to the kid's bedroom (two full sized beds) and if you went straight passed the living room, to the right of the balcony was the master bedroom, which also had a nice bathroom and VERY awesome shower. The kids LOVED the pools, especially the one with the giant water slide. There was a lot to do right at the resort so we actually spent two days just hanging out there. There is an activity list in your room of the events for the day (ice cream socials, carribbean music at the pool, soccer tournaments, etc). We were going to play the mini golf too but never got around to it. The other 4 days we spent at Disney and Seaworld, which are very close by. Seaworld is so close that you can't really go anywhere without driving past it! I have been to Disney at least 6 or 7 times in my life and this is definitely the best place I have ever stayed. It was well worth the price. I don't know if I'll ever stay anywhere else now! We will definitely be back!! Thank you Marriott Harbour Lake!!!

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation Summer 2010”
Reviews.Author: teddy1971
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harbour Lake for our annual family vacation. I must say that of the many places that we've stayed with our family over the years this is definitely one of the best. What makes this place so great is that one can just stay at the resort and have plenty to do. That is really saying a lot especially with it being in the heart of Orlando. I highly recommend this resort for family getaways. Even though I've had my fill of Disney (3 Times in 3 Years) I would not mind coming to Orlando just to stay at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place close to the "Parks"”
Reviews.Author: DenverDogDoctor
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here during the first week of January, 2012. We had a wonderful time even though for the first two days it was the coldest Orlando had been in 3 years. Yes it did get below freezing at night. My only real complaint is the furnace for the villa was almost non-existant and we had to turn the oven on to warm up the place. By the end of our stay it was in the 80's and the air conditioner worked very well. The location is nice because it is right next to Sea world and only 20 minutes to either Universal Studios, Disney World, Wal-mart or the Orlando airport. The lake in the complex does have a lot of Largemouth bass in it, and if you want to catch them use the crawlers that are sold at the boat house. They also have fishing poles you can rent for $10 a day. I went to Wal-Mart and purchased an OK fishing pole with reel and line for $12 total. There is a great work out room with good equipment, the kids loved the pools, the beds were amazing, the staff was wonderful, the place is clean and quiet. I would recommend calling the resort directly when picking a room. The more recently renovated buildings are considerably nicer. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but high level chlorine in the pool”
Reviews.Author: JHD_1999
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, amazing people at front desk, they try to help me with my reservation always polite even with my insistence. Safety, clean place, truly recomended Stayed in June 2011 with in June 2011 my wife and kids (14,11 and 3) for two weeks. They loved the area, the things to do, great pool but chlorine in the pool was too much, they must fixed this to be perfect. Next time at Orlando, definitely considered this hotel as a first option.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family”
Reviews.Author: Ken2fortax
Reviews.Content: Only one night but had great time. Have stayed there in past. great plaxe

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of Space in Orlando at a very nice place”
Reviews.Author: Chapsbaby
Reviews.Content: Had the opportunity to nab a great deal on a Marriott 1 bed/bath villa (approx. 900 square feet) in Orlando at the Marriott Harbour Lake complex during the first week of December. Since the first week of December is one of the slower vacation times during the year in Orlando, we were able to get this villa for $ 116 per night (plus tax) -which we thought was a terrific deal considering a week or so later on the calendar, this size villa would easily cost $ 300+ per night. We spent six nights here and thought it a great place all around. Found the villa to have plenty of room, very clean, everything in working order and the location terrific. Our villa overlooked a pond then onto a road, but the complex was far enough back, as well as the road didn't get that busy that we didn't experience any road noise. We found that we were a short drive from all the main attractions in Orlando from all the Disney parks, to Universal to Gaylord (where we went to the Shrek ICE attraction) and Seaworld which was just up the road from the complex. The complex was also close to restaurants and both Walgreens and CVS were a block or two down the road along with a Publix. We found the villa and its furnishing to be recently updated so everything looked fresh. This was the second time that we stayed in a Marriott Vacation Club complex in the Orlando area with the first time being back in 2008 when we stayed in at the Marriott Grande Lakes - which was nice too - but we found that we preferred the location and layout of the Harbour Lake complex better. As for Harbour Lake's other features. My husband did have the opportunity to work out one morning in the fitness center which is said was good but we didn't have the time to check out all the other features the complex had to offer. Overall we felt we couldn't have gone wrong staying here, especially since the price was so good and for what we would have paid for a regular hotel room, we had a ton more space that even had a washer and dryer. Definitely will keep this place on our radar when we return to Orlando in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel/condo ever stayed at with 2 kids under 6 years old...and I'm from Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Mommy-Traveler-1967
Reviews.Content: First off even after reading the reviews I didn't know the 2 bed/2 bath have stackable washer and dryer..plus 2 single boxes of Tide. I wouldn't have packed so much!! Being from O-town myself I knew that the weather could be shorts one day and a parka the next or raining. We went down a couple days early before our stay on Walt Disney property to see friends and my old college. I actually thought this place was better for our 4 & 6 year old than the Grand Floridian. The pool was the most amazing thing. The pirate ship in the pool was great. Within the same fence (by the way you have to be close to 5 feet to open the fence..which is great!) there is the pool, bar (so nice for mommy and daddy), 2 hot-tubs, room of arcade games, and probably other stuff I didn't see. The staff organized Angry Water Ballons which had a sling shot even kids as young as 2 or 3 were participating in. Yes like angry birds. Even us adults got a shot. Next door from the pool is another pool that has a AMAZING water play area, 0.0 pool entrance to about 5 feet where a water slide is located. This area has the bar outside of the fence line, hottub, grilling area with tables, little kiddie non water play area, goofie golf, basket ball, tennis and a HUGE bonfire pit. I am going to enclose pics too. We stayed on my Marriott points for 3 nights and I can say we had a more relaxing time there..Also there is a CVS and Ihop close by (not walking distance though). The entire Marriott is enclosed and you have to go through a guarded person with your car to get in. So I felt safer being so close to I drive and Sand Lake which has a lot of sketchiness to it. We could see Sea World sign from across the parking lot. The staff was very nice too!

Reviews.Title: “Great family choice for Wdw stay”
Reviews.Author: Andoverminnie
Reviews.Content: Even though parks were packed this place stayed quiet. Updated rooms are nice. No problems w our stay at all. Really of the mariotts here it's the best for the 4-7yo kids we have w nice pool options, game room, putt putt, pool table, foosball etc.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Kid Friendly Place”
Reviews.Author: peonyrose
Reviews.Content: Harbour Lake is another one of Marriott's success stories in the Orlando area. By using condos families are able to eat in some and enjoy larger spaces than just a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, but found a cockroach”
Reviews.Author: Gogojanet
Reviews.Content: Hello, My husband and two young children made our third visit to this Marriott condo in 3 years on Nov 28- Dec 9, 2911. Our children love the pirate ship, splash park, and pirate plunge slide. We had to negotiate with them so they would agree to leave the property and go to Disney World (yes, it is that good!). The grounds, pools, and hot tubs are very well-maintained. The condo was a large 2 bedroom in building 12 which has been recently renovated. The unit was large, but corners had been cut in the updating and cleaning. The door to the fridge was installed on the wrong side so we had to walk around the fridge to open it, and then had to close it to get access to the kitchen. The dishwasher door when opened in front of the sink, so you had to lean over toprove dished from sink to dishwasher. These are minor issues, but indicative of the level of care and thought taken. The carpeted floors while tidy looking, were filthy and in desparate need of a thorough carpet cleaning. After removing our shoes, our socks became stained from the dirt with just walking around during the 2ish hours between dinner and bedtime. Knowing how dirty the floor was, made me cringe about the non-washable bedding and large pillows. I immediately put them up pn a shelf to minimize our contct with them.The washer and dryer worked well, but are small and so we used them daily. The biggest issue was that after almost a week, I found a huge cockroach near the front door. I know bugs are part of nature, and Florida has a warm climate, but I am not a bug person. In fact, I have considerable anxiety over bugs. We had not had any problem in our previous visits, and so I was shocked. You may think, "so what, it was only a bug". However, seeing a 2+ inch cockroach scurry across your condo floor is never a good thing. I managed to catch the in a glass container. My spouse and I then checked online and confirmed that it was in fact a cockroach. I then called the front desk, and while apologetic, they certainly were not alarmed. It turns out that cockroaches, ants, etc are a typical part of life in Florida, and in the condos. The condo units are located in a large wooded/ park like area and so the staff said it was a common challenge. They have the areas sprayed/treated every three months to minimize the problem. We had 4 more days to our visit, and the best they could offer was to move us to higher floor. We moved from 2nd floor of building 12 to the 6th floor in building 13. The manager at the front desk speculated that the lack of a door sweeper, a flexible rubber strip that gets attached to the bottom of doors to prevent light, air, and bugs from entering, was the reson for the cockraoch getting into our unit on the 2nd floor. We had no problems with bugs on the 6th floor, but I was not able to relax and was constantly checking for more bugs. Given the one large cockroach, I would not return to the property in the future and would not recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Orlando with a smile”
Reviews.Author: RaysOpinion
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Harbour Lake in Orlando (rm #1032, 2 bdrm). I traveled with my wife and 3 children, 4 yr old twins and 10. This place was awesome!! The room, pools and grounds were very clean and lots of things to do with the kids. Location is great to Seaworld and Disney and the Marriott Cypress is directly across the street with a golf course. Anything we needed or asked for was addressed within minutes. I can't say enough about the staff, especially Jay and Danny. The staff remembered our names and engaged us in conversation (even the kids) instead of just walking right by us. If u want to go somewhere and truly relax this is the place. My wife and I are very picky and have high expectations when we choose a place. I don't give out high praises very often but they earned it here. We are time share owners and there was no pressure or nagging to attend another presentation.

Reviews.Title: “Best in area”
Reviews.Author: JohakaAs
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at likki tikki, orange lake , summer bay, and vistana, harbor lake is by far the cleanest , nicest, most fun place to stay outside of disney

Reviews.Title: “Great pool and very clean”
Reviews.Author: visitwisconsin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Marriott's Harbour Lake in October with my family. The pools were very nice. My five year old loved the pirate ship pool/play area. We stayed in a 2-bedroom condo and had tons of room with a great view of the pool and lake. It is very handy to both WDW and Universal. We all wished we had more time to rest and play at Harbour Lake. All the staff members were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “a must for families”
Reviews.Author: Adam S
Reviews.Content: Having 3 boys 7,5,3 a great place to keep them busy. 2 pools one with a pirate ship small slide and a full size water slide, kids events to earn tokens to get prizes. Staff met the Marriot standards, professional friendly and helpful. Close to all parks, food and shopping. We needed to extend our stay and they were able to keep us in the same unit with any hassel. An absolute must for families!

Reviews.Title: “Family Fun in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: massmom5966
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at Marriott's Harbour Lake because of access to the parks, great fun pool area and spacious accomodations beyond the typical hotel room. Glad we did. We stayed a few years ago at Marriott Grande Vista which was fine, but less kid-centric. Harbour Lake has two pools, each filled with fun splah pad, big water buckets and a great pool slide that was even fun for adults. Pool water was a nice pleasant warm temp. There is also a mini golf course that is beyond what you typically find at a resort, very much on par (no pun intended) with typcial mini golf courses along roads in resort communities. Very clean, typically comfortable Marriott beds and trendy decor. Starbucks brewed on property (although doesn't open until 8:30am?) Scavenger hunts, terrific firepit, basketball court, fooseball, pingpong all outside under a pergola. Happy to recommend and we will definitely stay here again. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler54
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this facility. I concur with all of the wonderful comments about the staff & facility, so I won't repeat them, but add some other comments. Cost - This is our third trip to the Orlando area in the 10 years. The first two times were at a Disney property; the Yacht club. I think it is important to experience Disney World from a property on Disney site – Once! That being said, I think I spent more money staying at the Yacht club for a week then our 10-day trip to Italy! The cost of the hotel plus food, plus sacks, plus + $$$ - Expensive! Harbour Lake, like all Marriott Vacation properties, are large and come with a full kitchen, internet & plenty of room. For this trip we traded a week we have at another location for Harbour Lake so it's almost like it was free! (Almost free, until I get the $1,000 maintenance bill for my own unit realizing that it's not so free.) Our two boys are older and my wife and I are not that interested in visiting the various parks again so Marriott's Harbour Lake was perfect. Each morning I dropped our boys off at the various parks. (They all have convenient drop off areas.) My wife & I enjoyed the hotel then returned to pick up the boys, sometimes staying at Downtown Disney or Universal City Walk for dinner or a movie and sometimes heading back to the hotel. It was all very nice & relaxing. The facility is approximately half way between Universal & Disney. There are nearby stores including Wal-Mart super stores and Costco for food & drink. Location - All of the rooms are very nice. As with all of the Marriott Vacation properties, some locations are better than others. I prefer a higher room that offers more openness. Building 12 & 13 & 14 offer the best lake views, which is my favorite. Building 15 also has a nice lake view but is close to the very busy & noisy Hwy 4. Frankly, I would not fuss over the room location too much. They are all nice and unless you plan to hole up in your room the entire time, location is not that critical. My favorite location to hang out on the dock, on the lake during sunset - Fantastic! You will enjoy Marriott's Harbour Lake.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: sarah f
Reviews.Content: my family and i stayed here for a getaway. All I can say is great great great. lots to do for the kids and adults in our party. Would highly recommend a+++++++++

Reviews.Title: “Harbour Lake never dissapoints!!”
Reviews.Author: GBC11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harbour Lake the first week of November. This was our 3rd time staying here and once again we loved it! Harbour Lake has so much to offer families that in fact our kids wanted to stay at the Resort instead of going to any of the Parks including Disney. The activities they have all day long for the kids are great and the activity staff are great to the kids. The Resort is very clean and the rooms are large and most have been renovated. The staff are all so friendly and very helpful and will go out of their way to assist. There is so much to do at this Resort that you do not need to go anywhere else but if you want to Disney is only 10 minutes away, Seaworld 5 minutes and Cocoa Beach 45 minutes. We have already booked for next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great Marriott Spot in Orlando - Just a Couple of Notes”
Reviews.Author: AddictedToTravel1964
Reviews.Content: I'm a big Marriott fan, and we stay in Marriott's whenever possible. This is a very nice property in the heart of Orlando. It's unique primarily because of the two pool areas with a variety of activities associated with them (kiddie pool, water slide, fountains, etc.), bball court, mini-golf and a nice open grassy area for any outdoor activities. It also has a couple of bar/snack bar areas for easy access, and the main eating area also serves a good menu as well as Starbucks coffee. In typical Marriott fashion, the staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are very clean and comfortable, and the location is nice in that it's 2 minutes from Sea World and only 10 mins max to the other parks. We stayed in a 2 bedroom unit, which is a lot of space for a family of 4. Here's a few details about the property that you might not get elsewhere. As I always say in these reviews, these are really just designed to inform you as a reader, not meant as a complaint. For some, these details will matter a lot, while for others they may not matter much. 1. The Starbucks place opens at 7:30am. This seems late to me for those of us who get up early. 2. The hotel is not too far from Highway 4, and while the noise isn't much of an issue at all, it is very visible from the property. If being near a highway in full view matters to you, maybe ask for a room as far back as possible (keeping in mind that none of the rooms are too close to the highway at all....just visible and noticeable as part of your view). 3. Oddly, some of the sorrounding grounds on this property wasn't landscaped when we were there in Nov of 2011. Not a huge deal to be sure, but very surprising for a Marriott Property. There were a few areas that were just open dirt areas just off parking lots, etc., which seemed out of place. It made me feel like they just dropped the resort down on the open land and decided not to landscape the entire area. To be fair, they may be planning to complete this, or maybe they don't own the land and have no control (if this is the case I'd at least plant trees to hide it). 4. I found it interesting, and yes a little bit strange, that all of the buildings on this property only had one entrance (rather than a front and back entrance, or side entrance too). I understand this isn't necessarily unique, but it did seem very odd to have to come out of a building in what is considered the front, only to have to then walk all the way around the building to get to the back (where the pool area is for example, and is really the front area). I imagine this isn't a problem in all buildings, but at least in building #28 where we stayed it was notable. It's possible that they opted not to include a second way out so as to provide more room space in the building, but I think it was a mistake not to make it easier to get in/out more conveniently.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: optimist333
Reviews.Content: We do not own timeshares but instead booked through the hotel website. We were doing our first trip to Disney. Plenty of things to do on-site for my 2 young kids - kiddie pools (the one that shoots water is not usable as the water is cold), mini golf ($25 for unlimited play entire stay), board games that you can check out from the front desk. We got a 2-bedroom villa for the 4 of us; it was huge. No need to bring ANY kitchen supplies as they provide everything that you need to cook (even the Tupperware for leftovers) and clean up (lots of automatic dish detergent packets as well as a small container of hand detergent and a scrubby sponge). They also provided 2 single-use packets of Tide for laundry. They do provide shampoo and soap but no conditioner. (Since I do most of the packing I really focus on what's provided by the hotel and what's not - hopefully this info will save you some packing.) Only odd thing is re: housekeeping, which seems to take out the trash and replenish soap/shampoo but does not seem to vacuum or clean the bathrooms. Would love to return again if I can get a good deal - this place is usually out of our budget.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: carlos e
Reviews.Content: Great value and great stay. Would sty again for the price we got and would recomend. Nice and clean and close to what we wanted to do. Staff was very friedly

Reviews.Title: “Your kidding - right?”
Reviews.Author: Prodance
Reviews.Content: I usually don't disagree with every single reviewer, this is a first, but I just don't see what is so special about this property. It is just another large time share property out of the hundreds in the Orlando area. The rooms are basic cheap decor, nothing special. Each building has a elevator that looks like something from the inner city slums or a dirty service elevator. We first checked into a 1st floor in a 10 yr old building and as we openned the door we were immediately hit with a horrible body odor smell. The carpet was an ugly dark blue that appeared to be very old. I thought maybe the carpet had gotten wet and moldy. We immediately went back to the lobby to change rooms. The front desk person was annoyed with us and at first told us that there were no other rooms available, then put us in a 3 yr old building on the top floor. This room had the exact same horrible body odor smell. The room looked exactly the same as the older one, the dark blue rug looked just as old. Other than the smell everything was clean and seemed adequate and we decided to open the balcony and all the windows to air the place out. No one ever called us to ask if we were happy with the new room. We had to leave the balcony doors open the entire week even when we were out. Did not care for the cheap decor or furniture and have stayed in nicer timeshares in the Orlando area in the past. The mass construction buildings were basic just like a cheap condo complex. I can see how little kids would love the pirate ship pool but for anyone without small children there is really nothing special here. The weather was cold early November and the place was very slow when we were there. Did not use the pool. They do not have any type of store on site which is surprising. We ate once at the outdoor bar when we arrived - typical fast food items. We received a call before our trip asking us to book a timeshare presentation. We declined and they never bothered us about it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family to vacstion”
Reviews.Author: Lkubat
Reviews.Content: Stayed in aug had the time of our lives there .the pools where awsome the staff very pleasent the food was good the planned activities where really nice and everything was very clean

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely would go back again!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBuggGirl
Reviews.Content: After deciding to trade our timeshare through Interval so we could take the kids to Disney World I checked out Trip Advisor and picked Harbour Lake. We were not disappointed!! The only negative points that we found were that there was no on-site convenience store and the proximity to Disney. It would be nice to be able to pick up milk nearby if you run out without having to drive 15 minutes. And of course you can't beat the on-site Disney accommodations but when it is important to hit the park when it opens (much shorter line ups first thing in the morning!) we might choose to stay on site next time because of the approx 30 minutes from our door to the Magic Kingdom (after driving, getting the tram and then the monorail!). Our kids are small so Disney was our only destination but if you are going other places, Harbour Lake is close to Seaworld and International Drive with all of it's attractions.
