Now for the positives (and we found many!). -great pools for the kids - beautiful, newly renovated rooms - clean!! I'm not sure about all of the cleanliness or cockroach complaints! No weekly cleaning (or maybe just a midweek cleaning) is standard for all of the timeshares we have stayed in!). We didn't see a single bug in our unit all week and we found there to be plenty of supplies in our 2 bedroom 2 bathroom unit with 4 adults and 2 kids. The only thing we ran out of was laundry soap and the housekeeper was more than happy to give me more when I asked her. This place was super clean and in great shape I thought! - our air conditioner stopped working one night. Within 10 minutes of our call a maintenance person was there and after replacing the thermostat and a few other things he had it up and running again (at 11pm I think that is great service!) - tons of activities (organized activities plus the mini golf, billiards, ping pong, basketball, park, we didn't even use our entire Disney tickets because the kids were so happy playing at the resort!) - we didn't find the poor "restaurant" to be an issue. Part of the reason we went the time share route was so we would have our own kitchen and could cook our own healthy food. We didn't eat at the restaurant once all week. Plus you are so close to so many great dining options on international drive. - concierge was wonderful! So helpful!! Being timeshare owners they asked us to go to their owner presentation. If the 8 am one wasn't booked we probably would have went for the $100 off our Disney tickets but when it was booked up and we said "no thanks" we weren't asked again. Overall this place deserves a 5/5 for what it is. It is a timeshare with no daily cleaning! It's a great place to go with kids. If we weren't taking the kids I probably wouldn't choose Harbour Lake... But then again, I probably wouldn't be going to Orlando either!

Reviews.Title: “Fun, fun, fun...with a few issues”
Reviews.Author: garci1r
Reviews.Content: First the negatives. If these are an absolute deal-breaker then don't go on. We had a slight bug issue. We had a gap under our front door allowing tiny bugs in. They didn't bite us, they weren't everywhere, but we saw a couple crawling around. Also, no on-site convenience store. We had to run to the local grocery store for bread...not a big deal, but I'm guessing they could make money on a few convenience items. Now the positives. Awesome, pirate-themed pools for kids. The best hotel pools I've been to in mildly extensive travels. They almost didn't want to leave the hotel, but Disney World pulled them away. Other fun amenities included a large fire pit, onsite gas grills, sport courts with basketball hoops, neat putt-putt golf, Starbucks, nice changing rooms by the pool, a very nice Boardwalk, quiet and safe location, decent restaurant/grille near the pools, NFL Sunday Ticket with 4 tv's by the pool (my Lions were playing), full schedule of events by the pool, and good service. Despite the bugs, I'd consider staying here again...which is just as shocking to write as it probably is to read. In my opinion the bugs can be taken care of, everythign else is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “owners first visit”
Reviews.Author: lufcgirl
Reviews.Content: We have owned here from 2009 and had our first visit from 23rd September- 7th October 2011, We emailed and asked for a newly renovated villa. We were allocated what we had requested, in building 13, a two bed , two bath unit. The new decor is lovely with updated appliances. The check in was quick and easy with friendly staff. Building 13 is just above the pirate ship pool , we were on the fourth floor and found this convienant for the resort and parking etc.The villla is spacious and has every thing you need with washer, dryer and cooking utensils. We were two adults and four year old daughter , we had plenty of room, with lots of storage facilities. As owners we only had housekeeping after we had been there a week but this was no problem as the villa had plenty of bin bags and dishwasher tablets provided. there was a carpet sweeper and brush and pan to wipe up any spills. We could not find fault with anything at the resort. The pirate ship pool and and pirates plunge pool are super and with daily activities for our 4 year old you could easily spend your vacation at the resort without going to disney. We had a 7 day Disney park ticket but actualy only went six of the days as our daughter was quite happy to spend her time at the pools etc. The resort is very convienant to Disney approx 15 mins and close to Interstate and airport . We found a Wallmart close by and there is a CVS five mins away.Harbour Lake is a fantastic resort for familys, and we are looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: jdvmd
Reviews.Content: Our kids wanted to go to Harry Potter World so we did an Interval World exchange for this property. We received an updated two-bedroom, two-bath unit on the first floor. It was just steps from our rental car. At first, I thought it would be better to be on a higher floor but later realized this was the perfect set up. This resort is an excellent spot for families. The units are large, clean and well equipped. There was a stackable washer and dryer in the unit. The kitchen had stainless steel appliances. Beginning supplies of trash bags, laundry and dish detergent, soaps, shampoos etc. all supplied. Free wifi. Slept very well during our week here. Really a gorgeous condo -- I believe the square footage was 1,200-square feet. The check-in process was quick and we were never asked to attend a timeshare presentation. I also loved the fact that there were all kinds of activities going on during the week. We were given a schedule ahead of time so we could plan. Also, there was an automated call (never rang to intrude upon your vacation time but only a flashing message light) to tell you about the weather forecast for the next day as well as any special activities. We roasted smores around the firepit with a guitarist playing; also fished with cane poles, swam, laid out, never did get to play mini golf because I thought it was $25 a person for the week but that turned out to be wrong -- it was $25 for the whole week for UP TO FOUR PEOPLE in a unit! The pools, water park and slides were all in great working order. You never saw trash laying around. Very well kept property. We also grilled out several nights though some of the starters had gone out on the grills. They did supply firestarters though. There was Hawaiian night with a luau and band, Italian night, wine and cheese parties, a great sport court (two separate), ping pong and billiards tables. Also, the resort felt very secure. The beds were extremely comfortable; the bathrooms spacious. There were nine of us ranging from 9 months to 66 years and we all had a wonderful time. While most of the day was spent in disneyworld, if we had to do it over again, we would have spent more time at the wonderful pool at the resort. The kids LOVED it. There was a pirate ship a splash pad and a big slide. The entertainment especially the magician was great fun. The on-site restaurant had a limited menu but it was fine for our purposes. The staff was very helpful. I would recommend this resort to families. So much fun!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place if you have kids!!”
Reviews.Author: bubliegrl
Reviews.Content: We stay at a lot of Marriott timeshares and Harbour Lake was awesome for our kids who love the water and pools. We have never really utilized any of the activities that Marriott provides but during this trip we did and the kids loved them! We played a game of flag football one night with several families and played football trivia one night. Great location right by Sea World. We also previously stayed at Grande Vista but I think this was a bigger hit with our kids. They are doing some remodeling which is nice but the units are still very nice and well furnished. Recommended heading to Sand Lake rd for great dining...try Big Fin Seafood if you want good seafood... Mondays they offer 16.00 1 1/2 pound Maine lobsters and this is a very nice restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: marebu16
Reviews.Content: We had an effeciency unit in November. I was surprised to find no dressers and no luggage racks, so suitcases were on the floor. Great country lake type furnishings. Pool area were amazing, uncrowded, everything from water park, slides, lap area, 0 entry, baby pools, hot tubs. Great listing of activities and great activity staff. Putt Putt course was a lot of fun. I-trolley stop just outside gate. Concierge on site. We did nto have a resort directory in room and I was confused aout maid service, we received none the week we were there. Safe in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the property”
Reviews.Author: captainhook1974
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 2 years ago with our then 2 year old son. We were checked in promptly. The nice thing I liked was that I said no to the timeshare presentation once and was never bothered again. So many timeshare resorts call every day and bug you till you want to leave. As for the rooms, they were very nice, no mildew which we've found at other big-name properties including Sheratons etc.... The parking was right next to the building, the pool was REALLY nice. That is a big-time winner for us as well. I would stay here again in a second. Actually are looking at trading our timeshare for a week here again in Dec of 2012 we liked it so much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Resort!”
Reviews.Author: jillerjo
Reviews.Content: This resort is perfect if you're traveling with your kids to Orlando. For starters, it's close to everything; 20 minutes from the airport, 20 minutes from Disney World, 5 minutes from Universal, and 1 minute from Sea World. We even traveled to Lego Land and that was only 35 minutes away. The rooms are beautiful and spacious. The pools are great! They entertained our kids for hours. The activities they have planned for the kids and for families are so much fun. You could seriously never leave the resort and still have a great vacation. When we ever come back to Orlando, this is the only place we will stay!

Reviews.Title: “A Welcome Center”
Reviews.Author: morandy
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three days and had the best time! it was clean and very friendly! Would not hesitate staying there again!thank you for the great memories!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bimmie c
Reviews.Content: Graet place to stay and service was excellent,staff very professional and helpful, restaurat dervice great

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Narcg11
Reviews.Content: in July wnt to Orlando Marriott Harbour Hotel spendt 5 nights, rooms are very clean and staff are excellent. Food was very good as we are vegetarian had no problem at all, all the facility was there it was like home to home.

Reviews.Title: “First timer with Marriott”
Reviews.Author: mmj_0882
Reviews.Content: For my daughter's 10th birthday, my husband and I took a trip out to Orlando to take her to Disney World. We spent 7 nights at Marriott Harbour Lake, originally 6 nights but the front desk was very accommodating in extending another night without any hassle. We made several changes to our reservation with Marriott and was originally booked at 2 different locations, one directly across from each other with 3 different hotel rooms. But during check-in, Marriott was able to compile 3 different reservations into one and we stayed in 1-2BR/2B villa for the entire reservation. Customer service was a definite plus, as well as the villa, and its location. This property was close to everything, from Disney World, Universal, Sea World, dining and to shopping. The property also had pools and other outdoor activities but we did not partake in, but will definitely will for the next visit. All in all, we had a great time at this property and with Marriott. Had an exceptional experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Property, Great Location, Would Come Back!”
Reviews.Author: RockyP95
Reviews.Content: I know that this property's rooms are being renovated, so I called ahead and requested that we get one of the 'new' rooms. The staff took care of us, and we did. The room was very nice, and modern. The colors, and comfort was all what you would expect at a Marriott property. We had a 5 day park ticket at Disney, so we actually didn't spend that much time at the resort. However, when we did, the resort was fantastic, especially if you have children. Their pools and hot tubs were all great. The huge playset, the activities center, the lift goes on. Great property! It was rainy 2 of the days we were there, and there were lots of indoor things to do at this property, which was nice so that the kids (and us) didn't go crazy. The proximity to dining and Disney was great, you're literally like 1 exit away from Disney. It's about a 10-15 minute drive to any of the parks, which is about as good as it gets, unless you're staying onsite at the parks. We didn't go to SeaWorld, but, this property was practically accross the street from SeaWorld, so if that's what you're doing, this property would be a good choice. There's no shortage of great properties in Orlando, and they all cater to a different crowd. THIS one caters to the kid friendly/family crowd. TONS to do, the kids will never get bored.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic trip!”
Reviews.Author: missbee_68
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our trip from Orlando. We spent our last 3 nights at Marriott Harbour Lake and it was great.We loved our 2 bedroom villa in building 29 (room 2963). Had a great time at the pools yesterday. It was great having a washer and dryer in the room - didn't have to do a big load of laundry when we got home. The villa was very clean and beautifully decorated. We had 3 adults and 2 preteens - all were very pleased. Service was terrific, housekeeping was great. We would love to return! The only negative thing I can think of is that the fridge was a little loud - not enough to bother us at night though - just enough to make me not want to buy a GE fridge :-)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Week! Teens and Adults Had a Blast!”
Reviews.Author: IowaDisneyMom
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at this property. Our first was 9 years ago when it was called Horizons by Marriott. The property has grown immensely but the service has not been diminished. If anything the service has gotten even better! I am a picky traveler and cannot say one negative thing about this resort. There was something for everyone-from toddler to adults! The organized recreational activities are great. Multiple pools and large water slide. Putt-putt golf on site (18 holes). Take advantage of this! Pay the $25.00 for the week (includes all people in your room)-we didn't even go out to Disney's Winterland/Summerland to play which is always a "to-do" for us. The 18 holes are great. Several hot tubs kept nice and warm! 101 degrees F. I truly cannot say enough about the service we received. I would HIGHLY recommend this property. You cannot beat the location. 10 minutes if that to Sea World. Maybe 20ish to Universal and Disney about 20. Email with any questions. I did request Building 28 and received it. We had a 2 bedroom unit. I will post pictures later or email me if you need them sooner.

Reviews.Title: “we WILL be back!!”
Reviews.Author: Swiss-Sandra1968
Reviews.Content: I chose this property because of the many good reviews and the cool pool pictures! Turns out: all the good reviews are true and the pool even cooler! Everybody is very friendly and helpful, from the guard at the gate to the people at the front desk to housekeeping, everybody has a smile on their face. The two pools, one with a big slide and the other with a pirate ship with slides for the little ones, are nicely heated and, although the property is almost booked at this time, never seem crowded. The rooms are spacious and clean and it is very convenient to have a full fridge and kitchen supplies at hand. The resort is close to all the major attractions and within easy reach of supermarkets and restaurants. And thanks to Camilo from the front desk management we already booked our next stay 2012, he was extremely helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for us”
Reviews.Author: Momlikestravel
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 (kids 7 and 4) had a fabulous time staying at Marriott's Harbour Lake. We did Disney a little non-traditionally by staying off Disney resorts and this Marriott Vacation Club was exactly what we needed. The pool area was amazing for the kids. 2 pools with a pirate ship, play area, big water slide (you had to be 48"), hot tubs. They also have lots of activities for kids - we did water balloons and a magic show. Our hotel room was spacious with 2 bedrooms, living area, dining table and large kitchen. It was also great to have a washer and dryer. It was right around the corner from SeaWorld and Discover Cove and only 10 minutes from Disney. Discovery Cove was awesome (even on a cool day). We also drove to New Smyrna beach and drove on the beach. On the way to New Smyrna beach we went to Zoom Air and did a ropes course through the trees and a zip line. Our boys LOVED it! What a memorable trip!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: MD68
Reviews.Content: 3rd stay (as owners). The place is still looking good and service is probably even better than before. Can't fault either the facilities nor the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: realreviews4you
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, great location (right near Sea World). Well maintained property. Fantastic for kids with kid friendly pools, sports courts and mini-golf. Rooms are large and nicely appointed. Not quite as nice as the Vacation Clubs in singer island and Marco island, but the outdoor facilities are even nicer. I would definitely recommend this hotel to families spending time in the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints and great for kids!”
Reviews.Author: kev99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last week of September 2011 and it was a great experience. We had a 2 bedroom unit on the 4th floor that faced “Horizons Harbour”, one of the two themed kiddy pool/pool areas. The other area is called “Pirate Plunge” and has a pirate ship with water slides off of it. The pool areas were great and a lot of fun for kids and adults alike. They had a nice playground area near the Horizon Harbour area with two basketball courts, pool tables, ping pong tables, large play set with slides, and a fire pit/sitting area. There are also two different areas to get drinks and food by the pools. On to the unit itself; it is spacious for what it is with a nice screened in balcony with table and chairs. The bedrooms and living room had LCD HD TV’s with plenty of satellite channels to choose from. There is a BluRay player in the living room. Typical Marriott vacation club amenities were present in the villa including washer/dryer combo and full kitchen with dishwasher. Free Wi-Fi in all the villas as well. We didn’t have any issues during our stay thankfully, so I can’t comment on whether the staff was good or bad. My wife handled check in as I stayed in the car with our child, and I assume that was painless since she didn’t mention otherwise and it didn’t seem to take very long. Overall, I highly recommend it for families with kids due to the various amenities on site that can keep kids busy for hours. They also have a game room that is near the pirate plunge pool area. Pros: - Close, fast access to Hwy 4 - Very close to SeaWorld - There is a 24 hour CVS about a minute away (very convenient when your toddler wakes up in the middle of the night with a fever and you forgot to pack children’s Tylenol!) - Plenty of parking, nearby (we have been to some timeshares that parking was a definite problem whether it be far away of non-existent and you spend too much time trying to find a spot and have to walk around the property to get to your villa) Cons: - The particular villa we were in could stand to be updated, though not dirty - Single elevator on building; had to walk to a central elevator for our building and then around the building to get to pool areas, though it was near the parking lot – thinking back, this isn’t that big of a deal and I didn’t really mind as all of the other access was simple i.e., getting in and out of property and parking situation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Time Share Rental”
Reviews.Author: dgreene99
Reviews.Content: Although we did not spend a lot of time exploring the facilities what we saw was very nice... the concierge that took care of us found us a room overlooking the lake with the front along one of the Grand Pines par 5s... the room was appointed appropriately, although the girls didn't really care for the nautical theme, it seemed pretty nice to me... we had friends staying at one of the other Marriott Timeshares and it seemed just as nice and had a nice restaurant (Faldo's) on property... the property winds through my favorite course of the week, Grand Pines, so I was happy... there seemed to be plenty of activities for adults and children and the pool was surrounded by whirlpools, kiddie pools and the lake... I would say the personnel were the best... from the concierge check in to house cleaning they all seemed to care that you were there...

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and close to Sea World”
Reviews.Author: robtk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is mainly geared towards families. Several pools and (water) playgrounds. My wife and I stayed there with the two of us. We had a 1 bedroom suite. The room was excellent! Very large, very nice bedroom and the kitchen is perfect with everything you need. The rooms are clean and even though it is a large property, it is easy to park close to your room. We only had breakfast one morning, but the restaurant isn't that special. Mostly some sort of fast food/bar food outlet. But that was no problem, since the other mornings we had breakfast outside on our balcony! Sea World is around the corner, and Disney a 10 minute drive. So the location isn't too bad either. We would definitely go back here when we go to Orlando again!

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach city”
Reviews.Author: Wiljan34
Reviews.Content: Cockroaches galore. BEWARE. The place is clean,but infested

Reviews.Title: “Another fantastic stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mousefan71
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed October 2 - October 9, we own at this resort and this was our 3rd visit. We stayed in Bldg 13 - 5th floor, we had an amazing view of the pirate ship pool and the lake. The rooms were recently refurbished with new furniture, granite countertops, stainless appliances and flat screen TV's in all the rooms. The pools are fabulous and they offer a number of activities for both kids and adults - the magic show was a real crowd pleaser. My only regret was not spending more time at the resort, next time we will!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Families--A Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: L0ngIslandL0ngisland
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed here in August 2011. We had a renovated 2 bedroom/2 bathroom w/full kitchen & laundry. The room was very nicely decorated & very spacious too. The master bedroom/bath had double sinks with several drawers for all your tolietries. The shower was very large & had 2 shower heads. So yes, the room was great, super comfortable & very convenient to all the area attractions but the best part of Harbour Lake was the outside. This isn't just a hotel, it is truly a resort like you would expect to find on a Caribbean island. There is a splash area for the kids with sprinklers, a pool with a water slide and a pool with a pirate ship & kiddie slides. There are lots of activities run also like trivia games, races & sports games. There is a restaurant, bar & excercise room. The boardwalk overlooking a lake is also nice in the evenings or during the day to fish from. There are bbq grills, ping pong, billards, basketball & more. The grounds were clean & the staff was very nice. You can't go wrong staying here, we really loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: Christina M
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2bd Villa from the 30th of Sept to the 5th of October. We did the Disney park and canceled the Universal trip, there was so much to do at the resort my kids didn't want to leave. Also the stuff was very nice and everything was great. Pools were wonderful loved everything about our stay, we are planning to visit again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Pools and Happy Hour”
Reviews.Author: bridgetravels
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for two nights in order to visit Island of Adventure Harry Potter. I booked a studio but when we arrived I asked how much it was to upgrade and at only 19 more a night we were place in a one bedroom with a full kitchen. I wish I had checked under the sink because they included dish soap and paper towels. I had gone to publix right down the road and had already bought them. They also include 2 complimentary laundry soaps for your washer and dryer. The pools were fantastic. Sundaes every day at 3 for 3 bucks. Happy hour had 4 dollar margaritas from 3 to 6. My son enjoyed the poolside organized games. The staff was happy and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Kiddie Nirvana”
Reviews.Author: jbharri
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bed suite. The suite was equipped with a full kitchen, washer dryer, and every amenity you need to be comfortable away from home with young children. Overall the resort is very clean and well maintained. There are two pool areas, each kid-friendly and equipped with water play areas, hot tubs, and infant pools. The location is great, close to all the theme parks, outlet malls and restaurants. On the down side, you can't walk to anything and the options for eating on site are very limited. So, either be prepared to cook or prepared to drive for dinner each night. That said, for families with young children, this place is a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer care”
Reviews.Author: leroi_11
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent. Speedy check in. Clean rooms. Well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott's Harbour Lake - Great for Kids!”
Reviews.Author: bruinbryan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom with a full kitchen. This was a perfect setup for a family of 4. The balcony had a screen cover so no insects got in. My only complaint was the bathroom while clean and functional was small and plain. The 2 pools at the property were great! My oldest loved the Pirate Plunge Water Slide and my youngest loved the Pirate Ship at the other pool. We never had problems getting chairs and tables either. We would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Whole family loves this place!”
Reviews.Author: GoTigahs
Reviews.Content: We go to this resort at least 1 night a year. This is our 3rd year. We have always reserved a studio that has plenty of room for 2 adults, 2 children. Room: -a bed, and a sofa bed -TV w/ a DVD player (DVD rentals from the front desk) -a cafe table with 2 chairs -a coffee table -Kichenette with a toaster, microwave, plates, cups, utensils, mini-fridge, ice bucket & tongs, can opener, and wine/bottle opener. -bathroom is standard. includes hair dryer, shampoo, soap -there is a screened in balcony The grounds -security person at the property entrance -very well kept Key West themed resort -not large -2 FABULOUS pools for families 1 with a slide and splash pad, the other with a pirate ship for kids to play on -2 baby pools -3 hot tubs -Poolside bar and grill with decent food -TONS of scheduled activities geared toward families/children (It is like being on a cruise ship) -plenty of pool lounge chairs and tables -Friendly staff -gas grills for use -bathrooms with showers poolside -pool towels available poolside -you can roll your ice chest next to your table by the pool with beverages and snacks -not a large property: easy to move between pools -arcade -basketball courts -ping-pong tables -free parking Close to SeaWorld. At night, you can see their fireworks! We have been in the 2 bedroom suite and they are fantastic with a full kitchen and plenty of room. WE LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families with kids”
Reviews.Author: mikepmcm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week with my wife daughter and her fiancee, mainly as a base to explore the Magic Kingdom (first visit for my daughters fiancee). All of the units have been updated since our last visit 3-years ago with new granite counters, new cabinets, flat-screen TV's, new furniture. Didn't spend much time there and it looked like a ghost town most days since the majority of people are usually in the parks. Pools are geared towards kids with a pirate ship in one and a small water slide in the other and a water cannon park where you can compete against others. Adults can find solitude in the numerous hot tubs.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids and the kid within”
Reviews.Author: ajsiegel00
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio and it was bigger than most hotel rooms. The room was clean and complete with a kitchenette and screened in balcony. There were lots of bugs outside but none inside thanks to the screen. There are tons of activities of which many are free (putt putt was not if you are not an owner). We were there for only one night but at no point were we asked about taking a tour, possibly if you stay longer they would have called. For the kids they have two fantastic pools. One is complete with a waterpark and water slide, while the other has a large pirate ship. The pool with a pirate ship also has several spas surrounding it for the adults. The resort itself is directly across from another Marriott resort which has a golf course and SeaWorld is a very short drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: waterwingsfun
Reviews.Content: This resort is beautiful. My son loved the 2 pool areas (one has a pirate ship and the other has a slide). The room was nice, plenty of space for a small family. Location is perfect, close to Sea World and only 16 minutes from Disney Hollywood Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it again, we'll be back again”
Reviews.Author: Loriann_1978
Reviews.Content: Love this place, plenty of room, gorgeous newly renovated rooms, excellent activities and attention to kids, great service from staff, so much fun in the pool

Reviews.Title: “Great For Kids”
Reviews.Author: dianar22
Reviews.Content: This resort has a great pool area and activities for kids. One pool has a pirate ship in it with several slides and other water fun on it. The other pool has a huge splash area and a slide for bigger kids and adults. Only a short drive (5-15min) to Sea World and Disney parks. We stayed there twice and plan to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay - GREAT KIDS POOL!!!”
Reviews.Author: kipcher
Reviews.Content: Very nice and very clean. We were only here overnight, so we didn't get to explore as much as I would have liked. The rooms are a great size complete with a pull out sofa and a balcony, complete with a table and 4 chairs. Our room had a small table inside with 2 chairs, microwave, coffee pot, refrigerator all of the dishes you could need along with laundry detergent for the washing machine in the building. This would make a great place to stay for the week. The pool area was beautiful!! Landscaped with palm trees and tropical plants. There are actually 2 pools, the "kiddie pool" has a zero entrance side with a very large pirate ship play area, slides, water cannons and climbing areas. The other pool has a winding slide into the pool. The slide is open so my 4 year old was able to go down by himself. (He's been in slides that are covered and hates them because they are too dark). There are also 2 large towers that you can climb up and shoot water cannons at people, but beware, they also have 2 very large buckets that dump water every few minutes!! There are other activities as well, ping pong (bring a quarter to buy a ping pong ball), basketball and pool. You have to check out the equipment at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED THIS RESORT!”
Reviews.Author: michele w
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom unit and it was wonderful. We were on the top floor so there was practically zero noise. We were expecting a tiny space crammed with a kitchen, but it was waaayyyyyy bigger than any hotel room or other place we have stayed with a kitchen area. There was a full kitchen and a complete dining area, separate living room space, spacious bathroom and of course a separate bedroom. The grounds were very nicely kept and the pools were great! The ONLY complaint we have about our stay was regarding the resort employee at the slide. She made sure both kids were tall enough for the slide and then as my nephew was coming OFF the slide, she says, "Is he a good swimmer?" We said, "UM no, why????" THEN she tells us the current is very strong and I ended up having to jump in and rescue my nephew. They should have a sign or a PERSON informing you BEFORE you send your kids on the slide, that HEIGHT isnt the only requirement, but that if they aren't strong swimmers, then need an adult in the pool to help them when they come off the slide! The kids loved the slide though and continued to get back on it repeatedly, with me in the water to help them after that! It was so nice after half a day or a whole day at Disney to come back to the resort and relax by the pool. After relaxing we could still play mini-golf, billiards, basketball, ping-pong and more right there on the resort. The smoothies at the pool bar were great too! We will definitely be staying here again. Next time we hope to do more resort activities as well, as they seemed to have a lot to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Sue121
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott Grande Vista owners but decided to try a different resort on this trip to Orlando. This resort is very nice. Rooms were clean but in need of some minor repairs. We were told our room had been through a "soft renovation" within the last 3 years, meaning paint, bedding, and other cosmetics. One of the dresser drawers in the master bedroom was broken and the porcelain was peeling off the sink. But overall, it was clean and very spacious. When traveling with young children, having the kitchen and the washer/dryer makes things a lot easier. We spent four of our seven days at the Universal parks which were only about 10 minutes away. Disney was only slightly farther as a trip to the Lego Store at Downtown Disney was requested by our kids. There's a Walmart, Publix and CVS all very close. Plenty of places to eat nearby as well. This resort is in a great location. The pools are fantastic for the kids. We spent a couple of days at the resort and really enjoyed the pool areas. The kids participated in the poolside games and had a lot of fun. They really loved the pirate slide. There were activities each day which we did not really have time for, nor did we use the mini golf or other amenities. There always seems to be too much to do outside of the resorts in Orlando and we rarely get to enjoy all the resort amenities when we travel there. One thing that annoyed me was that there were not enough towels in the room - they provide 8 bath towels, 4 hand towels and 4 wash cloths. We had 8 people and the girls usually need two towels each - one for hair and one for body. And 4 washcloths for 8 people for a week??! I called to request more and they told me there would be a $10 charge for additional towels since the room was "appropriately stocked for 8 people". Fortunately we had packed a few beach towels from home so used those for showers, and did several loads of towels in the wash during the week. Overall I would say, while not the nicest of the Marriott's we've stayed it, the resort was very nice and the pool area was one of the best for kids. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent base for visiting the theme parks”
Reviews.Author: TandT94
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here August 23 - September 2. The room set up was ideal: two bedrooms, with two queen beds in the second one for our kids, a full kitchen and spacious living room. There looked to have been a fairly recent refurbishment and everything was very comfortable and clean. The dishwasher and washer/dryer came in handy. there was a a large screen TV with Blu-ray player. Free WiFi was quite fast and reliable. The staff were remarkably friendly and helpful, in a low-key and genuine way. As an example, I dropped my wallet while inserting the security pass to re-enter the resort and the gate attendant noticed it and retrieved it for me. I would have driven away unawares, sans wallet. When I tried to give him a tip later he refused, saying it was just his job, before I finally persuaded him to take it to make me feel better. There was one polite telephone solicitation to attend a session on buying a time-share, with an offer to subsidize our park tickets as an incentive to attend, which we ignored. The concierge booked all of our Disney tickets cheerfully and efficiently. There are extensive recreation programs, with things like Polynesian nights and surfing lessons. We were too busy at the parks to go to them, but they would be fun if you were hanging around the resort more. The two pools were clean and well laid out. One has a water slide and spray park, with snack bar, and the other is larger, with a pirate ship for playing on and a bigger swimming area for adults, plus a full bar and grill. Our bits (10 and 12) loved the pirate theme and did not find the slide too tame, but perhaps older teenagers would. Plenty of pool seating was available. There is also a full video arcade and what looked like a well set up workout room. We also found the location to be very convenient for visiting the theme parks. The distances on the map are deceptive because this resort is very close to I-4, which means a fast easy drive to the WDW parks - maybe 15 minutes maximum - with hardly any stops on the way. Universal is even closer and Sea World is closer still. There is a Publix grocery store and 24-hour Walgreen's drug store on I-Drive about 5 minutes away. We had a rental car (which I highly recommend) so I can't comment on the availability of shuttle transport to the various parks. If your kids start school after Labour Day and you can stand the heat (high of 94 degrees and 80% humidity most days!) , the end of August is a nice time to go without taking them out of school, because Florida kids go back the third week in August and the parks are quieter. There were plenty of families at this resort but it certainly did not feel crowded at all. All in all this was a terrific place to holiday in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE LOVE this resort”
Reviews.Author: lactamom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 days at the beginning of our WDW trip where we stayed on property for the remaining 5 nights. The resort is BEAUTIFUL and everything that a resort should be. The pools and water feature areas were simply wonderful. Our kids are 4 and 6 and they were able to fully enjoy the little kid pirate ship area and the water slide. The staff at this property are warm and friendly, the grounds are beautiful, and the rooms are spacious and family-friendly. There are lots of activities as well, like make-your-own-sundaes. This property is convenient enough to the WDW parks, though we prefer to stay on property. We had no problem w/ parking at this property. My only complaint is that the on-site food choices (pool side, for example) are some what limited. Expect the food prices to be typical of any resort. We left the Marriott to stay at a WDW value property and our kids kept wanting to go back to the Marriott. We went on Marriott points, which made the trip even better, but would still return.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: snipesnest
Reviews.Content: Always my first choice to stay in Orlando. Great activities on site for kids And close enough to shopping, attractions and International Boulevard.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: marylou1017
Reviews.Content: This resort is an excellent spot for families. The units are large, clean and well equipped. Washers and dryers in the unit are a plus especially when traveling with small children. The beds were extremely comfortable; the bathrooms spacious. There were nine of us ranging from 9 months to 66 years and we all had a wonderful time. While most of the day was spent in disneyworld, if we had to do it over again, we would have spent more time at the wonderful pool at the resort. The kids LOVED it. There was a pirate ship a splash pad and a big slide. The entertainment especially the magician was great fun. The on-site restaurant had a limited menu but it was fine for our purposes. The staff was very helpful. I would recommend this resort to families. So much fun!

Reviews.Title: “Were going back this September”
Reviews.Author: cbonardi
Reviews.Content: We visited for a "family week" 18 of us from all over the East Coast. From grandma to great grand children. This resort has everything for familys with young children. We especially liked that we could cook in the rooms or on the gas grills by the play area. This saves so much money considering that Disney continues to raise the prices every year this place is a bargain. The rooms are triple the size of the disney onsite rooms and have washer and dryers so we can pack light.! We have stayed in other Marriotts and find this one has everything we would need. There is plenty of supermarket shops close by for breakfast and lunch and lots of nice resturants for dinner. Buy your Disney souvieners at the local Walmart! The staff has plenty of fun events for the kids to do and the putt-putt golf was cool too.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong with Marriott”
Reviews.Author: soup-r-dave
Reviews.Content: I loved our stay here at Harbour Lake. While it was the multiple extravagant pools that brought me in, it was the activities and the activity staff that really made the stay here fantastic. Unfortunately, the only rooms they had available were the studios. With only one room with one queen bed, and one pull-out for my two little girls, it was a bit cramped for our style, but we made it work. Since we were in a studio, we didn't have all of the amenities of the suites, but the staff accommodated us with our requests when we asked for an additional place setting when we had a fifth guest come over for dinner. They also provided us with grilling utensils that were not present in the room. I was also impressed that they provided unlimited free refills of laundry detergent to be used in the shared laundry facility in our building. Activities were great. From a luau complete with fire dancing, to a magician, to contests for the kids including "water-balloon olympics" and dodge ball. One day a band played all day and there was face painting for the kids. And there was even beer games for the adults! The location was excellent. Just down the street from Sea World and Discover Cove. I really enjoyed my stay here. When I return to Orlando, I would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Feels Like Home!”
Reviews.Author: Sherry B
Reviews.Content: We love the Marriott Harbour Lake. We always stay in a 2 bedroom villa and they are soooooo roomy and clean. Makes you feel like your at home. The beds are fairly comfortable, the shower has two heads and a hand-held hose which helps to get all the sun screen off. The pools divide up the crowd well; mostly the little kids stay at the pirate ship pool and the adults and older kids at the Pirate Plunge pool which has two story slide that our kids love. There is a mini-golf course, a play ground, table tennis, basketball court, a fire pit for marshmallow roasting and the recreation staff has something going on all day long for kids and adults too. Best place for families with children.

Reviews.Title: “WE HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS RESORT FOR KIDS.”
Reviews.Author: LeonardsofSherman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our 33 and 31 month olds for the week. They absolutely loved the pirate ship and accompanying pool. They could go down the slides independently and spent every hour that they could down there. The rooms were nicely equipped and decorated, and the bed was very nice. The maintenance staff was starting to deliver new stainless steel appliances. They are also getting granite countertops. There was a big TV and there was plenty of room in our 1 bedroom for the 4 of us. The staff was very friendly and the custodial staff was always singing or joking around and seemed happy to be working there. That speaks volumes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation - what I've cme to expect from Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Travellinggirl2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a two-bedroomed villa, which was really very nice. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the villa was quite large with everything I could have wanted. I checked in really late so the front desk operator was kind enough to give me a late checkout so that I could have a lie-in! Everything was excellent, and I am happy to recommend this to anyone looking for a self-contained villa with plenty of on-site activities for kids and adults, plus the advantage of being located at SeaWorld Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Family Friendly place to stay while in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: Travellermama
Reviews.Content: We checked into this resort in April for our Spring Break. We are owners at the resort and have been here twice before. We were traveling with our friends who also own here. We have a 13 year old daughter and they have a 13 year old daughter as well and an 18 year old son. I tell you this because the kids had even more fun at the resort this time than when they had all been the previous two times. We would have thought that they might be bored but they never were! We actually spent four full days just at the resort. Check in was very quick and we were able to get into our Villa early. Our 2 bedroom villa was located in Building 28 (Buried Treasure) in Room 2853 on the fifth floor overlooking the water park. We stayed in the same building on our last visit a few years ago and the villa had been brand new then. It was recently revamped with a flat screen TV and new décor. The room is very comfortable for a family of six and was very clean. The kitchen offers everything that you would need to cook any meal. The porch is screened with a table and 4 chairs in which is very nice. We sat out there every evening to enjoy the fireworks at Disney. Harbour Lake is very close to SeaWorld and Aquatica Water Park as well as International Drive, Universal and Disney. There are lots of great shops/outlets and restaurants in the area. After checking in, we went to the nearby Costco and Publix to get supplies for the week. It is nice to be able to cook some meals for dinner and to have breakfast each morning in the room. When we were at the resort during the day, we would be able to eat lunch as well. Eating in certainly reduces the cost of the vacation…especially when you have kids with you. The kids love the resort because they are able to go off safely on their own to do all of the activities. On property, there are two great pools…one with a water slide with a zero entry pool and the other has a pirate ship to play on. Both pool areas have hot tubs. There were kids playing in the small waterpark all of the time. There is a great mini-golf course and a sports area that has a basketball court, 2 ping pong tables and a foosball table as well as a soccer field across the street. The campfire is in that area as well as the gas grills. We used them one night to cook our dinner. There is also a Kid’s Club that is available for younger children. Our kids used to use it and loved all of the activities, but they didn’t this time since they were older. The HarborSide Bar & Grill by the Pirate Plunge pool has been recently redone and they offer some good food. The girls each bought a drink mug at the beginning of our stay so that they could get free refills all week. It’s is a great value. We also took advantage of the ice cream social every afternoon. There are lots of activities that the resort offers. Some have a fee but others don’t…there is an Activity Schedule that lists everything that is going on. The pool party by the Pirate pool was a great activity and offered live music. Everyone that we encountered who worked there was very friendly and professional. There is a Concierge desk if you need help with your travel plans and I was able to print my boarding passes off at the computer in the lobby. We did not have any cleanings during the week, but you can arrange to have your villa cleaned or just have the towels exchanged for a fee. This is technically not a hotel, but a Time Share, so they don’t offer free daily cleaning. This resort is a great choice for families with kids of all ages. We all had a great time and the kids are looking forward to returning over and over again! We look at Harbour Lakes as our second home.

Reviews.Title: “Still great after all these years..”
Reviews.Author: reg3sdaddy
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 days and four nights at Harbour Lake and truly enjoyed the experience. My sons's first time in a pool was at this very reasort when he was just 9 months old. He is now 5 years old and for the first time ever took the "Pirate Plunge".. this place is an absolute gem for families with small children.. miniature golf, basketball courts, absolutely wonderful pool and splash areas.. On Saturday night, we attended the magic show the resort put on and my son was picked to go up on stage to assist with one of the trips.. he was over-joyed.. so much so that he called his mom (we are divorced) to brag about his star turn.. The grills were absolutely great and provided us with many of our meals - which helped keep our costs down as we were able to make food instead of going out and racking up huge retsaurant bills.. yes, there are some shortcomings.. but they are few and far between and not anything that would severly impact your stay.. i highly recommended this place back in 2006 and continue to do so in 2011... kudos!

Reviews.Title: “Best Family Resort Ever”
Reviews.Author: lamira
Reviews.Content: Currently vacationing @ Harbour Lake and it is awesome. The rooms are newly renovated well equipped with all amenities a family needs and the beds are very comfortable. The pools are outrageous, pirate ship, slides, mini golf, basketball, arcade, we have not left the resort at all. Even the food is great, there's happy hour every day and the service is very good. Couldn't ask for more. Highly recommend for a family with young kids.

Reviews.Title: “Condo living with great kids pool area”
Reviews.Author: ELLASECRET
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Thanksgiving, and had a great time. Although our room was smaller than expected (I believe it was a Priceline win or possibly hotwire) we still found it more convenient than a typical hotel room. We had a small studio with a king sized bed and pull out sofa. There is a tiny kitchenette so we could keep beverages cool, and microwave popcorn if desired. A tiny screened-in lanai was attached so we had a partial view of the swimming area. The lanai had a table and two chairs so it became a nice breakfast spot. The best thing about this accommodation for us was the pool area. We have two kids, and they had more fun at the pirate themed pool than at Universal Studios! The water was freezing cold so it wasn't very agreeable for the adults, but the kids loved it. This property is very convenient to Sea World - in fact, you can watch their fireworks display from the parking lot! We also found it convenient to Universal Studios, but that was more of a drive. Still a nice property in a nice area.

Reviews.Title: “Family Fun”
Reviews.Author: JaxManHiltonHead
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott owners but had never stayed at Harbour Lake before. We wanted to check it out since we have a large family reunion booked there later in the year. We loved it!! The kids are going to love it. It is the most kid friendly resort we have ever been to. Employees were very nice but the ammenities were outstanding, Pirate pools, water spouts, game room, minature golf, basketball, soccer fields- so very much to do as a family. Cant wait to take out grandson and the extended family back for the reunion.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the renovations!”
Reviews.Author: agnaus
Reviews.Content: The newly remodeled rooms are beautiful! I was shocked at how nice they were. We didn't go to any parks just hung out the resort. One thing we had a good time with was cane fishing. Go to the activity center and ask for the Cane Poles. You can get bread from the bar but I would use leftovers you may have. We caught 5 fish with chicken nuggets. The pools are fantastic.....the pirate ship, splash park and waterslide were a huge hit!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families with kids”
Reviews.Author: Jasamy11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our first visit to Disney. We were in one of the older buildings, but we found the villa to be in great condition. It was adequately stocked for making meals to save on calories and money at the parks. My 3 year old had a blast at the pool and exploring the resort. The grounds were beautiful and there was ample parking. We were kind of sad that we didn't plan more "down time" into our trip to enjoy the resort more. The service was excellent for any minor issue we encountered & the housekeeping service went above and beyond. Will definitely stay here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at Disney every year...uh sure”
Reviews.Author: SEflordiagirl
Reviews.Content: My parents (Imho) were duped into getting this timeshare unit about 5 years ago, and in theory it sounded fine. They paid premium for a fixed week #52 (which usually encompasses Dec 24/25). We always meet them there as it is a great time for our kids to have Christmas at Disney. In the past 4 years the rooms have had virtually NO upgrading and they are starting to show their wear. MY BIGGEST pet peeve is EVERY year my dad takes time off his ridiculous work schedule for this trip; week #52 per their contract. Last year they "had to" move us a few days after that #52 first Saturday. Okay fine. Well, dad just got an email this week saying that this year we "can" arrive on December 29 and leave January 5th! WT...?... This is absolutely unacceptable and against contract. Not to mention that first week of January you can book a room for significantly less than week #52. I am livid. Yes, you will also be bombarded with sales calls while staying on property. They bother our room and we are owners already. they want to "update us and explore other opportunities"... Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families. Very clean.”
Reviews.Author: bella2828
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from June 18 threw the 26th. Two babies under 3. This was the best hotel we could have asked for. the pools were great water was so warm. The babies enjoyed the sprinklers. And there is also a baby pool. The Food by the pool was delicious! And frozen drinks were so good! The hotel it self was very clean. We had a one bedroom and still had a lot of room the kitchen has everything you need down to Tupperware. The room was very updated .. flat screen TV in living room and bedroom. We went to Disney 5 days it was very close 15 min. And one day to sea world about 5 minutes .. there are stores all near by we went to CVS and publix for all food for kitchen. I will definitely stay here again and will bring my family.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT EVERY THING PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: thecrosbygang
Reviews.Content: great base for families. Room a great size, and you had every thing for cooking. In the great Americian sytle nothing was to much trouble and problems were sorted with speed and a smile. Will be back next year Swimming pools busy at times but it was a heat wave of 105f Didn't use the kids club or evening enterainment so i can't comment on them No negatives at all 100% from us which must be a first. The Williamsons north of England x

Reviews.Title: “Always pleased with Harbour Lake”
Reviews.Author: augustfamily12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harbour Lake in June 2011 and had a great time. This was our third stay at the property and have yet to be disappointed. The kids have a ball at the pool and the grounds are beautiful. We will definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Brian_Sherry20292
Reviews.Content: My husand and I are owners at this resort and have stayed before. The attitude of the staff and cleanliness of the room (previous tenants' hairpins still in bathroom) is not what it has been on past stays. Midweek we requested a change of towels and additional toilet paper. We were told there would be a $10 charge. Considering two of us needed a change midweek, I hate to think what a family would need. After letting them know we were not pleased about this recent rule change, they brought us a change and "complimentary" toilet paper. Are you kidding me? This place has potential, but it needs to live up to the standards Marriott has promised and we have come to expect. It's a competitive world out there.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to go but presented some real challenges.”
Reviews.Author: RaleighMomofthree
Reviews.Content: Loved the pools, this place is great for kids. It has a mini-golf course that is great! Pools have slides and everything that kids could want. It is easy to get to the parks, and after staying on property we thought that we would miss the monorail system but we liked the car and parking better. It is easier. Harbour Lake had some issues that we rarely encounter with our Marriott time-share stays. The dishwasher and washing machine were both broken. Someone came into our room then ran off then tried to bother us again later...wierd. We were concerned about our safety. The staff replaced the dishwasher and fixed the washer - but that should have been done before our arrival. The dishwasher was rusting from the outside and the dished that were put away were all dirty. Overall the whole resort was in need of better cleaning. Overall, it was fun but we had challenges with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED this Marriott!!!”
Reviews.Author: wework2travel
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is awesome! We are already planning our next trip back. We have a 7 & 5 year old who loved the pirate pool and the water park. The rooms were extremely nice and I loved the bed, so comfortable. This was our third time in Orlando and I would stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING family vacation! LOVED this resort!”
Reviews.Author: TLJN_travelbug
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying at this resort. We were sad to leave. It was our first time staying at this resort and Marriott in general. We were tremendously pleased and absolutely loved the resort. Our 2.5 year old son loved playing in both pools and all the water sprays and splash pads. It's very safe for young kids. In fact, our son actually increased his swimming skills, independance and confidence in the water thanks to all the water activities at this resort. He loved the pirate ship with water slides. We stayed in a very spacious two bedroom unit near both pools that was recently renovated. The room was very quiet The staff at the hotel were always friendly and helpful. We received great service from the bar/restaurant and all employees, even the towel staff. The resort has daily activities and every morning at 9am my son participated in fun and games (puzzles, finger painting, sidewalk coloring with chalk, etc...). He received 2 pirate coins for each acitivity and at the end of the week, he redeemed those coins for fun prizes. The hotel is located close to all the various theme parks, restaurants, outlet malls and grocery shopping. We will definitely be back again next year. It's also only an hour's drive to Daytona Beach where we spent a few hours playing in the sand before coming back to the resort to play in the pool/water sprays. It's honestly the best kid-friendly resort I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Loads of Fun-- great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jrblum67
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful! It was clean, the staff was friendly and helpful and the kitchen was great. We had three adults, two children and one baby and the two-bedroom model was fairly spacious-- we had enough room. My granddaughters loved the pools! My daughter loved the baby pools which were entirely enclosed. The third day we were there one of them asked if we could come back next year. Last week another granddaughter said it was the most fun hotel she's ever stayed at. We really enjoyed the Polynesian show on Friday night. it is a short drive to Disney World.there is a great arcade the kids love it. there are great water games my granddaughters loved it --and the grown-ups can play some games too. clean rooms, and great maid service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: drkevinwong
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at a Marriott Vacation Club and it was WONDERFUL! The facility has enough to keep my 5 and 8 year old busy and entertained after a busy day in Orlando. There are basketball courts, mini golf, splash area, and a waterslide. It was centrally located to all the Disney Parks, Sea World, and Universal - no more than 15-20 minutes to each. It is about a 20 minute ride to the airport and close to great restaurants on International Drive. We stocked up at the local Walmart which was about 5-10 minutes away. The staff was extremely attentive. We complained about the bed and they changed it that day. With any request, we were met with a quick response and a follow up call to make sure it was to our satisfaction. The restaurant was a great place to eat after a long flight. The WiFi was spotty and only worked in certain areas of the room. That was disappointing, but we were on vacation. It forced us to unplug. Some of the rooms faced the freeway. We were lucky to be near the entrance where we heard an occasional car coming over a little bridge. It was nothing like the constant sound of cars whizzing by.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation resort”
Reviews.Author: lopezth
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Harbour Lake on Memorial Day weekend 2011 for a 7 night stay. Our room was away from the pool areas overlooking the lake in front. It was a quiet building and noise was never an issue. We were about 100 yds from the pool. The room was newly renovated and was spacious and very clean. Washer/dryer, dishwasher, and pretty much all the kitchen appliances we needed. We chose this resort because of the pool areas and our kids loved them! There were more activities than we had time (or energy) to participate in. Other than the pools, the only things we took advantage of was the poolside bar & grill, we rented movies from the rec room, and played a Texas Hold 'Em tournament one night as one of the planned activities - no money involved, of course, but fun. One very handy amenity was the on site concierge from whom we purchased all our park tickets. Calling around I found their ticket prices to be equal to, or slightly cheaper than buying at the park gates, but MUCH more convenient. They were there 7 days/wk 8am-8pm. There was no room cleaning service (although available for an additional charge) but we didn't mind. One thing that was a little unusual about the room set up was there was no door separating the master bathroom from the master bedroom. Other than that everything was great. I found their WiFi to be 100% reliable and adequately fast. Flat screen TVs in every room. Cable was decent. 10-15 min drive to WDW and Universal. Probably <5 min to Seaworld. Drugstores, grocery stores, etc close by (<5 min). Very friendly and helpful staff. It also felt very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Nanaluvsnyc
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from a wonderful vacation at Marriott's Harbour Lake. The location of this resort is great! There are many free planned activities for the children and my grandchildren loved the putt-putt which you can purchase for $25 for the entire family. They actually played 5 games which would have been $25. But had they not spent 4 days at WDW they would have played many more games of putt-putt. The pools are great as well. I liked everything about this resort. The staff was friendly, especially the front desk. The grounds were well-kept. The one negative would be that the sofa was quit firm, so luckily we brought an aerobed with us and the one who got the sofa slept on it on the floor. We plan to return as we thoroughly enjoy our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantastic Week”
Reviews.Author: flalover23
Reviews.Content: Marriott Harbour Lake continues to impress. This was our 4th time at the resort and we have nothing negative to say whatsoever. The children were kept busy from 8 till late every day which left us alone to relax and to enjoy a proper holiday. We are owners here and decided to stay for 15 days this year and spent 13 of those days on the resort; the other two days, we visited Seaworld and Universal Studios. The bar-staff and pool attendants do their utmost to meet and greet the guests while the front desk staff were able to accomodate any request required. Its a nice feeling when they greet you by your first name and the Resort should be commended for it. Our villa was in building 14 over looking the pool and was updated--however the pools are noisey, so if you want a quiet stay then you should request a villa away from the pools (we enjoyed the noise and being able to see the pool however). We've already booked two weeks for next year for another family vacation perhaps more....

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, unhappy service”
Reviews.Author: CUNEOGIRLS
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing, the rooms are top notch: clean, spacious, beautiful furnishings! The kids love the pools and the slide. The only bad thing is that the workers seem to hate their jobs; grumpy towel attendants all but throw the towels at you and you have to interrupt the bartenders conversations after standing there for about 10 minutes just to get service! If we were paying full price for this hotel I would be ticked, but we got a greatdeal and love the room, sooo...

Reviews.Title: “This is what a vacation feels like”
Reviews.Author: valdan19881988
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Harbour Lake on Saturday, May 7 around noon. Our rooms were ready and we were able to check in and get in our room in about 15 minutes. We stayed in Buried Treasure, rooms # 2860 and 2861. The rooms are very roomy and clean. Our balcony over looked the pool and we could see the fireworks at the Magic Kingdom. Previously, we stayed in Sunken Treasure and like that building better. The rooms have a better layout and overlook the lake in the front. Both buildings are very quiet. I am a very light sleeper but I did not hear anything at night. Not even my parents who were next door and have no sense of quiet. The pools and putt putt were fabulous. We used both every day. My dad and I walked around the resort every morning. We did not attend any of the planned activities but got reminders every day about the events. From someone who has always stayed on Disney property, this is a better deal and will stay again. Pros: large condos, very quite, clean and well stocked, great pool and putt putt, beautiful grounds, short drive to Disney parks Cons: tub had a slow drain, internet and cable were out a lot, building walkways need pressure washing

Reviews.Title: “Not the marriott vacation club we like so much”
Reviews.Author: RAWS
Reviews.Content: We had 6 nights in this marriott vacationclub resort. The appartments were absolutely fine except for the airconditioning which made a lot of noise keeping us awake at night and taking away from the peaceful atmosphere. Pools were small and always with music. Food at the resort was very limited and the more unhealthy kind. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Overall we won't come back to this resort as we found the atmosphere to "cheap and cheerful" with too much noise. The resort is also next to the I-4. Not a bad hotel at all but compared to the other MVCI resorts we have stayed in, this one was the least attractive to us due to bad sleep and it being to noisy. I do want to thank the staff and our boys loved the minigolf, the soccer and the fishing!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT!!”
Reviews.Author: khcruise
Reviews.Content: We just returned from two nights in a 2 bdrm villa and we absolutely loved it. The 2 bdrm villa with full kitchen was a nice, large size. The beds were very cozy and the room was very clean. Also loved the screened in balcony with ceiling fan and light. All of the buildings (we were in 31 by the entrance) seem to be located within quick walking distance of the amenities. The resort is gated and secure, and we felt very safe at this location. It is also closer to Disney than we expected which was a nice surprise, however, I could have saved a ton of money and skipped Disney this trip. Once my son saw the pools and mini water park area, that was all he wanted to do. We spent more time using the resort's wonderful pools then visiting the parks. The pools are very kid friendly with zero entries and shallowness so that even non-swimmers can enjoy the wonderful slides and water features with more independence. My 8 year old is not a strong swimmer and is scared of deep water. However, for the large pirate pluge slide, the water at that end of the pool was shallow enough that he was able to enjoy this slide without needing us to catch him. Having a bar by both pools was also a nice feature and my husband and I really felt that we could relax and enjoy ourselves as much as my son was enjoying himself. We ate breakfast on site once and we were pleasantly surprised at how tasty it was (I recommend the blueberry pancakes) and the pricing was very reasonable (and cheaper than Disney). The service we received from everyone on staff was excellent! Our check-in was quick and easy and no one even mentioned a timeshare presentation to us during our stay. And, I can't say enough good things about the staff at the main pool bar/restaurant. They were all wonderful and went out of their way to make sure everyone was satisfied and enjoying themselves. The resort has many activities going on all day, every day and I wish we had more time to enjoy some of them. They also have game tables, basketball courts, a playground, marina and I'm sure more things we didn't have a chance to enjoy. We are already planning a return trip and this time we are skipping the parks altogether and plan on just enjoying all the wonderful things this resort has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic family hotel for Disney & Seaworld!”
Reviews.Author: pilgrim373
Reviews.Content: We had a magnificent stay last week at Harbour Lake -- staff was amazingly friendly & never bothered us about investing in a time share, the location was extremely close to Discovery Cove and Seaworld and very convenient (15 min. drive) to the Disney properties. We were there for 9 days and had every minute planned and it was a great "launch" for our adventures. But we also took 2 half days to hang out at the hotel, and it was wonderful. Great for young kids -- ours are 5, 7, and 9, and it was perfect. They LOVED the splash park and the slide into the pool. The pool is relatively shallow which makes it relaxing to watch kids when they are swimming -- they felt confident in the water. There are basketball courts, pool tables, foosball table, ping pong tables, playscape -- all immaculately clean. We didn't have time to do the adjacent minigolf but it was beautiful, and a lot of families did. We requested a newly refurbished room in Bldg 28 which was huge & brand new -- including in-room laundry washer/dryer & beautiful screened porch. Beds were comfortable. Seriously couldn't have been happier with the room. And the price was incredibly reasonable, esp with a AAA discount. LOVED it. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place, especially for kids”
Reviews.Author: Sean24
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our timeshare for a room here 4/17-4/24 and loved it. The place is really nice and the pools are great for the kids. It is located right down the road from Seaworld (5 min) and not far from Disney and Universal. When I exchanged I was only able to get 1 room( back in 9/10) (studio with small fridge,sink and microwave) but needed 2, so we ended up "sleeping" at another resort and came here daily to use the pools and others amenities. We would absolutely stay here again in the future, the staff was excellent and the property was spotless. They have gas and charcoal grills near the pools to use, a neat mini golf course ( $5 per round or $25 for unlimited), fishing, basketball courts, ping pong, foosball, billiards and probably more that I didn't even realize.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible and unexpensive; perfect location to visit Disney, Universal and Orlando at the same time”
Reviews.Author: jcaviles
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Disney, to Universal, and to the city of Orlando, this is a perfect middle ground to stay in. It never took us more than 20 minutes to arrive to any place, and we went to all Disney Parks, Downtown Disney, Universal Parks and Downtown Orlando. The rooms were perfect. We were 6 adult guests and we slept perfectly in only one room with 2 bedrooms (I king size bed; 2 queens; one sofabed in the living room). The beds were very comfortable, the 2 bathrooms were spacious, well equipped and well distributed (one of them could be entered from the living room/kitchen area and from the second bedroom as well), the kitchen had everything we needed (dishwasher, oven, refrigerator, microwave), there were 3 TVs, plenty of closet space and there was no noise whatsoever during our stay, Also, i was very handy yo have free in-room internet connection and to be able to make local calls for free. Be sure to ask for a renovated room at the time of booking, because those rooms are even better than some of the pictures showed in the hotel web page. We ask for a renovated room at the time of booking and they respected hour request. The service was very good, everybody was friendly and well behaved with us, despite the fact that we didn't speak English perfectly. Housekeeping was very good too, they cleaned and tided everything in the room every day at the time requested for us. The infrastructure of the hotel was incredible too. They had 4 pools, with different sizes and temperatures, a little bar which also had fast food meals and Starbucks hot drinks, soccer and basketball courts, a beautiful deck were you could relax in, and plenty of parking space per building. Before our trip, we read a lot about annoying timeshare-related calls, but we never received one. They told us at the time of checking-in that we could go to a meeting and get a gift, but we decided not to go and they didn't insisted. Overall, this was a great pick, even if you only want to relax a few days. We actually were sorry to had so little time to enjoy the hotel activities and areas. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “A new meaning to American accommodation”
Reviews.Author: bisgrove001
Reviews.Content: Marriott hotels are always a good standard but this place was great. There was a safe and secure 24 hour security enterance. It was in an excellent location not far from the airport, only a few minutes from the main road, a 10 minute drive from disney world, universal studios and sea world. Its very close to publix, the supermarket and its a 10 minute drive to a massive shopping outlet that has all the best designer shops. Its also only a 20 minute drive to the florida mall which is something like the biggest mall in the whole of florida. There are so many shops and restaurants around (largest Mc Donalds in the world only a 10 minute drive). We went at christmas time and everywhere was decorated beautifully and the staff had a gingerbread house building competition, some were amazing. We stayed in the buried treasure block of appartments it was very nice and had lots of parking space. The room was amazing we had 2 bedrooms one with a single king which was so comfy and the other with two queen size beds there was two bathrooms a very well equiped kitchen and a big lounge dinner.The balcony was really big with a big table and 4 chairs added to this we had a view of the pirates pool area and two neibourghing cities. The room had 3 flat screen tv's. The crazy golf area was fun however we had a members card so it was free. The two bars and the games room was also good, they had a great range of cocktails which made for an interesting night however the bar was extremely quiet, they served proper american food at the bar. Both pools were brilliant and the jacuzzi was fab. The entire place was just brilliant and I will definately be going back. While I was there I also visited the J.W.Marriott for a meal and that hotel is also great I highly recommend it and its only a 15 minute drive from the Harbour Lake.

Reviews.Title: “2nd trip was better than the first!”
Reviews.Author: Lynforde
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our 2nd trip to Marriott Harbour Lake. Our kids have already asked if we can go again next year! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, we stayed in building 14 with a view of the pirate ship pool and the lake. It was beautiful, beds were comfortable and the kitchen was well supplied! We did not visit any parks during our stay because our two kids, age 9 and 12 were completely content with the on-site activities. There were many activities that we could take part in with our children..it was so much fun! My son enjoys playing basketball, mini golf, cane pole fishing on the dock and my daughter loves the 2 pools and various activities. She also attended one of the kids night out where she played with other children, the rec staff , had pizza, played games, decorated a shirt..etc...she loved every minute of it! Happy Hour every day at the pool bar was good...I would recommend buying the ice cream cups...unlimited ice cream everday at 3:00pm..there really is not a negative thing that I can say about this place!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back- and I am picky!”
Reviews.Author: chrolly420
Reviews.Content: Our family of four, including a 2 and 4 y.o., just completed a stay of three nights and we were sad to leave. I can't imagine any place better for kids, particularly kids like mine who aren't crazy about the beach. The property is adorable.The grounds are lovely. I love that it's gated. CVS is within walking distance. Free wi-fi. The pools weren't crowded at all. The daily activity schedule was a nice perk- we took advantage of the fireside smores and the ice cream sunday events. I was a bit concerned about roaches after reading a few reviews (I have a phobia), but we didn't see a single one ever, inside or out (and I was looking). The unit was spacious, clean, and comfortable. Eating meals on the screened porch was a nice treat for all. Every encounter with staff was friendly- very important to me. The reviews are right on, this place is perfect for young families. Kudos to the management- they are getting it right!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: aaronmet
