Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 weeks at this hotel. We were in room 1012 which is a ground floor 2 bedroom unit centrally located and newly renovated. We stayed there with my parents and my 2 children ages 8 & 7. We used the pools a lot when we weren't at the parks. My children took advantage of a lot of the activities that the hotel had to offer. We paid the $25 for the family for the mini golf and used it quite a lot. One of the things we never anticipated doing was fishing. My 8 year son became a fishing pro at the lake on the resort. You just check out fishing poles at the activities desk. This is such a family friendly hotel and we really enjoyed staying here. The staff were very attentive and were very quick to respond to our requests - wine opener, then spatula. Always giving a phone call to make sure we received what we needed. The parks are very close by which was convenient when we needed a break from EPCOT to come back and swim and then returned later for the fireworks. Overall this was an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there all year round!”
Reviews.Author: holidays2059
Reviews.Content: We were at Harbour Lake resort for Spring break in March and enjoyed our stay. After a weird arrival (bed was stained with blood or other organic fluid), we were given a new room and everything went perfectly well after that. Rooms are large, clean, with screened blaconies overlooking the lake or the resort. Kitchenette with utensils and plates, spacious bathrooms. No bed bugs. There's a trolley bus stop just outside the resort entrance, taking you to Seaworld in a matter of minutes, or on to the International Drive shopping experience. If you buy your Seaworld tickets at reception, you get a second day for free. The staff is very helpful and kind and even give you a little complimentary gift on arrival. There are lots of activities offered for kids on premices, swimming pools and water games, pirate boats, and a very cool bar serving Stabuck's coffee for the parents who supervise their kids. The grounds are clean, well taken care of. There were as many gardeners as there were cleaning laides artound there! A pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: hartmann4
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a one week stay in a one bedroom condo at Harbour Lake. We were pleasantly surprised with the location. It’s an easy commute (just off I-4) to Disney, Universal and right down the street from Sea World. Our condo was clean, spacious, and stocked with everything we needed. The screened in porch and large bathroom were nice perks. Our children (8 and 5) loved the pool. There is a Publix grocery store only 5 minutes in either direction and a CVS just up the street. The grounds were very nice. The parking lot was crowded. We usually had to park near the back but it wasn’t a hindrance for us. There was someone around us I could hear coughing early one morning. Never heard talking, but I could hear kids if they were yelling outside in the hallway, or if someone dropped something on the tile floor above you. Noise wasn’t too big an issue. Overall, I would recommend Harbour Lake and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I was hoping for...and more”
Reviews.Author: amcirish
Reviews.Content: We stayed at MHL from Febuary 27 until March 6. I had specifically requested a newly renovated unit. We ended up getting to the hotel 4 hours before check in. They had a unit (we stayed in a 2 bedroom) available for us, but it was not a newly renovated unit and was the furtherest away from all of the action on property. I was a little concerned as we were traveling with my 79 y.o. MIL and my 3 and 4 y.o. children. Since I really just wanted to get to our room and get to the pool, I took the "risk". The walk to the pools, was no more than 2 minutes and the "older" room was even up to my sometimes snobby hotel standards. The hotel was immaculate and well kept. The staff was always friendly and helpful. The pools were wonderful and the extra large hot tubs were fabulous. The pool bars offered great food for adults and kids and drinks (cocktails included). This is definitely a hotel geared towards family with young children, but unless you are specifically looking for a party hotel I think that all age groups could enjoy the hotel. Super easy to get to the parks (15 minutes), 10 minutes to the outlets, CVS 1/4 mile for emergency items. We stayed in building 31 which is near the entrance and faces the main road... but even this did not deter from the beauty as there is a big pond and palm trees blocking the road view. Don't forget to get your $12 + cup for the daily ice cream social from 3 to 4... well worth it for the free refills all week.

Reviews.Title: “Honest Mixed Reviews”
Reviews.Author: haithgirl
Reviews.Content: I'm really split on this property. I tried this property out because I stayed across the street at Cypress Harbour last year at just about the same time and heard Harbour Lake was better. I have to tell you this is true for some things and for others, it's not. If you want your children to be happy, they will love the pools at Harbour Lake because there is a Pirate Ship with slides at one and a water play area at another. There is no question that hands down they are awesome. My two year old was in heaven. Service is comparable at both places. I had okay help at both properties. Nothing amazing, just average. If you are looking for stellar service, I don't know that either property will offer you that. The quality of the rooms is much, much better at Cypress Harbour. The rooms at Harbour Lake were dated and old. The televisions (yes, multiple) did not work and the water pressure was horrific. There was left over trash from the previous guest in the room on the floor and no one likes to find that. Plus, the elevators for our building were beyond scary and made so much noise that it made it impossible to sleep in the front room of our villa. I can't say I'll never stay here again because my daughter was so happy at the pools, but I don't know that I would jump for joy if I had to. During our stay, the front lawn of the property was littered with old televisions that were being replaced. Perhaps that's a sign of changes ahead.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Gracious_Grace
Reviews.Content: this place is a great place to stay in Orlando.Its close to international drive and if you have a car a perfect location to get to all theme parks.We didn't eat at the resort since there's so many places to eat .The rooms are nicely furnished and a real comfort to be in.Parking gets hard if you come late but i guess we were lucky.The main water-park was closed for renovation the week we were there so that was disappointing but it was a bit cold anyways.The pirate ship is not a big deal once you see it in person unlike the pictures but a plus was that the pool is heated at a comfortable temperature.I would stay here again but i think the fountains is a better value.

Reviews.Title: “On business with family, this worked great”
Reviews.Author: jsmitherscsi
Reviews.Content: Rooms are big, and come with full kitchens and washer and dryers. A must when in Florida with kids. We had the two-bedroom suite and were not on top of each other at all with two adults and four children. The rooms are beautiful, the outside, elevator grounds are not beautiful, but the waterpark makes up for it. It would be nice if they had some sort of option for shuttles to the parks, but most people retn We had a sitter with our children while we worked and it cost $30+ for a cab from the hotel to the parks. Another strange thing...unattended alrams were going off during the day...fortunately not at night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Waterpark Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Southport-TRIP
Reviews.Content: Pools, waterpark areas and activities are the thing here. Recommend if you have kids under the age of 12. If you have teens or are a couple looking for quiet you'd probably want to go elsewhere. Its a very comfortable laid back family place. I saw timeshare people at the front office but they didn't bother us at all. There were games, races, beer tasting, mini golf, basketball, arcade, movies etc going on all day. Kids will not even miss going to the theme parks if you stay here. My 8 yr old son was in the pools for hours. I'm very picky about warm pool water and pool temperature was perfect. They had two enormous hot tubs. They also had plenty of BBQ grills and picnic areas. Rooms were not luxury level but basic with big bath, sink, microwave, small fridge and room safe. We were 2 adults and 1 child and had a studio. Was plenty big enough for us. Bed was very comfortable. Had a sleeping bag and put it on the fold out sofa so it wasn't hard. Walls are very thin. Could hear everything next store. They left no towels or shampoo - had to chase the maid down soaking wet but not a big deal. I might return just for the pools for my 8 yr old son unless I wanted a more luxury room in which case I'd recommend the Caribe Royale. Street is very quiet. There is a security gate. Not many resturants nearby but there is a Publix down the street (take a right out of the parking lot). If you drive up a bit you come to the convention area which is very congested and too much for me but I'd imagine teens would love that area. Hotel had onsite bar and grill type dining but we wanted pizza. We found a great take-out pizza place. Got the menu from the front desk. Don't recall the name but the name has the letter "V" in it - Pizza Valento - something like that.

Reviews.Title: “AWSOME”
Reviews.Author: CantWaitForVaca23
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. We have stayed at multiple places in Orlando and this one tops the list. We left wondering why we ever went anywhere but the resort. The pools were great, the kids activities were fantastic, and the drinks were reasonable priced. (unlike other resorts). We are going back this year.

Reviews.Title: “Sparkles Like A Diamond!!”
Reviews.Author: Alasunk
Reviews.Content: Check was a breeze - Glory , the youn lady who works at the check in desk is a doll, pleasant, helpful and above all NICE!! We had lunch and marguritas at the pool, good food and great service. Building 30 has my recomendation. We are are an older couple so we chose the top floor. There are a million kids here. They were well behaved and there are many organized activities provided. Room was clean, bright and comfortable. Close to grocery shopping - Publix. I am staying a full week, at time of writing this I am a few days into this vacation. Have to say... security welcomes you in at the main gate and it's comforting to know someone is paying attention to the coming and going. Management should be commended - a staff like theirs does not happen by accident.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: crein76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the end of Sept. 2010 and LOVED it! This is such a wonderful place to get away especially with the kids (we had three under 10). There are kids activities galore!! Something is going on all-day long for them to do and keep busy! The pools are amazing and the staff was sooo friendly! It’s so close to Sea World that we actually took our toddler in the AM, left and put her down for a nap and then came back in the PM. It's only a 15 minute easy drive to WDW as well and we are huge Disney fans! We had a two bedroom suite and we couldn't believe how big it was (much bigger then Disney Vacation Club Villas). Super clean and wonderful! I have no complaints.....We will definitely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “TOO GOOD TO BE TRUE”
Reviews.Author: swqa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harbour Lake for 2 weeks in January. We called earlier to request rooms in the refurbished buildings (28 and 30). We stayed at building 28. At the moment we got into the room my first thought was I was probably missing something (we paid $220) - LOOKS TOO GOOD TO BE TRUE - Rooms were recently refurbished, clean, nice view, new bedding and a very nice full kitchen. Free High Speed Internet. All hotel personnel were extremely helpful, specially front desk. Special thanks to Mr Camilo (front desk manager). 10-15 minutes to any park. Kids had plenty of activities when we wanted to take a rest at the hotel (minigolf, mini-basketball, pirate and slide polls). In summary, I would be surprised to see any negative review about this place Just perfect

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: kkjmluv2travel
Reviews.Content: We visited Disneyworld in August 2010, staying both onsite and at the Harbour Lakes. Both were great, and had their pros and cons. The ONLY con to the Harbour Lakes was that it was not on Disney property (which was a very minor thing, compared to the fantastic room and resort). We stayed in a beautiful 2 bedroom, 2 bath unit. It was nicely and comfortably furnished, with comfy beds and great ammenities. There was a full kitchen which we did use. Also had a washer & dryer (awesome!). The screened balcony was nice, although it was very hot while we were there. The resort itself is wonderful. We did the mini golf, fishing, luau party, activities by the pool, and of course swam in the 2 pools. The kids LOVED it. We loved having the extra space, and it was nice to hang out after the kids went to bed. We would return in a heartbeat if we could find an affordable price. We had gotten a good deal last year.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: alexontour_11
Reviews.Content: We stay there during our visit to disney. Our big room with kitchen had a nice view. swiming great pool.we need just a few min. to the disney parks Lots of resturants. Highly recommend to anyone who want to visit Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - with lots of space!”
Reviews.Author: 1192012a
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in beginning of january, our last stop before heading home to Europe. When we arrived late at our room after checking in we were in awe - we had booked a 2-bedrrom villa (which is just called a villa - it is an apartment). It was huge! And so nice, with really nice beds, 3 tvs + dvd players, 2 bathrooms, a fully equipped kitchen with a dining area, washer and dryer, screened in balcony... We loved it! It was great to be able to come back after a long day at a themepark and cook your own food and just relax... Also being able to put the little one to bed and then watch a movie in bed (in another room) was a nice touch after having spent two weeks travelling and staying in the same room at different locations. It was to cold to use the pool and water play area, but it looked really nice. Free Wifi and free parking, everything spotlessly clean and well-kept. Perfect. There was some construction going on, it didn't bother us though.

Reviews.Title: “super kids friendly place”
Reviews.Author: lovehawaiigirl
Reviews.Content: we stay there during our visit to disney - via exchange by interval we are marriott owner so nothing suprise us - all the marriott vacation club is superb including this one very roomy room full kitchen - we made lunch everyday and bring to the park and save lots of money great sleep quality we had first floor on 30th building - no view/ enterance but no complain swiming pool was sooo great for my 3 years and 2 years - love the main pool with ship 10 min to disney park (any park out of 4) closed to outlet mall - which i think worth to spend some time right by the sea world closed to lots of resturants - via international blvd did'nt spend lots of time in the room since we did 5 days in the park but after day, we had very comfortable rest highly recommend to anyone who want to do theam park and with young kids *pool bar price(food and drink) is very high!!! would love to go back!! lots of building are under remodeling - if you plan to there by spring, you will get brand new room

Reviews.Title: “Really nice resort!”
Reviews.Author: LorzaB
Reviews.Content: My parents, sister and I stayed at Harbour Lake during December. When we arrived, the staff on the front desk were extremely helpful and courteous and even later on when I asked for some extra coathangers they immediately had them delivered to the room. The apartment we stayed in was very nice, with a large kitchen/dining/living room, two bedrooms (one with 2 queen beds for my sister and I, the other a king size for my parents) and both had adjacent bathrooms. Both bedrooms and the living room had flatscreen TVs with a lot of channel options. The kitchen was well equipped with utensils and we cooked there every night of our stay. The apartment also had free Wi-Fi which was extremely useful. When our apartment was cleaned it was done to a very high standard - no complaints at all! The only downsides of the apartment were that the fan in the bedroom didn't really do much good even though we had it on full but it helped when we opened the window a little and that the pillows were so soft that I couldn't really sleep on them! Everyone else managed fine though so it might just have been me! The whole resort was immaculately kept and I loved the fact that they made Starbucks coffee on site! We used the pool and hot tubs a few times, but generally at times when there weren't loads of kids around - just our preference. Because of going to Disney and Universal and also because we were there for a wedding, we didn't join in any of the resort activities though they seemed to have a good selection. Disney was extremely easy to get to, either via I-4 or on the back roads past Downtown Disney, as was Universal Studios. Had we been there in the summer we probably would also have gone to SeaWorld which is literally around the corner. Walmart and Winn-Dixie supermarkets are both within a mile or so and there are plenty of shopping malls around. All in all we had an excellent stay at Harbour Lake and even though the resort itself is probably more orientated to families with younger children, due to the friendliness of the staff, the distance to DisneyWorld and the very well-kept grounds, I would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but for the taxi trap!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GFtrip
Reviews.Content: Marriot Harbour Lake was excelent. Spacious room. nice service but the only time I needed the front desk to arrange a cab they called a limo (expensive, of course) and said "that is the only taxi service we know". So if you ever need a taxi while staying at Marriot Harbour Lake, call (407) 422-2222. I feel I have to share this precious information as the hotel "does not know about this service"

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort”
Reviews.Author: Mamatravel28
Reviews.Content: After trying to find a place to house my 3 year old, myself and my parents for a week I settled on Harbor Lake. Location was key and seemed to have great reviews. Well it was a wonderful experience. The rooms were extremely spacious. Having 2 bedrooms and bathrooms made it feel lime home with separate kitchen and open living area and patio no one was on top of each other. The entire resort was clean and the staff was awesome and had just been newly renovated so I was suer excited to have brand new digs!! I would stay here again! Kids will love the pools and theme pirate pool.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but the sofa pull out needs improving.”
Reviews.Author: simplyjewelry
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay, despite the cold. We were disappointed we didn't get a chance to use the water park, they ended up turning the water off..............but it was so cold it was understandable. The resort is well maintained as was the unit. However, the sofa pull out is dreadful. They really need a better mattress on it for such a high class resort. We found everyone very helpful and firendly.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great stay!”
Reviews.Author: small1029
Reviews.Content: Would definitely stay there again. Loved the pools and the amentities. The hotel room was clean and very spacious. We liked having the fridge, sink, and microwave...used that alot. Just had a queen room with pull out. The only complaint I have was the sofa bed was AWFUL. I mean it was really bad. My young kids 7 and 5 slept on it without complaint but if you had older kids or adults that needed to sleep on it...I'd definitely pass it was awful. We will be going back again on our next trip to Orlando. We loved the location. I will just get a different room this time...pay to have two beds instead of the pull out.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: Lynn50
Reviews.Content: While my grandaughters loved the pools and the activities I had some qualms about our room. I requested a 2 bedroom overlooking the pool and we did get that. The view was wonderful. But, as an owner here I was very disappointed to have been given one of the older non-renovated rooms. We did not have the flat screens I told my family we would have and the TV in the 2nd bedroom did not even work. Since the kids were in the LR mostly they watched that one instead. It's a breeze to the parks and convenient to everything else. Unfortunately we were also there during "lovebug" season and housekeeping did an awful job of keeping the hallways to the rooms cleaned. They should have been hosed down everyday and I don't think they were ever touched. I also left comments and I never heard from anyone. Again, as an owner here....we were disappointed. I would go back.......if changes were made......but we might try the other new Marriott timeshare being built over by the JW Marriott next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: joelcohena
Reviews.Content: The rooms are great and the location is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints; Marriott has a good product”
Reviews.Author: abcjjl
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Sat. 12/18/10 for 5 nights, checking out on Thu. 12/23/10. 3 boys 7, 10, 13 with us their mom and dad. We were given 2 choices for a one bedroom. A 2nd floor new (less than 2 years) unit near the main pool and a 4th floor unit that had been recently refurbished located overlooking the slide at the 'other' pool. The check-in person had zero personality and would not really commit to which location or unit was preferable (road noise/location in the property/size of new unit vs. the refurb, etc.) and believe me we tried to get her help. We decided on the refurb unit that was located in bldg 28, room 46. Mainly, because it appeared to be farther from I-4 and its accompanying road noise. The road noise was minimal but please be aware that this resort is located adjacent to the interstate. With some bldgs being somewhat closer than the others to the road. Unit was in very good shape. Quite large living/dining room area. TVs are not HD and the unit in the living area is a large floor box type set. Plenty of channels (not that we were there to watch TV). Patio was nicely screened in variety. Master bedroom was a little small but the bathroom was a nice size. The bed was above average in comfort but the pillows were beyond bad. The washer and dryer was put to good use. The dishes, glasses, towel situation, dishwasher, etc were all excellent. We received service everyday. I left a daily tip, not sure if this made a difference or not. On Monday, we did return about 3:00 pm and the room had not been touched. I called the front deslk and was connected to house-keeping. We left for the evening and upon on our return we had about 8 towels and wash clothes. It was almost funny. Everyday after that we had product coming our of our ears. The room was completely serviced ie., beds made, trash emptied, shampoo and soap replenished. The 'secondary' pool was very nice. The kids enjoyed the slide and the hot tub on 2 occasions. This was primarily a park stoming trip so we spent very little time at the resort. Kids did play some of the games provided. And on Saturday evening upon our arrival the lady overseeing the putt- putt let them play for free. It was, I believe $25 for the length of your stay or $5 a round. Another evening they inquired about playing and the person there told them the costs. We found out about this later, but, again, we just did not really spend a ton of time at the resort. The front guards were very much on the ball, they always greeted us even though we used our cards to access the property at the gate away from their guard bldg. No matter the time of day (and believe me we got back after midnight a couple of times) you got a friendly smile and wave. Security is a good thing. They were really on the ball. We had interaction with a couple of the house-keepers when we were arriving on Saturday and they were very friendly. Odd that the front desk person was so blah but the other people we encountered were great. Joanne at the pool was very nice and friendly making sure wer had plenty of pool towels.We observed her asking a group of 'mental giant' adults if she could get them some paper cups for their beers that they had setting on the pool deck around the hot tub in glass bottles. She handled it great. You would think that the giant letters on the rules advising of no glass at the pool would have been a clue but not to these geniuses. No matter Joanne solved the problem. We were not really bothered by any sales folks. We were told that we had a free photo session upon check-in and there was one message left later in the week reminding us of this but we had no interest. No other calls were received, if there had been we would have just politely declined. We have stayed at several Marriott properties in the Hilton Head Island area. It is a quick jaunt down from Greenville, SC for us. We always pay cash. We are DVC owners with HHI as our home resort. This was a relatively last minute trip...decided in October so we just couldn't hook up on a DVC resort. We paid $149 a night, with taxes it came to around $850 for the 5 nights. We felt that the quality of the accomodations were a very good value. The trip to the parks is a breeze from this location. You hang a left out of the resort go less than a mile, take a left and you jump on the interstate and in 2 exits you are exiting to most things Disney. Coming back was just as easy. We did miss the Disney resort 'magic' but, again, we spent so little time in our unit that it did not make that a big thing. We still visited some of the Disney resorts for various things. Even rode the buses and the monorail on a couple of occastions. This was the 1st time in years that I had spent money to park at the parks.($14 a day, ouch). We did head over to Disney's Old Key West Resort on Thursday morning after check-out. My brother had a studio for us to use (we did not even sleep in the room, leaving Orlando around 5:00PM getting home around 1:15AM on Friday morning). We were able to get right into a room by taking a handicapped room. It was a nice wrap-up to our trip.The Disney pool was much warmer than the heated Marriott pool. Back to Harour Lake, this is a nice property for hitting the parks and it also has some nice amenities. You should not be disappointed with this property.Our rating of very good would be about 93 out of a hundred, a very high B+ or a low A-.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of room for reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Metro_Engineer
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a 2 bedroom suite at the Marriott Harbour Lake property for a week during winter break. Suite included two large bedrooms, one with a king sized bed, the other with two queens. Suite also had a relatively large kitchen, dining area and a large living room. Suite was dated but clean. TV was a large screen model of early 90's vintage. Good wireless signal. We experienced unseasonably cold weather during our visit and were unable to enjoy the pools, but noticed that this did not dissuade many other families. Lots of noise, but it is a family resort. I did not mind the late night karaoke parties, or noise from the pool. Others might, so I highlight it. My only annoyance is the heavy sales pressure for time shares, pictures, vacation club, etc. It was not too bad, about once a day, but I don't care for this approach. Very close to parks, and driving was short and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: SunnyState1
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property just around the corner from SeaWorld. Gated property with friendly guards that make you feel welcome and safe. Ultra friendly staff and well maintained property. GREAT place for KIDS (young and old). Fun pools, slides and hot tub. Outdoor billards and ping pong tables, mini golf, bar and Starbucks coffee. Updated and clean rooms with keywest style decor and plenty of space. 5 Star bedding. My 6 yr old and I had a wonderful time, got a great deal through Orbitz and will be back again soon. Thank you SeaWorld and Harbour Lake!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent for Families”
Reviews.Author: FiveTravFromMi
Reviews.Content: I found this location to have plenty of activities for families. The property was very well managed. Our unit was clean, equipped with DVD players in Master, Living, and Second Bedroom. The kitchen was well stocked with everything we needed. Our children enjoyed both pools. While we didn't get a chance to use the water slide in the one pool, it looked like it would have been a blast. The location is right by the Sea World exit off of I-4, which makes you centered between Disney and Universal. So, in a nutshell, if you're going to do all things Theme Park in Orlando, this is an ideal location. We did visit the Magic Kingdom and Universal during our stay, and found that we were 10 minutes from anywhere we were going. Another big plus - for me atleast - was that they had a very good wireless internet connection that I had to use during our stay for a conference presentation. Nobody had a clue that I was doing my presentation from the comforts of my room in the Marriott Harbour Lake. We did stay in a unit in building 30. After having walked the property with my kids ranging in age of 6 to 10, I would say that it was a very well laid out resort. It's not as large as others I have stayed at. You can easily walk to anything you want to go to within the resort. My wife and I loved the bed, as did our kids. We never used the pull-out bed in the living room couch, but did notice it was there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Calikiss313
Reviews.Content: We come every year and it just gets better and better! Pools are awesome and my kids love the pirate ship and big water slide! Activities are great and there's something for every age group. The activities program was by far the best I've seen at any resort! We especially enjoyed the fishing tournament, deal or no deal, beer tasting, ice cream. My little ones enjoyed the puzzle activities. Josh and his staff (especially Kelsey, Stacy, and Brittney) made for our best vacation so far! Front desk staff was friendly and knowledgable as well as bartenders.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not as high as #4 hotel in Orlando in my opinion”
Reviews.Author: vjs5150
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th trip to Disney and always seek out a Marriott vacation club property wherever we vacation because they are so spacious for families that you don't mind spending time in the rooms. As noted in some reviews this property was not built by Marriott but by Horizons which Marriott purchased, hence the rooms didn't meet the standards of what we are used to. First, the 2 bedroom villas are smaller than typical villas at other Marriott VCs (about 75% of the typical room), still plenty of room but we were a little disappointed upon first impression, also, the patio is screened in and bland, but the unit was clean and had all the other amenities. The TVs don't have HD. I do have to say though that the staff was very good, the activities by the pool on a daily basis were run very well and entertaining for children aged 4-11. Also we have a 3 year old and the pools were great for young children. Our kids got tired of the splash area and pirate ship after the first day, however, the zero depth pool allowed my wife and I to enjoy relaxing in lounge chairs by the pool watching our 3 year old from a short distance, so that was very nice. Also, the pools were heated to 84 degrees which was great as this can make or break swimming for kids. So here is the skinny - the rooms are average (relative to Marriott VC standards), but the pool is great if you have very young children. If your kids are older, I would recommend Cypress Harbour where we stayed twice before which is right across the street, however their pools were not as warm on the flip side.

Reviews.Title: “Really great time”
Reviews.Author: dz4
Reviews.Content: interval exchage stay, booked 9 months in advance good - close to everything, nice 1 bed/bath/kitchen/washer/dryer/2 tv/balcony/free parking/free internet/sofa bed/ walmart, grocery, drug store nearby/ restaurants near by/amenities like pirate ship and billiards good/staff is helpful generally bad - no HDTV signal/just basic cable/pre-authorized my debit card without my knowledge; apparently a policy exists to notify guests but I fell through the cracks/toilet backed up, plunger collapses instead of "plunging"/ no jacuzi tub, old style shower head/water could tast better/"white sand beach" needs heavy maintence

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: NicoleT2010
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this resort twice already and have our third trip planned in a couple weeks. We have a toddler and a baby and we always bring the in-laws. We go to Orlando to go to Disney World and Sea World. This hotel is only a few minutes away from both. The two bedroom rooms are so spacious, with washer and dryer, dish washer, dishes... It's like a furnished condo. Always very clean, the staff is very nice and helpful, the pool areas are so much fun with the spray parks for the kids. The food in the dining area is very good. The last trip I left my phone charger in the room and I called after I got home- they overnighted it to me at no cost. I just can't say enough. Oh, and the price is so reasonable for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “You HAVE to go here if you have young children!!”
Reviews.Author: Laurie89
Reviews.Content: We were in building 29, very clean and neat, lots of room, everything we needed for the week, and the room was cleaned twice while we were there, which is more than any other time share we've been to. As far as the pools and activities....FUN, FUN, FUN!! our kids - 3 boys - 7, 4 & 1, all had a fabulous time. Lots to do, didn't have to go anywhere else. We did disney one day, and the rest of the week stayed at the resort. Lots of fun activites for the boys, games, live music, free pool tables and ping pong, kid sized basketball and of course the great pools. Beautiful grounds...cobblestone roads, beautiful trees and landscape. NO COMPLAINTS! (well maybe one, it would be nice to have a hot tub in the master suite) Very friendly staff - we plan on returning.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic- facilities, staff, room -everything”
Reviews.Author: eleanorferguson
Reviews.Content: We have a 7yr old and an 18 mth old. Rooms were great, pools were fantastic for little and big kids! staff very friendly. Adjacent to main roads to Disney, sea world (2ooyds away) and Universal.

Reviews.Title: “We are not a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DoubleDUk
Reviews.Content: Arrived to find beetles in the bed and in bathroom and mosquitoes in the room. Dead insects on bathroom floor stayed there for four days by which time we realised that beds were not being made up just pulled back. When I enquirer about the lack of housekeeping service was told - we are not a hotel we are a timeshare facility. The room decor is good, the pools are great for kids, but when I booked at a rate which is one of the highest in Orlando - the Marriott website did not state that it was not a hotel!! If you want a hotel with services such as bed linen changed more then once a week then this is not the place for you. As we have our grandson with us the pirate ship is great but I could have saved a lot of money by staying at a hotel! Why is it categorised as a hotel on trip advisor if the staff say it is not a hotel????

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: donhol27
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed at the Marriott Harbour Lake resort for the second time and it was even better than our first stay. The resort has so much to offer for families. Check-in was smooth and easy. The front desk staff are so friendly and helpful. We arrived late at night and requested a pack and play for our daughter. It was delivered to our room within 10 minutes. The rooms are clean and well stocked with things to make your stay comfortable. There is a Publix grocery store 5 minutes away, so stocking up on supplies is very easy. Our only complaint with the rooms is the lack of comfort you get from the beds and pillows. Woke up a bit sore on some mornings..The grounds are kept beautiful and the pools are very clean. The spray ground and water slides are great. Our kids liked it more at the resort than going to the parks. The resort is located close by Seaworld. It was a 4 minute drive..There is a trolley stop across the street that takes you on I-Drive and to the surrounding areas. Disney is a 10-15 minute drive. There are plenty of daily activities for kids at the resort. You get a schedule of them at check-in. My daughter painted Halloween magnets and my son made his own tie dye shirt. There is an additional charge for these things, but it is worth it.. We would recommend this resort and will be returning again..

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable quality family oriented time share”
Reviews.Author: mylastdance
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this resort for a week in October. Chose this resort out of a few because it got good tripadvisor reviews (and no cockroaches, which I heard were problems in other orlando area resorts). This resort was perfect. It was just my sister and I in a studio room. It was 2.5 times the size of the Disney Value hotel we stayed at for one night we were in orlando. The room is clean and spacious. Had a nice balcony where you could sit at a table with screens to keep out pests and a fan for hot humid days. Didn't have a big kitchen just a microwave and fridge but that worked out since we spent every day in the theme parks. Had enough closet and drawer space for 2 L.A. girls and all our tons of clothes. It was nice to have the living room and dining table to hang at after days of walking through the parks. The only 2 things that bothered me about our awesome room were 1. the bed. I am a heavy sleeper and can sleep most anywhere (even on airplanes somtimes) but somehow the bed was not that great. It wasn't uncomfortable per se but something about it took me hours to fall asleep even after spending 9+ hours walking in the sun at walt disney world. Also, the walls are paper thin. We were in the front of the resort and heard cars coming in and crossing the bridge loudly. Could definitely hear kids running and shouting above and below us late at night or early in the morning. Other than that (which was tolerable) the room was great and a nice place to get away from the disney crowds and relax. The jacuzzis were nice after walking so much. The pools are cool and have slides, a pirate ship!!!!, and other water splashing things that are VERY fun for kids. So fun that kids were there all the way till pool close at 11pm running around. Did not spend alot of time at the resort besides in the room but we did see lots of activities, like ice cream and karaoke. But I noticed there was not alot to do for young adults like us unless you're with family. Just a few pool tables :/ Did not eat at the pool bar but it was decently priced with lots of drinks! It looked good. Close proximity to grocery store and OUTLET shopping! These outlets were open late (11pm) and always busy. Not far and very conveniently located from the theme parks (universal and disney) Lots of tasty food around also. One thing also kinda of strange but a guy got stuck in the elevator for 20 minutes while we were there (right after I used it) :O! All in all I would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for all ages”
Reviews.Author: jgilmore123
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at Harbour Lake (Oct 2010). This is a first rate resort. We stayed in a two bedroom, two bath villa. The rooms were clean and the kitchen was large enough to cook for a large family. The staff is friendly and helpful. The two pools are definitely geared toward smaller children (I have a 7 and 5 year old) - but there are other activities for older kids - 2 pool tables, 2 ping pong tables, 2 basketball courts, 3 or 4 whirlpool spas, a volleyball court and video game room. I must have played the miniature golf course 15 times. The resort is located close to I-4 within a couple of blocks of Seaworld and only 1 exit (off of I-4) from Disney World. I had to use the free Wi-Fi a couple of times and it worked flawlessly (AT&T). I highly recommend this hotel/resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for our Family!!”
Reviews.Author: tripberger
Reviews.Content: Marriot's Harbour Lake was perfect for us!! The room was clean and plenty big. The staff was nice. With the 2 pool areas, we never felt overcrowded. Our 3 year old absolutely loved the pirate ship...he still talks about it!! There were plenty of activities to choose from. Close drive to all the Disney attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family getaway with comprehensive Marriott Vacation Club benefits for kids.”
Reviews.Author: EZEdChicago
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at two Marriott condo developments in the Orlando area, Cypress Harbour (CH) in August 2009 and Harbour Lake (HL) this year, October 2010. We loved CH's quality, amenities, kids programming, and value. The only reason we stayed at HL this year instead of CH was HL's top rating for kids on this site, which we found to be justied. At both properties we stayed in one of the two-bed, two-bath units with both of our young children. Overall everything was excellent, with superior accomodations, spacious and well thought-out units and beautiful pools and grounds. While similar, we liked the Harbour Lake (HL) rooms slightly better than Cypress Harbour (CH), even though the CH struck us as slightly newer. Both are very spacious, with three TVs, screened-in porch, separate TV and eating areas, large (for a condo) kitchens, and washer/dryer. HL layout was better b/c 2nd bathroom connected to foyer area, which provides a powder room for guest access, and it had a corner-banquette instead of a free-standing dining room table that used the space better. CH master bath felt more spacious--doublesinks are always nice, as did the porch (octagonal- vs. rectangular at HL). CH feels more tropical and secluded than HL due to its more lush, tree-heavy landscaping. Biggest difference: While CH was great for kids, the pools at HL really set it apart--great water slide, great kiddie pool/jet play areas, pirate ship, etc. Location is great for both properties (across the street from one another)--easy (driving) access to everything, right off I-4 and a couple exits to all the Disney properties, within a mile of Sea World, high end outlet mall shopping, and International Drive with its numerous restaurants and other retail options. HL pros/cons: Liked best: Service ultimately came shining through, as evidenced by the near-immediate response we received to fix the porch sliding door which came off its track. Kids pools were great, and structured events were well received. Liked least: Check-in was not smooth, requiring 25 minutes to finally get sorted. Also, the unit was missing two TV remotes, which were finally replaced but we had to ask a couple times.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly but Nice for Anyone”
Reviews.Author: brianrouse
Reviews.Content: Traded a timeshare through Interval International for a week in a 2BR/2bath unit in Building 12. The unit was nice with good appliances, flat screen TV's in living room and both bedrooms. Lots of family friendly activities offered but kept to ourselves and were not bothered at all by them or timeshare reps. The pools will always have kids, but most days they are at the parks so never an issue dozing off in a lounge. I researched a lot before booking and can say if you have a family of young children you will be thrilled with the pool areas but as a couple or adults travelling together you will enjoy the nice resort.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Inella05
Reviews.Content: This condo is great. If you have children they will love the pirate ship water slide. It is around the corner from Sea World. You are in the vicinity of all the attractions. You can get on the trolley right in front of the condo. The rooms are beautiful and they are very clean. I love the decor in the rooms. I would recommend this condo to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “The best pool for kids!”
Reviews.Author: tricky_ricky_toronto
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel thats close to Sea World, Disney and The Premium Outlets - look no further! Great location, rooms were adequate with great kitchen space. But thats not what you come here for. The pools are both fantastic - the pirate ship is certainly the reason you come. My 3.5 year old son loved it. The other pool and interactive water was also great, as was walking around the property. Will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “A great holiday resort”
Reviews.Author: DavrosSouthampton
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for a family holiday. We were two adults and one twelve year old boy travelling from the UK. We stayed the last week of July and the first week of August in a two bedroom villa. The rooms are massive by European standards. The rooms are very clean and indeed the whole resort is spotless. Perhaps it’s the American attention to detail but everything worked. The barbeques have the gas on a direct feed, no bottles to run out, and they work. Every morning they’re cleaned by high pressure hose and are spotless for the next person. When we were there it certainly wasn’t packed and you could easily get a sun lounger. The staff are friendly and helpful but you don’t have a lot of contact with them if you’ve hired a car and are out doing your own thing. Towels are provided at the pool and the fridge has ice on tap. You just have to remember to switch on the icemaker. There’s also a washing machine and dryer in your room so you don’t have to pack the suitcase to the brim. It’s a gated community so there are security personel checking you in and out which provides piece of mind although check the window locks because we found a couple that were broken. The various apartments are arranged in blocks four storeys high. Just remember the first floor is the American ground floor. It’s about two minutes from Discovery Cove and Seaworld. Everything else is only a short drive away. The only very small criticism would be this. There’s no provisions store on site. There’s a big Publix nearby but it would be good if there was somewhere on site to pick up milk and the basic provisions without having to get in the car. Also the crazy golf costs a fortune unless you buy a season ticket for your entire stay. If you just want one game it’s pricy. Not sure why this needs to be the case. However there’s basketball courts and table tennis. In other venues these would be dilapidated but here everything is new and well maintained. So if that’s all the complaints then you can see that this is a first rate resort. If you’ve got kids and you’re doing the whole Disney, Universal, swimming with dolphins’ thing then come here. You won’t be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: SueI5
Reviews.Content: Love, Love, Love this resort. My husband and I and three kids; 9,6,4 stayed here from Sept 6-11. We stayed in a two bedroom villa and it was perfect. Everything was in mint condition and everything you could possible need. From the top of the line cookware down to the dish detergent to run the dishwasher. The entire staff was so nice and friendly. My kids could have just spent everyday at the pools. Lots of fun activities for them do and only minutes from the parks. would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: rheimerm
Reviews.Content: We had a four night stay at Marriott Harbour Lake, and WOW! Very impressed with the accommodations, and the pool areas were just amazing! We spent one whole day at the pool with the kids (ages 2 and 4). Great bar and food poolside. Lots of activities for kids and adults. (Magic show and s'mores for kids, beer tasting and football for adults.) You can rent DVDs in the lobby of the hotel. Entire place is clean and maintained very well. 10-15 minute drive to Magic Kingdom. Sea World is right around the corner. Downtown Disney is 5-10 minutes away. We would definitely stay here again. The entire family loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Place To Stay !”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for three nights after residing in Disney for the previous five earlier in the month. Let me tell you, this place is the Ritz Carlton for the same amount of money as a moderate resort within the park. The location here only adds 5 more minutes to the parks by car and you live like a king ! The rooms are huge, well appointed and the pool areas are quite elaborate with plenty of kids activities. I would highly encourage anyone to stay here. I know when we return we will !

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!!!”
Reviews.Author: IWANT2TRAVLNOW
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Orlando yesterday after a 7 night stay at the Harbour Lake and had a fantastic vacation, picked this hotel mainly on the tripadvisor reviews.. Check in was super fast, room was great. We were in building 12 not sure if it has been redone yet, I am going to say no but still very nice. We were at the very end on the 6th floor so very quiet... We went to Sea World and Aquatica this trip and the location of this resort to those attractions was great. Super short drive time... We loved the pool areas, my 4 year old son was in heaven. We loved the water slide and the pirate ship. My 4 yr old loved the buckets that dumped water on you. They have a mineature golf course that was great. We played in the evenings because it was a little cooler and for $25.00 for the whole week you cannot beat that. The room did not seem to cool off real fast, granted when we first got there it was very, very hot but the air conditioner could have worked a little better. The other thing that really bothered me about the room were the locks on the door. They have a deadbolt which is great but the bar lock was just above the main lock and very easy for a 4yr old to open that was a little nerve racking considering his room was closet to the door. It should have been placed up much higher so only the adults could open it. He is not one to open up doors but still you never know. Also it would be nice if they had an indoor restaurant for people who do not want to cook every evening and who do not want to sit outside in the 100 degree heat. Not many restaurants real close. I did like that they had gates at the entrance. When we returned from a day of fun someone always came to the door of the security office to welcome us back, I loved that, very nice. They do have grills that I did see people using. All in all the resort was a wonderful experience, would definetly stay again. I do not think that you would be very disappointed staying here especially if you have children. We loved it!!!! Also they had free wifi so that was great too and it worked well!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place For Kids”
Reviews.Author: MyCues
Reviews.Content: My wife & I, together with our daughter and two granddaughters (aged 8 & 3) stayed at the Marriotts Harbour Lake Resort for two weeks while we enjoyed the Disney World theme parks & water parks. The friendliness of all the staff, the standard of the accomodation (two bedroom apartment) and the amenities, including two child friendly swimming pools, could not be better. There was never any complaining when we told the children we were leaving the theme parks to go back to the resort!! The convenience of the resort to all the attractions was great - 15 minutes to most of the Disney attractions & 5 minutes to Seaworld.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay . . .Again!”
Reviews.Author: bebxs3
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th year at Marriott Habour Lake(formerly Horizons) In Orlando, Florida. We travel this year with our now 8 and 10 year and my mom. We called the resort 2 weeks ahead and asked for a newer unit and one of their new buildings(this is something I suggest you do before to go). The staff was more than happy oblige. Newer unit, 2bed, 2full bath, kitchen, living area, and screened-in balony(lanei). The washer and dryer is always a plus because I never have to go home with dirty clothes!!! The kitchen has almost all the comforts of home(pots, pan, cups, plates, etc.) and a dishwasher to boot. We stop off at the Walmart on Turkey Lake Road before we check-in. There's also a Publix nearby as well. We save so much $$ cooking in every now and again. 15 to 20 mins from all the attractions(Disney, Seaworld, Universal) Can even see the fireworks at night from the balcony at night. There's always something to do for the kids on the property either for free or a nominal fee. So if you are tired from the parks, you can always sit at the pool or in the jacuzzi and watch the kids have fun. My two never want to leave. Head photographer was a little peeved I guess because we didn't want to purchase a package( we just did't like the pics they took this year lol) but that was the ONLY "hiccup" in our stay. Everyone else( the staff) was wonderful and friendly. Oh, forgot, fast and free WiFi too!!! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “We would come back again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: Harassedmumoftwo
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a party of seven with 3 elderly grandparents and 2 young children. This resort was ideal. The staff are sooooo friendly, from the moment you arrive until the moment that you leave. My mother-in-law was 'under the weather' for a day during our stay and when they heard that she was choosing to spend the day alone in the apartment recouperating, the staff phoned the appartment 3 times to check that she was ok! Nothing is too much trouble for these people. The activities were fun, although we didn't have time to join in as much as we would have liked, and the pool complex is fantastic - our kids didn't want to leave. The only niggle is that there is not a proper restaurant on site, just the poolside bar which serves food. Having said that, the food there was great and there are so many local restaurants that you are spoilt for choice. The appartment was clean and spacious and the washer/dryer was a real bonus, as was the free WiFi. We would go back again tomorrow if we could.

Reviews.Title: “Harbour Lakes was perfect for our Grandson's 1st Disney Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Robinann
Reviews.Content: We traded one of our timeshare weeks for Marriott's Harbour Lake. We wanted to take our daughter and our 4 year old grandson to Disney and chose Harbour Lake because of the positive reviews on tripadvisor. We were extremely pleased with the resort! Having a two bedroom, 2 bathroom suite with a full kitchen, spacious living room, terrace and laundry facilities is the only way to travel with a family or extended family. Harbour lakes is the perfect destination for families with young children. The resort offered a kids club with numerous activities, miniature golf, a small arcade, a playground, basketball court, a ping pong table, a pool table, two pools, water slides, sprinkler park with a dump bucket, a pirate ship pool and hot tubs. The pools are great and open till 10 and 11pm every night, wonderful for a late night dip after spending the day at the Parks. We had a 5th floor room with our screened in porch overlooking the interactive pirate ship pool, unfortunately we spent so much time at Disney World that we didn't get to the pool all that often. Everyone I spoke to before our trip said we needed to stay on Disney Property, but I'm very happy we didn't. Harbour Lake was about 15 minutes from the Magic Kingdom and a easy trip to the park with our rental car. I also loved having 2 bedrooms and the extra living space, plus we would have spent so much more to stay in a Disney Hotel. There was so much to do at the resort that next time we take our grandchildren to Disney we want to stay at Harbour Lake and spend a few days enjoying the resort.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value"”
Reviews.Author: VacationMom0242
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Harbour Lake for 5 nights at the end of August. I was very pleased with the hotel as were my husband and 2 sons, ages 6 and 5. The location was very good for us, as we visited Sea World, Aquatica, Universal and Islands of Adventure. The size of the rooms was AWESOME (we stayed in a 1 bedroom villa) as compared to a regular hotel room. I went shopping at Publix when we first arrived and kept our kitchen stocked with breakfast, lunch and snacks. This really helped to keep the overall cost down. The king size bed was extremely comfortable, but the pull out sofa was flimsy and the blankets were not soft. The pools were a huge hit and the poolside bar made great drinks that were reasonably priced. Everyone at the hotel was very pleasant and no-one pestered me about buying a time share there. Overall, if you are looking for a hotel off of Disney or Univeral's property, and you have young children, I would absolutely consider staying at Harbour Lake!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families but wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: unvoyageur22
Reviews.Content: I was not satisfied with my recent stay at this resort. I have stayed at many Marriott properties and have never experienced roaches in my room. We stayed at the property for 4 nights and saw roaches everyday. I realize that there may be occasional sitings of bugs/spiders due to the weather, etc., but roaches are totally unacceptable. I brought the issue up to the attention of the staff and was told many times that they would spray the room only to find roaches when we returned. In addition, the staff was not helpful in resolving the issue and were very nonchalant about our displeasure. This is not what I would expect at a Marriott property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and location”
Reviews.Author: scorro1
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this location from Aug 24, 2010 to August 27th. The room was clean and perfectly sized. The pools were fantastic for adventures post theme parks and the water slide was a great touch and even available for adults :). The staff was extremely helpful and kind. The free resort photo was an added bonus. If I were to go to Orlando again, I would only consider staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great For Kids, Great Location but could use updating”
Reviews.Author: RPGinDC
Reviews.Content: We had a spacious 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom condo - the unit was very big and we had plenty of room. Pros: Big units, lots of space and privacy for everyone. Area is very convenient to just about everything - Disney, Sea World, good shopping, restaurants and the airport. Free wifi is fantastic and a nice feature. Lots of activities during the day but we were never around enough to take part in the ones that looked fun for kids. Grounds are nicely kept, beautiful lake area and lots of ducks, fish, very pretty. 2 great pool areas for kids .... but no real pool area for swimming. Pirate ship and water slide were fun for all of us though they can get very crowded. There is also a mini golf on site but it was $25 per family - unlimited use but we did not think we would use it enough to make it worthwhile. Washer/dryer in unit was nice, but would have been nice to have a start set of detergent. Cons: Our unit really needed updating, the carpet was frayed and coming up in places, we had several cracked tiles. The old formica countertops in kitchen and baths need replacement, appliances also could be updated, and the furniture - couches/chairs are also fairly worn, The biggest con was the bed, it was old and ours backs were killing us when we left, which has never happened before. Also would be nice to have a restaurant on site, the poolside grill has very limited selection of pool/bar food. Overall, we had a nice visit. If the units were updated, it would be fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Again!!”
Reviews.Author: barnmanNewYork
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time that we have stayed here and we love it. We two children, 8 and 6 and they absolutely love it. They never even asked to go to any of the parks. Probably the only thing that I think they are missing is offering a "kiddie camp". This would give sometime for the parents to have some alone time. We will continue to come back here and I would recommend it to anyone with children!!!

Reviews.Title: “good!”
Reviews.Author: jmp4plus1
Reviews.Content: I had an awesome time at the hotel that I stayed at because the hotel that I stayed at ws awesome. Thats why the hotel that I staye at was awesome. It was awesome because it was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “MY FAVORITE PLACE!!”
Reviews.Author: weavfam
Reviews.Content: We own here. I fell in love at first sight. It has never let me down!! This place is spectacular!! We have 14, 4 and 2 yr old boys. They all love it!! We traded this year to take the family to Cancun (our first love) and were sadly missing Harbour Lake! We can'twait for next summer...might even go over Christmas. Soooo many activities and fun and entertainment for the kiddies!! Cuz when the kids are happy-mom and dad are happy and it makes a BETTER vacation!!! We couldn't relax in Cancun because the kids missed the Pirate Ship!! We will never stray from the Pirates again!!!! Constant fun for young ones-you never have to leave the property!! Often imitated...never duplicated!! We have seen a few faux pirate ships-but that's it. They can't deliver that wonderful pool side pirate fun!! Take the whole family.....they won't be disappointed. Highly highly recommended!! I will continue to enjoy coming here for the rest of my life!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT RESORT FOR FAMILIES WITH YOUNG CHILDREN”
Reviews.Author: hole13
Reviews.Content: What can I say ! I'ts a Marriott Resort !!! Resort is designed with children in mind ! we have a 5 yr old and we could not get her away from the pools !! Fantastic for children , but lacks for adults ! If you go to Orlando it's for the little ones and little ones at heart ! We were very pleased with our stay , if we did not have children , It would be different ! Go enjoy the resort and if you have children beware you might not get them to leavethe pools! Had a great time as a FAMILY !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant place for families! will be back for sure!”
Reviews.Author: AlexWacla
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel past July with family for 10 days and loved it! room (2 suite room) is big, is clean, has all you would ask or need (full equiped kitchen, fridge w/freezer, washer/dryer / huge beds / great shower, dinner table, all appliances you might think of, etc). Despite been in front of the pool, that closes 11pm BTW, shutting the window sufficed to be sillent, which is a plus too. Room service is ok, but not brilliant. Pool is great for kids, but I haven't seen people cleaning it, so got a bit worried to take my son out there all days - feel they need to have a morning or night, at least twice a week to clean the pool. Overall loads of pros and few things to polish/improve. Missing my days out there!

Reviews.Title: “this is very helpful to see if you would like to stay at the harbor lake marriot in orland florida.”
Reviews.Author: partygurl01
Reviews.Content: okay well my stay at this hotel "resort" was nice. oh and i had the newest building. which is buliding 30 & 31. but at one of the pools there was a lifeguard that was well wierd. Jo-ann would blow her whistle almost very 2 minutes. she actully got in the water with her clothes on to turn off the slide! the slide wasn't even suppose to be turned off! also if you get a room next to the elevator well you are going to hear it all night long! but besides that the service there was nice! one of the lifeguards "Gary" was very polite and nice! so i would recomend it! p.s. it is a very nice resort for kids!!!

Reviews.Title: “Definetly Going Back”
Reviews.Author: UhOhAndreaOh
Reviews.Content: This was our first time coming to Harbour Lake and was absolutley our best stay. The hotel room was like an apartment and had its own kitchen, washer-dryer machine, and a mini living room. There was multiple pools-one with a big slide, pirate ship, mini pool, mini water slide, and a small jacuzzi. But be careful in the pools, it doesn't look like the staff cleans it very often and you wouldn't want to see what's in that water. The staff in the front office is very friendly and the house keepers are very polite. The hotel is approx. 20 minutes away from DisneyWorld and I think on the same street as Aquatica and Sea World. But overall i think its worth going to.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic property”
Reviews.Author: slgerals
Reviews.Content: First time staying at this property as well as a property of this type. This was nothing but impressive from start to finish. The staff was very friendly, the room (2 bedroom suite, 1 King and 2 queens) was a perfect size for a family of four, there was a lot to do at the facility as well as many local attractions within a short distance (some even walking distance). There were a couple minor negatives, close proximity to I-4 created a lot of noise (although this could not be heard in our room which was in the building closest to the highway) and there were the typical charges for some things that aren't advertised very well, i.e. Miniature golf is $5.00 per round or $25 per family for unlimited rounds. Several activites also included a charge but most were nominal. Food prices were comparable to local restaurants, without the typical hotel upcharge. Overall, spent four great nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great fun!”
Reviews.Author: allaboutfun76
Reviews.Content: We stay at Harbour lake every other year when we visit Disney/Universal parks. We don't ususually plan to spend much time at the hotel on our vacations but after the first time there we have changed that. The room is so spacious, comfortable and stylish, you feel like you are at home. You can even cook your meals or pop in a pizza,and rent movies to relax in the evening if you want. We usually get the 2 room suite with the kitchen. The kids(boys age 3 and5) and us. absolutely love the pools/slides and they want to spend the day there. There are plenty for adults to do as well including an eating area next to the pools. There are also activities for the kids. The location is a quick trip to any of the parks and the staff is always nice and helpful. We won't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time, will go back next year"”
Reviews.Author: ermedicmom
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Marriott Harbour Lakes last week as a getaway. We are somewhat local to the Orlando area (1hr 15min away) & we braved the notoriously crowded time of year. Since we booked last minute we were in a "studio" type room, basically a lockout. We knew it would be a little tight for a week but for just two adults and a 7yr old it wasn't too uncomfortable. There was a small bar type fridge, sink & microwave as well as a very nice coffemaker. There is no w/d in this type room but a free one very nearby with no waiting. The pools were fantastic. we stayed at the "big slide" pool most of the time, which along with the spray park was fenced in so it was very nice to be able to sit & read my book as my 7yr old knew not to go out of the fence without us. There was never an issue for seats even when the pool was a little full . Another nice thing is that you can bring your own food/drinks to the pool,although the food at the Harbor grill was very tasty and well priced for the area. Lots of activites throughout the day, we likes the Smores at the campfire and took advantage of the kids nite out one time. There are fees for some activities but many are free. The pirate ice cream bowl was well worth the $12 if you are there for the week. We hit the parks we had a 14day Fla Res Seaworld, Aquatca & Busch Gardens Tickets. We went to Aquatica & seaworld for a half a day each and Busch Gardens ( no crowds-very nice) for one day and never went back to the Parks. Next year we will skip them all together. Keep in mind we live in the area and have "been there done that" many times in the past. Marriott Harbour Lakes was a great break from the crowds of Orlando-perfect for kids. Adults without kids may not care for it...there are ALOT of kids there. The property was clean & well kept as well. The free wireless was nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort kids. Short drive to see the Mouse”
Reviews.Author: TallTex_Austin
Reviews.Content: Spent six days straight chasing the Mouse. Harbour Lakes was undergoing some renovations but they did not get in our way or more importantly the kids way of fun. Staff was nice. Pool bar food and drinks lack a lot. Their Happy Hour specials are so weak I complained they forgot the tequila in my Margarita. I would eat and drink elsewhere. Any review that says their food is great, well I guess some folks say McDonalds makes the greatest hamburger in the world....it is all relative to what you have been exposed to. There are just too many places in and around the town to eat at. Remember too it is a vacation resort so buying your own and cooking your own is why we like condos and give us flexibility while on vacation. They had gas grills right outside our unit so we grilled out a few times. This resort is a great place for kids to have a great time. We chased the Mouse each day and we always take a natural break away for what ever park we are at to relax at the resort, eat, nap, etc. They kids are ready to go back to the park for night-time fun. Thus, we could have stayed around the resort more to enjoy its amenities but we were in Orland for the Mouse, not any other attraction just the Mouse. This place is a like down the street from Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It Again”
Reviews.Author: gorockets2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harbour Lake for a second time. This time with our 18 year old sons and my brothers family had a room next door. Had a blast for 6 days. We spent 3 days at disney parks, and spent 3 days at Harbour Lake. If you go to Disney, use International Drive,it was a 10/15 min. drive; I 4 was backed all the time we were there. The three days at the resort included: all teenagers not getting up until 11:30 am, 15 to 20 rounds of putt putt, best of 7 basketball tournament with the boys at the bb courts, 2 cookouts at their gas grills, many, many trips down the slide at the one pool, many games of ping pong and pool, great drinks at the bar, temporary tatoos, and I could go on and on. You could easily stay here and not leave for a week and have an incredible vacation. The thing I noticed about our 18 year old sons while they were at the resort, was they were acting like little kids again. I must also include how comfortable the beds are!!! Looking forward to visiting Harbour Lake in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location, lots of activities”
Reviews.Author: fcparma19
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Marriott Harbour Lake in June 2010. This hotel is in an excellent location since it is right near I-4 which takes you to all Disney related parks and it is down the street from Sea World. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Lots of things to do on site such as several pools, mini golf, gas and charcoal grills, playgrounds, rec rooms, etc. Our room was very clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Be More Pleased”
Reviews.Author: NCtourist
Reviews.Content: We spent five days at this resort last week. We had a marvelous package (five days for the price of three plus two fourteen-day tickets to Sea World ). The two bedroom condo was perfect for our family. Other reviews have mentioned the great pools and other amenities of the resort. It is beautifully landscaped and maintained. We were pleased with every feature of the facility. Response to a problem with a hair dryer was quick and efficient. We loved the full-sized kitchen and used it quite a bit during our stay. It was very well equipped. The washer-dryer in the unit was great for mid-week laundry. All in all, I don't think you could beat this resort especially for families with children. We did not participate in the daily scheduled activities but we saw some youngsters out on a scavenger hunt one morning who appeared to be having a marvelous time. There is much more to do here than one could possibly do. I don't think you could go wrong selecting this resort which is less than five minutes from Sea World and Discovery Cove.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1disneymama
Reviews.Content: we absolutely loved this resort...probably in our top 3 resorts in orlando. very child friendly...pools are great for little ones (i have a 5 yr old and 8 month old)...tons of activities for the kids and adults...cannot wait to go back. also, great service. we asked for a room with a pool view and they accomidated us. nothing but good things to say!!

Reviews.Title: “losing steam”
Reviews.Author: bergerb
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property 4 or 5 times now mostly w/ my kids. I have always been impressed by it (thus the return visits) but my enthusiam is less stong after this past visit. It still has large convenient rooms w/ kitchens, laundry, etc. But the decor is definitely showing its age. The table lampshade was waterstained in master bedroom, the kitchen table old and full of stains/scratches (same table that was there 3 and I think 4 yrs ago), the carpet had a big stain in one corner, the kitchen cabinet doors were falling off. The grounds are still very nice but the pool had cracked tiles in it. I have stayed at a number of other Marriott timeshare destinations in the past few yrs and they were nicer overall. Higher end decor, granite countertops rather than laminate, nicer appliances, etc. I know Marriott started out with this place being a Horizons, aimed more at families with more moderate prices, but if they are going to call this place a regular Marriott timeshare resort, they need to improve the decorations and furnishings. Stil a nice place w/ kids, much bigger rooms than average hotel room, though.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: Altitude9600
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early June, 2010. We had a two-bedroom unit overlooking the water slide. All I can say is this is the best place we have ever stayed with kids. The second bedroom had an attached full bath and two double beds which were extremely comfortable. The master suite was large and had a king sized bed and full bath. This was not quite as nice as the master suite at Marriott Cypress Harbour but the two pirate pools and the double beds in the kid's room make this resort better in our book. The pools: there are two pirate-themed pools. One has a huge pirate ship with smaller slides and the other (a couple hundred feet away) has a big splash park with towers and a two-story water slide. Both pools are kept at a very nice temperature and there are spas at each. We were there during a heat wave (95 degrees) and our 4 and 13 year olds spent much of their time in these pools. In fact, when we would leave an amusement park we would just say “Time for the pirate pools!” and they were thrilled to go “home”. There was always a towel attendant and plenty of available lounges and tables. The last night we were there we were watching Mythbusters and the big screen tv went out. I called the front desk at 9:05 pm. By 9:15 we had a brand new tv installed in our room and the old one had been taken away! I would absolutely book Harbour Lake every time it is available from now on, the water park features were worth a fortune to us as far as enjoyment, and ability to withstand the heat while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: eilmaguire
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. Staff friendly and well groomed. the food was outstanding. On checking in we were given a warm welcome, Rooms spacious and we have a stunning view. We will be back next year! Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous vacation for a family with young children”
Reviews.Author: 617Boston
Reviews.Content: We had a blast! This is a fantastic place to stay if you have younger children as the pools are a great source of fun. Our accommodation was perfect for us. We took a two bedroom apartment which offered us lots of space, privacy and everything functioned perfectly. We were in building 30 and this and Building 31 are fairly new and so all furnishings were in top condition. I also loved the enclosed private balcony/deck. It is worth asking for a higher floor as I think it might be a bit dingy on the ground floor. I should mention that these buildings are a little further away from the main action, but that suited us just fine. We ate a couple of meals at the Harbour Side but it was a bit on the heavy and greasy side. Fine for the odd meal when you can't be bothered but for the most part you will want to make other plans. Fortunately, there is a plethora of restaurants in the area and every taste is catered for. The pools are open till late at night so if you are seeking quiet at night, you may want to make a note of that when you reserve. Sea World and Acquatica are extremely close. A great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Simply a wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: thechief71
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first trip ever to Disneyworld. We had our two kids with us (9 and 7). The accommodations are great and our room was super! We stayed in bldg. 12 and had the two room villa. It was very clean and we looked out over the lake. It's perfectly located to get to WDW as we had a 15 minute drive each way. My kids loved the two pools but we didn't have time to use the miniature golf course. They have events planned throughout the day so that the kids stay entertained and they can earn coins to trade in for prizes at the end of the stay. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The poolside bar was a nice place to hang out. They have a decent happy hour special. For folks who say it looked old or was unkept, I'm not sure where you were on the property or what you expected. Perhaps there are other MVC properties that are higher end than this one but I was very impressed with the whole property and would stay there again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome family vacation spot!!”
Reviews.Author: chrissy46
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Marriot'sHarbor Lake resort and had an awesome time. The place is very family oriented and especially children friendly. The water park and pirate ship were a great hit with my grandchildren ages 7 & 9. They LOVED it. We also did the Disney thing but they were always fine to go back to the resort to enjoy the amenities!! My self included! Also loved the activites they had for children. The villa was perfect for us and all staff members were very accomodating. Didn't want to leave and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the kids, plenty to do.”
Reviews.Author: lexgjackson
