Reviews.Content: This place was great for children, with lots to do for them. If you do not have children with you, go to Marriotts Cyprus Harbour, far better, and quieter ....(across the road) Large resort, very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but can't believe it's #2 in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: GoMets
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5/12-5/17, 5 adults and 2 toddlers. Hotel is ok, similar to other MVC's. This one seems to be getting a little old though. Example: Our front door was broken, so it was hard to open (tough while holding twins). They seemed to have plans for expanding but stopped, so the boundaries are quite ugly and unkept. On the positive side, the location is great if you want to be central to WDW, Universal, Sea World, etc. The pools are very family friendly, and there is a mini-golf course on-site. The rooms are nice, large, and well equipped (kitchen, etc.). Again, not bad at all, just not something I would expect to be a Top 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!! The rooms are spacious and the grounds are amazing.”
Reviews.Author: CanadianMegan
Reviews.Content: I liked this resort a lot, especially if you have school-age children. The pools are amazing for kids and the pirate theme is really fun. The rooms are (generally) clean, spacious and modern. The only downside is they really need to steam clean their carpets more frequently. Our kids are crawling age and their knees and hands were really dirty (yuck). This is common at almost every hotel we have stayed at though. I thought the staff was very friendly, but really very little happened where we needed to interact with them so I have no idea how they handle problems. Not much for resort dining, but we mostly cook for ourselves so that was fine with us.

Reviews.Title: “What a Fabulous week”
Reviews.Author: flalover23
Reviews.Content: We were skeptical about visiting this resort last April only due to the fact that we had an absolutely fabulous time the year before at a Condo in Kissimmee. Were we wrong. The resort is perfect for families with young children, so young partiers this place is not for you; don t get me wrong, there is a wonderful poolside bar that serves iced cold beer and drinks as well as great food. The resort is huge and includes two huge pools; the first beside the poolside bar has a pirate ship as its focal point. The second pool is a bit smaller, but has a waterslide for young and old as well as a huge water splash park. Our children were kept busy by the staff every day and really enjoyed the ice cream sundaes every afternoon. The villas are huge, self contained and are modern and have fantastic views of the resort especially if you request one on the top level. The 18 hole miniature golf course is also a nice distraction from lazing by the pool as well. Centrally located, you are within 5 minutes of Discovery Cove and Seaworld and 10 minutes from Disney. Shopping and dining is right around the corner as well. We were so impressed by the facilities that we purchased a timeshare and we are pleased to be returning in less than a week and looking forward to spending many more spring vacations here.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful in a crisis!”
Reviews.Author: Scully4
Reviews.Content: Myself and my family from Ireland intended to stay just 5 nights in the Harbour Lake, but like many thousands of others in Orlando, were stranded due to flight cancellations on the back of the Icelandic Volcanic eruption and ended up staying 12 nights! The staff could not have been more helpful, assisting us with finding suitable rooms when the hotel was almost fully booked, helping us with room changes and assisting us with our many re-bookings of flights. The front desk staff and management team could not have done more to assist us and maee us feel at home at this difficult time. Crisis aside, this hotel is perfect for families looking to stay close to but not completely immersed in Disney. Located just beside Sea World, and only a 10 minute drive from Universal Studios in one direction and Disney World in the other, it is ideally located for those families who sensibly want to take a break from the parks during the day and just chill beside the pools (mini-water parks in themselves) for a couple of well needed restful hours. We stayed in 2 bedroomed villas, which were ideal for any length of stay, with two large bedrooms, a fully equipped kitchen, fantastic, efficient and badly needed washer dryers, and nice balconies. We availed of the outdoor barbecues to keep our costs down when stranded for the extra week, which worked really well. For those of you who like to shop, there are two excellent outlet centres within a 10 minute drive and the large bustling Florida Mall, 5 minutes further. We were in easy driving distance of two Publix supermarkets, which were excellent for stocking up the kitchen with good quality food and snacks for the parks. We will definitely be back and this time will fit more hotel time into our otherwise frantic park visiting schedule!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Lucchinou
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in Marriott Harbor Lake in a 2 bedrooms appartment. This hotel is strategically located between Disney, Universal and Sea World parks: less than 15 minutes drive from each park. Also very close from factory outlets and Florida mall. We were a little bit disappointed. by the rooms. Located on the ground floor, the rooms were very dark. More anyoing, our apartment 1315 was very close from the AC machinery resulting in a throbbing noise all night long. To be honest, I didn't request another apartment. The staff was very friendly. Regarding dinning facilities, we went out every day for breakfast and dinner: actually the only place to eat in the hotel was the pool bar and the "menu" was very limited.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing..everyone with kids should go here!”
Reviews.Author: Lynforde
Reviews.Content: Marriott Harbour Lake was absolutely amazing, we just completed a week's stay and could have easily stayed for another week! My husband and I could not think of one negative thing to say about this place, it was absolutely perfect for us and our two children ages 11 & 8. My 11 year old asked if we could live there, he made great friends and had fun playing unlimited basketball, mini golf as well as participating in some of the activities. My 8 year old lived in the pools, they were so much fun and she loved all of the daily activities planned. Most activities are free but even those that have a fee are reasonable...childred are given tokens after each activity to turn in at the end of their stay for a prize. Happy hour at the pool bar was good, the pool bar had good bar food, get the mini cheeseburgers and onion rings..awesome. We purchased two pirate cups so our kids could have unlimited ice cream sundaes everyday from 2-3...they loved this part and now have souvenir cups! Our room was beautiful and spacious, very modern with everything that we needed. We spent our whole week here as there is so much to do, no need for parks when this place has it all!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: jennsskylar
Reviews.Content: EVERYTHING was just wonderful, nothing negative to say here.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Time Just as Good”
Reviews.Author: ashah7
Reviews.Content: This is our second time back to this place. We loved it the first time and highly recommend it. The staff is outstanding and very cordial. The rooms are clean, spacious and well equipped. The children love the pools and the location is prime. Overall...we very well run timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “The non-Disney place to stay in Orlando.”
Reviews.Author: HamptonRoadsNomad
Reviews.Content: Traded our Colorado timeshare for a week at Harbour Lake and we weren't disappointed. We had the studio villa which is all we needed since we spent so little time in the room. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. The only complaint was there was not an old fashioned dresser to put clothes in, but that is a minor issue. The pools were the highlight of the property. There is also pool tables, ping-pong, a fire-pit, and there are other activities going on all over to keep the little ones entertained. There are no restaurants within easy walking distance, but a short distance away is Fama's Ristorante and it has some excellent classic Italian dishes. It's worth checking out. The resort is about 20 minutes from Disney. The resort does have a shuttle service, but it is not free. Not sure of the cost. All things considered this place is definitely worth staying at. Especially if you want to escape the Mickey fiasco.

Reviews.Title: “This place is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Aloushin
Reviews.Content: The staff was very accomidating, and the amenities / activites are just GREAT when traveling with children of any ages! I would definately recomend this property to friends and family members of all ages!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great pools, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: JewettsMills
Reviews.Content: Through a timeshare deal my family and I stayed there from March 20 - 27, 2010. My kids are almost 4 and almost 6 and had a great time. Our only regret is we didn't spend more time there. Our room was adequate, a studio with one queen bed and queen pull out. I did find my mattress to be a little soft but not too bad. The pools were wonderful and we thankfully got some great weather to enjoy them. There were lots of other kids playing on the pirate themed slides and water spraying all over our kids had a fantastic time and were in sight of our chaises all the time. We relaxed in one of the many hottubs there most every night which made walking and waiting at the theme parks tolerable the next day. The service was great at the bar and the food was very good at the grill. The location was fantastic for us, right beside the highway and a block from Seaworld which made sneaking back to the pool quick and easy. We were impressed by how quiet the room was. With the highway close by and the pool right outside our patio doors we never heard a thing. I know the hotel had daily activities for those that were spending the day there, next time we will enjoy the resort a little more. Would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “The absolute best place to stay in Orlando, bar none!”
Reviews.Author: Carolina0nMyMind
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here every year at least once the past 4 years (one year stayed twice). We have also experienced other hotels in the area and none are like this place. The name changed from Horizons from Marriott but still the same wonderful place. The spay pool and waterslide area have been refurbished and are even better. Very secure gated community with loss prevention staff that do more than just make sure nothing is stolen. My son had a scrape up and those same loss prevention officers came running with large well-equipped first aid kits and training on how to use them. Even one of the front desk staff (Elsa?) brought a warm washcloth to my son before they got there. You are treated like a member of the family here. We enjoyed the water park, miniature golf, arcade, poolside grill, large safe playground and even just sitting on a swinging bench by the lake. The property is on a beautiful natural lake and made for a great lakeside view from our room with screened porch balcony. ABSOLUTELY THE BEST, PERHAPS IN THE ENTIRE COUNTRY!

Reviews.Title: “What more could you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: thepiratemorgan
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? Check-in, polite, courteous, and fast. The efficiency room - good size, nice mattress, pillows a touch thin, small balcony, good size mini-fridge for an efficiency. We only have a 4yr. old daughter, so room size was good. I would put a maximum of two young (up to 10yr. old maybe) in this room type. This was the third year for another couple who traveled with us and they were fine with twin 5yr. olds in this type room. It was very clean upon check-in. This is NOT the one or two bedroom offerings at this resort, it's called an efficiency for a reason. We barely even slept there. So if you are a small (3-4 person family) and are on the go, either to the "parks" or swimming in the pool up until dusk and going to late dinners, than this is the room for you. The grounds - Meticulous!! They were CONSTANTLY cleaning. The elevators always had a pleasant smell, even the "garbage room" across from the elevators was clean and pleasant. I wanted to throw a beer to the workers, out of guilt, as a quick break for them. They were always working, but always stopped to say hi as you walked by. We didn't use maid service, but I did notice they were cleaning rooms right up until 5pm. The fire pit was nice one night, it made for a good "Where ya from?" meet and greet. The small "boardwalk" and dock / pier were very welcoming and would be perfect for catching a gentle breeze from the lake or a sunset. We did neither as our 4yr. old could care a less about either. The pools - Nicely warmed water. So much so that we swam even on a rainy cool 74 degree day. Then again, we were in 35 degree weather at home the day before! Only one complaint here, the "splash park" adjacent to one of the pools. You know, the one with the barrels that fill and dump water on the kids? For some strange reason they DO NOT heat the water for that feature. Strange, as that becomes the coldest water when it's sprayed from hose, falling from buckets, etc. The only time I saw children there is when they were just "running through", never to stop and play, and that was on one of the hottest days there. Very odd that this area didn't have heated water. The short water slide in on o f the pool complexes has a STRICT height restriction of 42 inches. You do have to closely monitor your younger children as there is no lifeguards and the pool(s) can get slightly crowded. But this is something any responsible parent would do in the first place. The pools never seemed over crowded though. The pool(s) have a good number of shady spots for the lighter complexion crowd. The activities - Great for the under 6yr. old crowd. Dry activities almost every morning. Almost afternoon they would have competitions in the pool complex with the pirate ship. The usual hula hoop, limbo, and other contests. They did get kinda repetitious toward the end of the week, but my 4yr. old still went out there like she never saw a hula hoop the day before. The food - Very good. We ate at the pool bar for lunch and dinner once. The quality was good, a decent value. Every day they had 2 for 1 drink specials from 3pm-5pm and service was very quick. I think once you get to the teen years with your children, this resort will lose it's luster. There isn't much of a nightlife here. A Caribbean night with some oldie "island tunes". Friday night was Karaoke night, it sounded like they were having fun there as we walked by after feeding the ducks. I am surprised to see that this resort is rated as a 3 out of 5 star resort by Tripadvisor. I would think this to be a 4 star in my middle-class eyes. If this is 3 star, I would love to one day see a 4 star. Hell, even a 5 star if I hit the lottery!! I can't say enough good things about this resort, it was that good. For the middle-class working man, this is a 5 star resort. We hope to get back there again in the near future, if not next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Broomfieldtravelers
Reviews.Content: One week visit at the Marriott Harbour Lake. Nice condos and well equipped and clean. Staff was very friendly and responsive to all requests. Location was convenient for attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: iluvmygiants
Reviews.Content: What's that??? You are looking for a place to stay while in the Disney area??? Well....stop looking! You found it! I am not going to rewrite all the fab things everyone has already said...its all true! From the location, to the facilities, to the staff, to the housekeepers, to the activities...just PERFECT!!! Only sad thing now is....our trip is over!! :( booo hoo hoo! And i will recommend one thing....with all the $$ u save by grocery shopping and loading your fridge with breakfast, lunch "adult beverages" and snackies....use it to go to Discovery Cove! Hands down one of the best things our family has ever done together!!! And the free pass to Sea World with the purchase of Discovery Cove while we were there was an added bonus!! Except for being in the park when the trainer was killed...that ....not so good. :( THX Harbour Lake...now we see why you are ranked #1 in the Disney area!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Timeshare Hotel, especially for families with small children”
Reviews.Author: relaxation-hound
Reviews.Content: Marriott Harbor Lake was a nice timeshare hotel. We stayed there for 6 days and it was a nice place to hang out with our children. Unlike the other properties for Marriott this place was small and definitely manageable for families with kids, we have three (12, 8, 7). What I really liked was the size, as well as the two great pools, one with a Pirate ship and the other which had a splash park. There was also Table tennis and other activities. We have staid at the Cypress Harbor, which is bigger and has more amenities, I have vistied the Grande Vista which is huge, but for the kids this place was spot on. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, safe and great pools for smaller children - restaurant and bar were nothing spectacular.”
Reviews.Author: MnRichfam
Reviews.Content: The pools were heated to a comfortable 84 degrees. The mini golf course was very nice and creative. There is not a lot to do indoors if you have a rainy day. There is an arcade but other than that there isn't much to do indoors. They do have a variety of activities everyday but don't be late or you will miss out. My girls enjoyed going to the activities but I didn't feel that the staff went out of the way to make them feel comfortable or to get to know them and their names. Overall it was a great week and most importantly we felt extremely safe and were comfortable letting our 9 and 11 year old go places within the resort alone.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place overall but not our best marriott vacation club experience”
Reviews.Author: napagirl2
Reviews.Content: This place used to be called Horizons. It was changed for unknown reasons. We had a 2 bedroom which was nice and large with a huge kitchen with stainless steel appliances. We were in building 14 which is too close to the highway and you can hear the noise from the road in the kitchen and the 2nd bedroom. The pool area is nice. There are 2 large hottubs by the pool. The miniature golf course was fun. Our biggest complaint about this place was that the staff was not friendly or accommodating at all and we did not receive housekeeping for 2 days. One day we left our room early in the morning and returned at 4:30. The maid had not been in the room yet. When we called the front desk we were told that she was still working on it. Really? At 5 pm. We were exhausted and were not leaving the room so we just told her to bring us towels and shampoo. We were paying guests not vacation club and housekeeping should have been provided to us earlier than 5pm. If you can overlook those issues and get a room that isn't so close to the highway I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place for families”
Reviews.Author: YoCoop
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Harbour Lake; my wife and I stayed last year and decided to bring her children and grandchildren this time. There were 12 of us and we reserved two condos right next to each other. There was no problem with sleeping accomodations at all, as this facility has ample room for 6 in each condo. The staff is very friendly and the place is very clean. There are two large swimming pools; one that is ideal for kids to spend an entire day in, and the other I would recommend for the adults. There is a large lake with sitting areas and a path that travels around the facility with outdoor bar-b-q gas grills scattered throughout. It's right off of I-4 Sea World exit, and it's 5 minutes to the theme park. It's about 20 minutes to Disney from door to parking lot. Trememdous amount of restaurants in the area as well as plenty of supermarkets and convenience stores. The outlet mall is also very close and it features plenty of stores. It's secluded enough for privacy, yet very convenient to be anywhere else in minutes. We can't wait to do this again, probably with another couple.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for family and kids”
Reviews.Author: Armbar1
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel from RoadTripHelper.com via thier hotels map, and it was a great place to stay with the family. Very relaxing trip it was.

Reviews.Title: “Great great place!”
Reviews.Author: Musman2
Reviews.Content: Stayed feb 2010. Great heated pools. Felt very safe, lots of security and gates. My room was in oldest building but was really nice and clean. We are definately coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Kids will love it!”
Reviews.Author: APDMOM
Reviews.Content: Absolutely a GREAT place for a family with children! PROS: Location close to Seaworld (<1 mile) & International Drive; Lots of entertainment and activities for kids. Pirates theme. No pressure to buy timeshare. Beautiful pools and play areas. Staff was GENUINELY friendly and helpful. Unit was spotless. Bed is even more comfy than at home! CONS: Small studio units with very small kitchen sink. Bath water does not get very hot. Very slow wireless connection - got kicked off every 5-10 minutes. Noise from neighbors on the last night - thin walls.

Reviews.Title: “There's so much to do that we're sorry we don't have our grandchildren with us.”
Reviews.Author: BrickLeb
Reviews.Content: I do not know what the other buildings are like, but our stay in Bldg. 31 which has been recently renovated, is really lovely. The beds are very comfortable, and the amenities in this two BR villa are very, very nice. We have a screened porch overlooking their man-made lake which has made for quiet nights with just the sound of the lake's fountain. Our service has been quick and congenial. The outdoor activities for children are adorable for little ones or preteens. It's near Disney World and Universal and lots of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for trip with young children”
Reviews.Author: trieditout
Reviews.Content: This resort was perfect for our trip to Orlando. The pools and spraygrounds were wonderful. Also our suite had a full kitchen, washer and dryer and screened in porch. The location was right next to SeaWorld and within a 15-20 minute drive from Disney Magic Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Marriott's Harbour Lake”
Reviews.Author: VT3Travelers
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful stay at the Marriott's Harbour Lake. Our 1 bedroom suite was large, clean and had all the amenities we needed. We were told on check-in that we would be in one of the newly constructed buildings and although our balcony view was of another building, everything in our unit was brand new. The resort has two pools, basketball court, lake, arcade room, miniature golf, outdoor grills, and daily activities for both children and adults. The staff was great and truly seemed to enjoy interacting with the children. My only regret is that we spent so much time at the Disney parks, we were unable to participate in more of the resort activities. We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: imc410
Reviews.Content: this is a very nice resort. it is classified as a family friendly resort and it is .. however, it has a very beautiful pond with awsome views , and sunsets. a very romantic lit pathway around the pond . and the staff are exceptional as all marriotts are, this is my second time i have stayed at this resort and i will stay here many more times.

Reviews.Title: “Great home base for Disney and outlet shopping!”
Reviews.Author: TravelRules14
Reviews.Content: We've traveled to Orlando five times in the past six years, and this was the best resort yet. A short drive to the Disney resorts and the Outlets, two of our fave destinations. The condo was not the biggest we've had, but clean, very comfortable beds with high-quality linens and pillows (makes a big difference in your trip when you can get a good night's sleep!). We didn't have a lot of time to spend at the resort, but great amenities - two sets of pools, complete with slides. Wish the hot tub was warmer, but that's how it goes at family-oriented resorts! Nice porch swings overlooking the "lake", good walking paths throughout the resort. Our dryer was broken, and they brought us a new one pronto.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: MissMouse1928
Reviews.Content: PROS: The villa I stayed in was so clean, I would have felt comfortable to eat off the floor! The villa was humongous! Although only one king bedroom and a sleep sofa, the dining table was big enough for 6. The screened lanai was delightful. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful. Excellent location for all the area theme parks, just a short drive to Disney, fabulous outlet malls and lots more. Sparkling clean, huge, full kitchen with everything you could possibly need on hand. Free WiFi, free parking, excellent off season rates. CONS: I was in the building closest to the hotel entrance which I was told was the newest building. I was disturbed by the noise made by cars driving over the wooden bridge that brings you to the hotel security gate. I considered asking to change rooms but I adjusted to the noise after one night. The noise is fairly constant from very early morning to very late in the evening so if you are noise sensitive request a room that is not near the front entrance. SPECIAL NOTE: Monica in reservations went far and beyond what I would expect for courtesy and service as a hotel guest. She deserves many kudos and she should be a hotel manager or better some day. THANKS MONICA!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: cachcia98
Reviews.Content: This is a great place. The staff was professional and helpful. We stayed here while going to Diney World during the day. We were there during the record breaking cold spell so we were only able to take advantage of the awesome pools and hot tubs only one day. They have great activities for the kids, mine especially like the familyl wii nites. My self and my husband liked the 2 for 1 drinks during happy hour at the pool side bar/grill. We didn't play mini golf but the course looked nice. I read it was $25 for all week to play. I wasn't sure if that was per person or what...it's per family!

Reviews.Title: “Great location....nice size for 6!”
Reviews.Author: dentalhy
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (2 adults and 2 young adults) and another family of two (adult and young child) stayed here from 12/27 to 1/1. The villa was the perfect size with two bedrooms and two bathrooms. The kitchen was handy, and had most of what we needed (a colander would have been handy). All appliances worked well. They provided us with enough dish detergents and sponges etc. The beds were very comfortable. Nicely decorated, no visible signs of wear or dirt. There are a lot of activities for families. We did do the mini-golf one night, and used the work out center and outdoor basketball courts. Florida had unseasonably cold temperatures and the pool facilities were not used at all...but they looked like they would have been fun! All staff that we encountered were very friendly Short drive to the Disney parks and even shorter to Sea World. Probably would have felt it was a better value had we been able to use more of the outside amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Off Disney Value and Accomodation Option”
Reviews.Author: Klug
Reviews.Content: Harbour Lake is well done. If you are looking to save a few $$ or do a short disney experience without total immersion this is a great property for kids up to 16 years old. The pools are fantastic for my 3 year old and up. Well designed, safe and quality construction. Accomodations seem to be the best bang for your buck in town. Very spacious 2 bedroom villa with sofa bed in living area. Beds are hotel quality and super comfortable. Good size flat screens with DVD players in both bedrooms and a larger one with DVD in living room. Bathrooms are well equipped and perfect for a family to use. Kitchen was perfect for vacation use, dont plan on cooking a holiday meal here but all the basicsa are there. New and clean appliances. Comfortable furniture and plenty of it. Free wireless internet in the villa is huge too! Works great with adequate speed. As others have mentioned all staff members have been totally friendly and accomodating. Smiling and offering to help in any way. I am still at the resort and its raining buckets today so perhaps I will have an update regarding rainy day activities later but they have tons of activities scheduled so we will check it out. Only word of caution would be the on property dining is not what you would get at a hotel property. This place has a bar/snack bar type restaurant which seems adequate for a poolside lunch but has a limited menu that would not do well for me other than in a pinch. That being said there are dozens of restaurants within 15 minutes so its not a problem. Side Note: Building 31 had a great view of 2 Fireworks Displays on NYE and we could see at least 3 other ones. I am assuming that one of the 2 large ones was Magic Kingdom but I'm not sure which. One of my photos shows the 2 larger displays. I would not recommend this resort if you are traveling without children. This place is designed for families through and through.

Reviews.Title: “Will return again!”
Reviews.Author: Hatelivinginnyc
Reviews.Content: Using Marriott's "Buy 3 Nights, Get 2 Nights Free" promotion, I booked us into this resort and am so glad I did!! This place is amazing! Plenty of activities for the kids above and beyond the 2 large pool complexes. Anyone with kids knows if they are bored, they will want to go out (which means you spend $$). This place will save you from the extra expenditures! As everyone else has indicated, the staff are incredibly friendly and very helpful. I think they go out of their way to put out good customer service since they know they are working at a better Marriott property than the Fairfield Inn and/or Courtyard. This is an incredibly fabulous place and at the incredibly low price we are paying per night, I think we got a monumental steal compliments of Marriott!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: travlingalNJ
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Walt Disney for a few days and needed accommodations that were close to the parks and had a kitchen. This place really fit the bill. Not only was the unit very nice and clean, the staff was terrific. Everyone we encountered made us feel very welcome. Especially, the guys who work at the gate securing the complex. My mom and I had to wait at the guard gate for our rental car agency to pick us up (they didn't show up that day). They guys at the gate were beyond terrific. They put us in the shade and let us sit while we waited. They are first rate!!!! So friendly and they gave good advice with directions and where to shop. They could not have been better. We had such a nice time talking with them I wasn't so upset that we weren't able to get the car until the following day. The food at the pool bar was pretty good and the guys working their were very nice too. Ask to stay in the new units. They are really nice. Can't wait to stay again. I'm planning another trip already.

Reviews.Title: “Reality falls far short of the hype”
Reviews.Author: teamsc10190
Reviews.Content: Unless you're travelling with small children who might appreciate the pirate theme, you would be better served by almost any Marriott property. Our room was tired with mildewed bathroom and plugged drains. Maybe easy to overlook if the kids are having a great time on the pirate slide, but difficult to justify for the price. The location is ideal for access to Disney or Sea World, however it is immediately adjacent to Rte 4, so the din of traffic is your constant companion. Hard for me to imagine that this property was originally envisioned as a Vacation Club timeshare as its lacking a lot of the polished execution of those properties. Skip the pirates

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort, Can't Wait To Return!”
Reviews.Author: ThemeParkKid59
Reviews.Content: What a great resort for families. Centrally located to all the Orlando theme parks, less than a mile to Sea World and only 70 miles to Busch Gardens. Two magnificent pools, both however geared for kids 10 and under, maximum depth only about 5 feet, but hot tubs were spectacular- holding up to 20 people at a time. We stayed in the sunken treasure building 28 and had no problems. Sure the TV's in this section were all not flat screens, but who cares...the one in the living room had to be at least a 48 inch! Full cable including HBO sure beat ones we've stayed in previously. Staff was courteous, friendly, and efficient. Pool bar staff just as great and food was good. Pools open to 10 or 11 made it great to take a dip after the long days at the parks. I would gladly stay there again, or if not, stay at the Marriott Cypress Harbour, just across the street, which is more for adults and older kids. Bonus: Super Walmart less than 1 mile away for all your grocery needs. Informative directions sheet to all local attractions given out at check in sure helped navigate our way around. We are an Interval Internationl Timeshare owner and used our exchange to stay here. We only received one phonecall about picking up info about attending a meeting(which we did not) and in no way were harassed about sales. I would highly recommend this resort. PS: Dont worry about the highway noise as others have posted...almost unnoticeable.

Reviews.Title: “This was the best resort for our family bar none!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sunshineandfun
Reviews.Content: This resort was beautiful!!! We had 3 adults and 2 small children with us. The 2 br villa we had comfortably fit all of us, with room to spare! The amenities were wonderful (washer/dryer, dishwasher, dishes, big screen TV's, screened in deck). The room was beautifully decorated, the staff was polite, the grounds were secure, the pool area was spectacular!!! Two seperate play areas for the kids...pirate ship water slide on one side and a huge area with sprinklers (pirate themed water play area) this also included a kiddie pool (about a foot deep) and of course a regular sized pool and hot tub for the adults! I could even go down and get my Starbucks in the morning from the little stand out by the pools!!! They had mini golf and other activities which we did not participate in, but they looked like fun! Everything was just beautiful and we really enjoyed ourselves! The one and only complaint that I had was the buildings fire alarm going off a couple times due to malfunction. It scared the crap out of my kids! But, things happen and it was fixed as soon as possible. Other than that slight mishap, our 5 day stay there was wonderful and I would definetely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic yet again”
Reviews.Author: wrisberg
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on an exchange for my own timeshare in Tenerife. I had already been to this resort in 2007 and i would say it was even better than the first time. I travelled with my husband and 11 year old triplets and my parents who are in their 60's and even although the resort is more for families my parents had a great time. Security at the gate was excellent and we managed to check in at 10am which was very convenient as we had just left Marriot Grande Vista and wanted to leave our passports etc in a safe rather than carrying them about with us all day. Pool were clean and activities excellent, my 3 went fishing, played volleyball, basketball, table tennis, pool and joined in all the weekend pool games and just had a ball. As this is my 11th time in Orlando we only went to 2 parks so we spent a lot of time in the resort and thoroughly enjoyed our time. The staff were excellent, friendly and helpful. I would recommend anybody whether you have kids or not to go to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “okay”
Reviews.Author: lovely101
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed when I stayed at the Marriott Harbour Lake. It is nothing like the reviews say. It is nice but it is not as nice as the other Marriotts.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location !!!”
Reviews.Author: Fergie2
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at HL with my 12 year old daughter. Check in was quick and easy even at 4am - thanks Globespan !!!! Rooms are fantastic - huge living area with all mod cons, great bedrooms with big comfy beds and super views over the lake. We visited all the parks which are an easy 10-15 min drive away, Sea World is within walking distance and International Drive is 2mins by car. The location is perfect, in a nice quiet area but so close to all the restaurants and attractions. There were lots of families with smaller kids and they all seemed to be having a fabulous time in the Pirate Pool - next time I will have to rent a small kid and join the party !! Well done Harbour Lakes, great staff, great resort and great location - you will not be disappointed....

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: stormycpa
Reviews.Content: this was our second stay at this hotel and it did not disappoint! We have two small children and the two bedroom suite was just perfect. So convenient to have the washer and dryer and the full kitchen- a must for travelling with small children. My three year old just loved the pirate ship pool. All the employees were helpful. My only complaint would be that we had ordered a pack and play for our infant, and the first one was broken and the second one was pathetic. The poor child was sleeping on such an uncomfortable surface.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Roomy, and a Great Location for visiting Disney, Sea World, and Universal!”
Reviews.Author: klavin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Marriott's Harbour Lake for one week in a two bedroom unit with our two children (ages 11 and 9). It was great to have two bedrooms, two bathrooms, living area and a full kitchen, especially since we were there for so long. We also took advantage of the kitchen for breakfast, snacks and a few dinners "in" when we were worn out and tired of eating at restaurants. The rooms were very quiet, we never could hear anyone staying above or next to us. The property had a pirate theme in the two pool areas with a water slide, pirate boat, and water activity area. There was also a miniature golf course, a lake for fishing, and nice trails through the property. The staff was very helpful whenever we had questions. The location was in a convenient area that was less than a mile from Sea World, about 5 miles from Disney, and about 10 miles from Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Gated Property, Well-Groomed Grounds, Huge Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jayseae
Reviews.Content: After experiencing a family vacation of driving a few hundred miles, there's nothing quite like being able to relax. Even stretching out in a "suite" is nice, but when you stay in a place like this, it's just different. I don't know how many different room types there are at Marriott's Harbour Lake, but the one that we were in was huge. There was a full-sized kitchen, a living room, and then a couple of rooms. Rather than the family having to figure out how to fit, everyone could expand to their heart's content. No one had to share a television (well, the wife and I did). There are two pools, a mini-golf course, and multiple places to eat. To be fair, several of the areas around the property do exist to take your money (mini-golf, restaurants), and they may not be the best of quality. But the location is excellent - you are just minutes from Sea World, with other parks down the road, there are dozens of restaurants a few more minutes not far away. So you don't need a lot right there. If you'd like to save money, you can cart in your own supplies and cook in the kitchen, and being in a gated community keeps out the riff-raff. Not sure how we made it in, quite frankly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fabules3
Reviews.Content: This place was a roomy alternative to staying on Disney property for our family of 5. Super clean, full kitchen and well stocked with laundry right in our rooms. Hotel supplied us with washing machine soap enough for two loads...or you can buy extra for $1. We also were given dishwashing soap, paper towels, garbage bags, coffee, etc. Fully equiped kitchen with full size fridge, stove, toaster, microwave and dishwasher w/ detergent, dining space for at least 8 people. Our three kids had own room with two queen comfy beds with plenty of pillows as well as their own flat screen tv and bathroom. Grownups had own bedroom with king sized bed and bathroom.We were on 6th floor and other then kids laughing in the pool during the day...it was quiet as can be. We didnt hear any neighbors! We were in building 13 overlooking Pirate Ship Pool.. Screened in private balcony with table and chairs..,railing was high...came to my chest for safety. Pool was great for swim breaks from seeing all the theme parks. And pool was open until 11pm.Pool was large and had a few hot tubs as well. We had quick check in and check out. We received quick responsive service for towels when needed! Great staff. 10 minute drive from Disney World....if you have a larger family......this is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: GoCeltsGo
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 2 weeks in Orlando. First week was at another Mariott (Grande Vista) which was beautiful, but we liked the Harbout Lake better. Both offer clean, spacious villas and beautiful grounds. Harbour Lake is MUCH better for the kids. The mini-golf at $25 per family (NOT per person as previously stated) for the week is well worth it. My 7 and 13 year old played nearly every day. The campus is small enough and safe enought that we would let them occasionally go out on their own for a bit. They offer a slew of daily activities, unfortunately we were so busy that we didn't get to do much there. Next year, we are planning 1 or 2 days on-property. The location is great, close enough to WalMart/Publix/Outlets/Theme Parks, yet not in the congestion of things. The pool side grill has great food, drink specials. You can get breakfast and coffee too at reasonable prices. I really can't think of anything negative to say. Again, this is our favorite place and we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mousefan71
Reviews.Content: We own at this resort but this was our first visit here. I had very high expectations after reading all of the reviews and I was NOT disappointed. The weather was unusually hot for this time of the year and very humid, the pools were a wonderful diversion - we played in them every day for several hours. My kids (7,6 and 4) loved the pirate ship and the large waterslide. We played one round of miniature golf, the course was very impressive but it was just too hot. We stayed in room 1012 on the first floor, it was quiet and convenient to the pools and lobby area. The kids enjoyed the daily ice cream at Pirate Hall (we purchased the refillable cups at the lobby), I regret not signing the kids up for the activities offered here, we were having so much fun in the pools that it didn't even occur to me until we were on our way home - maybe next year!!! We loved the size of this resort, it's small and everything is so convenient. I can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “We had a blast!”
Reviews.Author: jfreak5
Reviews.Content: We had such a great time at this facility. They had so much to do for the kids, very very kid friendly. I was a bit worried when we first booked because one of their pools was closed for remodeling and it had a big water feature/slide on it. But to compensate for that they had bounce houses (yes more than one, a bounce house and a huge slide) up every day and a few more activities for the kids. And as it turned out the pool that was open had a nice slide and there was a splash pad at that one as well so we didn't feel like we missed out on anything. If I had any complaint at all it was that I left my camera battery charger plugged into the wall after we left and I called on several occasions to see if anyone had found it and they said no, I find that hard to believe but whatever. But overall this resort was top notch, we had fun playing mini-golf (although $25 per person for the length of your stay I thought was a little bit pricey) and it is nice and close to the parks but you don't pay the high disneyworld on property prices.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest timeshare we have every stayed in. My children wanted to stay!”
Reviews.Author: kimylou
Reviews.Content: Everything about this place was great. Check in was quick. Room was amazing and clean. Washing machine and dryer in the unit were great. Kids love the TV at night after going crazy at Disney World. Close to a Walmart to stock the awesome kitchen. Close to Disney! I can't say enough about this place. Great service for everything.

Reviews.Title: “One Stop shopping”
Reviews.Author: RYam603
Reviews.Content: This place has it all, for those who don't need to go to the Parks everyday. Plenty of activities to keep the kids busy, although I wish there would have been more organized activities for teens. The resort seemed to have the majority of activities geared towards younger children. Regardless; the mini-golf, pools, game room, fitness center, basketball courts, ping pong, etc. kept my kids busy from check-in to check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Great for young children”
Reviews.Author: shaskellyrabbit
Reviews.Content: This is an ideal stay for people with young children. Two pools, 3 hot tubs and a water park with fountains,sprayers etc that you play in. Water slide for kids under 8 and one big one for the older kids. Ice cream social from 2-3 every day. Stayed in building 30, top floor which was good. Furthest from the pools and lake, but barely a 2 minute walk, so can't complain. Activities everyday for families. Very close to SeaWorld. Was able to go back to the hotel for kids naps in the afternoon and return to the park after. We spent three days at the hotel in the pools etc. and two at Seaworld. Must rent a car. Closest grocery and good restaurants is 3 miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay at Kid Friendly Resort”
Reviews.Author: FamilyGuyBC
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 (we have 3 girls ages 5 years, 2 years and 5 months old) spent the week of August 16-23 at the Marriott Harbour Lake. We stayed in building 31 in a roomy renovated 2-BR suite with a view of the lake and a short distance to the kids water park. The resort is indeed family oriented and the kids love spending time at the water park. It is literally next door to Seaworld with a bus (just outside the resort entrance) that comes by every 30 minutes, so we didn’t need to take our car and pay for parking at Seaworld. Restaurants, shopping and Disney parks are also close by (15-20 minutes by car). Overall, we were very happy with the location, services, facilities and friendliness of the staff. This was a great time share exchange and the resort does live up to its Marriott standards. We wished we had more time and will definitely come back in a few years. Some memorable moments for us were: The fireworks at Seaworld and the new Shamu Rocks show. Swimming at the beautiful white sandy Clearwater Beach. Fabulous dinner at Roy's Restaurant. Taking pictures with the princesses and fairies at Disney World (actually the whole Disney experience was great). Recommend getting at least a 2-day pass. Shopping at Prime Outlet (best outlet of them all)

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Crumdom
Reviews.Content: Our family really enjoyed our stay here. We have 3 kids (15, 14, 11) I thought the place would be a little too young for them, but they had a great time in the pools and playing putt-golf. We didn't get much time at the resort was our only complaint as we spent 5 days hopping parks at Disney World. We also had some rainy days where we had to stay inside. The staff are very pleasant and welcoming. We stayed in building 14/15 and I recommend this building. The far end of the building away from the center of the resort is near the freeway so you might just request that you get a room nearer to the pool. We were in the middle and we had no freeway noise. The view from this building is the lake and it is very nice compared to looking out to a street or other buildings. We had been asigned to bldg 33 which was the furthest from everything and we asked for building 14/15 on recommendation from a review. They found a first floor room in bldg 15 which was great. The rooms are tastefully decorated and our kitchen was well stocked. They provided paper towels, dishwashing soap, dishwasher soap, plastic garbage bags and dish rags which some resorts leave up to you or give only enough for 1 day. This hotel is closest to Sea World and a 10-15 minute drive to Disney. We would definately stay here again with kids. In a few years though our kids will probably out grow it.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids but lacks quality expected from Vacation club resorts”
Reviews.Author: sp1005
Reviews.Content: My young kids loved this resort with its activity slides and boats in the pool areas. It felt safe and secure, and had a good activity programme. However i felt that it lacked the usual feeling of luxury that i have come to expect from Mariotts vacation club. The rooms were comfortable and well equipped. My main criticism of this resort is its closeness to the I-4 motorway. I could here the traffic from my room 24/7 and found it impossible to use the balcony because of the noise. I would recommend asking for a room located at the front of the resort, furthest from the I-4. The location was good, as Disney, Universal and Seaworld theme parks were all within 10 mins driving distance. I would recommend thisresort to those with young children, but think that other could be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort & Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: rjlbz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the recently renovated building. Our 5 year old daughter really enjoyed having her own studio apartment. We were able to see the Sea World fireworks every night from either screened balcony. Our daughter did not want to go to Disney, instead she wanted to swim in the resort pools - even though we have our own inground pool at home. We enjoyed the putt putt golf, food at Harborside, and the sundae bar in the pirate cup. The location is great. Only miles away from Sea World, Outlet Stores, Downtown Disney, and a multitude of restaurants. We have stayed at other resorts that had more swimming pools, golf courses, and restaurants. However, we think this resort was more child friendly. Also, you were able to walk everywhere within the resort.

Reviews.Title: “We love Harbour Lakes!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mangi1091
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic vacation (7-31 thru 8-15) at Marriott Harbour Lakes and can not wait to go back next year. I don't know where to start so lets begin with the actiivities which are led by some of the greatest individuals in the world the Pirates (Sara, Tiffiny, Erica, Bryan, Jason, Amelia, Andrea & of course Britania). They kept the activities going from morning to night for kids and kids at heart. Great Going guys another fantastic year. The rooms are very large and spacious easily had enough room for my family of five (2 adults, 1 teenager & two 10 yr old boys). A total home away from home. The staff is very freindly and accomidating to all your needs. There is no real restruant on site but there is an excellent BAR & Grill at the Pirates Pool. The food is really good and not very expensive. Matt the bartender makes some of the best frozen drinks in the world!!!!! We went to the parks on several days but the kids just wanted to stay at the resorts so next year we will not be going to any of the parks. JUST CAN'T WAT TO GO BACK.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort with young kids”
Reviews.Author: rudynd
Reviews.Content: Checked out today building 28. It was good, only wish there was a flat screen in master bedroom. I have 10 year old twins who could not get enough of the pirate ship and slide. The putt putt course was fun. We must have played 5 times per day. Pay the $25 weekly fee as it is worth every penny. Could use a little more lighting for evening play. We did not have daily housekeeping service. You take care of this yourself. You call for what you need and they bring right up to you. Good activities for both kids and adults. would recommend without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Our BEST family vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: jkmac90
Reviews.Content: Having reviewed several resorts, we chose to stay at Marriot's Harbour Lake. It looked like it would be a good choice for our family. If I had it to do over again, I probably wouldn't have even purchased SeaWorld or Busch Gardens tickets; the resort was everything we needed! The room was very, very nice and perfectly clean. It had a washer and dryer in the room - very convenient! The room was incredibly spacious, with two bedrooms and two bathrooms, a well-stocked kitchen, and a nice balcony. Ours had a beautiful view of the lake behind the resort. We found it very quiet and relaxing. You had to really, really be listening to hear any kind of traffic noise. The best part of the resort, however, was the staff and the activities. Our children (and ourselves!) really enjoyed participating in the activities and events, from making tie-dye tee-shirts to Texas Hold 'Em tournaments and karaoke, we had a great time just being at the resort! The pools were incredible; our children loved them and just couldn't get enough swimming. The mini-golf course was very enjoyable and laid out very well. The additional amenities, such as gas grilles, pool tables, ping-pong tables, basketball courts, playgrounds, gas fire pit, docks, sitting areas, arcade, Nintendo Wii tournaments, excercise room, and bars added greatly to the resort. The staff, to me, was the resorts greatest asset. We didn't speak to any staff member who wasn't smiling, cheerful, and very helpful. They were all very kind and gracious to us and to our children. Even the DJ who ran the karaoke night was very entertaining and friendly. (Special props to Erica, who led our Texas Hold 'Em tournament! Very good hostess!) We couldn't have been more pleased with our experience at Harbour Lake. As my wife stated, "All we needed was more hours in the day!" We will certainly plan a return trip, and we highly, highly recommend this resort to anyone who is traveling with children! It is very kid-friendly and safe! Thank you to all of the staff!!!!

Reviews.Title: “This resort is fabulous”
Reviews.Author: royster181
Reviews.Content: We had 2 teens and a 10yr old. All loved the place. The 2br 2 baths w pull out couch were great. Kitchen well stocked and plenty of room. We are looking foward to coming next year. Pools are spectacular, kids loved them. The activitirs were great too. Staff was friendly and very helpfull. Special mention goes to Sarah and Erica of the pirates crew who were wonderful with our younger guy, Mat at the bar & grill was excellent as well. Herd a few negative things about staff before we arrived and believe you can't please some people at all. Any Complaints would be petty picking. An example, When we arrived the ice maker was not working. Maintenence arrived within 10 minutes and not only fixed the ice maker but brought us a bag of ice because we had none. this rates 10 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: iwnt2trvl
Reviews.Content: We were in Orlando originally scheduled from 6/12/09-6/18/2009. During this time we stay in the Marriot Harbour Lake. We were having so much fun that we decided to stay longer and stayed two additional days at the Radisson Hotel Orlando-Lake Buena Vista. We stayed at this timeshare in the past in 2006 for a few days before we went on a Disney Cruise. Back then it was called Horizons. So we knew what to expect. We enjoy the size of the unit (2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, kitchen, great room and screen porch). The pool areas are nice. There are lots of amenities like ping pong, putt putt, basketball, firepit etc. Our unit was starting to show some wear. Having stayed here twice, I think that we want to try other accommodations. The TVs are dated. But we find that we always enjoy our stay here. It is roomy and the areas that the kids want to visit like pools, putt putt and playground are a two minute walk away from the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Family Reunion”
Reviews.Author: BabsMansfield
Reviews.Content: My husband and I flew down for 6 days to the Marriott. We decided it was the best place to meet up with my son and his wife and 4 children. I hadn't seen him in 1 1/2 years, as he just got out of the Marines. It was a wonderful place for all of us. The kids ages 3 to 9 loved the pools and pirate ship. We couldn't get them out of the pool but finally did when we wanted to go to Magic Kingdom. I was able to use the kitchen every day to cook a large breakfast for all. The kitchen had everything you would need. It comfortably fit all 8 of us to sleep. There was plenty of room and we never felt crowded. I would consider staying here again as it was right next to Sea World and just a 10 minute drive to Disney. The large screen tv's were an added attraction in the living room and bedrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Better Every Year”
Reviews.Author: cmrtraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the two bedroom timeshare again this year. First time we went in the summer months. Very hot that particular week. The rooms are always impeccable. Plenty of room for us - myself, husband and 9 year travelled with 4 other relatives. The Horizons Harbor pool is a great draw for the young kids. There were scheduled games and activities there all day for the kids. The waterpark was also a fun thing for the kids to do and us adults could relax in the pool while they were there. They also took advantage of the mini golf course. We are owners at this resort and noticed a few improvements since last year. They put a roof on the outside dining area near the pool which was nice and overall the resort seemed to be a lot cleaner - no garbage overflowing like we saw in previous years. All in all, we enjoy returning to this resort each year. Great location in relation to the parks - so close you can leave the parks and go back and forth a few times each day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice For Families”
Reviews.Author: planman1
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to an Orlando area Marriott resort and really enjoyed ourselves at this location. My 4 yr. old daughter could not get enough of the "great" pools and other kid related activities. With the minature golf course, water slides, and game rooms, she was happy just to stay at the resort. The overall atmosphere is nice done with a Key West theme, but as other reviewers have mentioned some of the rooms/buildings are in need of renovation. Our room was not great, but I did see one in a newer building and thought it was very nice. Also, the staff could have been a bit more informative and friendly and a store on the property would help and when asked about the latter, I was told that this resort is still growing and a store and movie theater are in the works. (FYI) There is a small store across the street at the other Marriott property. Just show the gate guard your car pass and tell them you are just going to the store. Overall, your kids will love it and just remember to ask for one of the newer or renovated rooms.

Reviews.Title: “One of the BEST, IF not the BEST”
Reviews.Author: topher6315
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay with the family. Already planning our trip back to the resort. Such a kid friendly place to stay. The rooms were very clean and up to date. The ease to get to get to all the parks was amazing. The pools were so relaxing, especially if you have kids. There are two pools and both were great. Plenty of games for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: TripletMommy
Reviews.Content: This place was wonderful! Excellent rate for the location. We wanted to take the kids to Disney for their birthdays and utilize the "get in free on your birthday" promotion, however were having a difficult time finding a reasonable resort, when Marriott called and offered a 4 night stay, at a very discounted rate, for listening to the timeshare presentation, we jumped at this offer. When we checked in, they gave a packet of things to do, coupons, & list of activities for the week. We used the pools and our 3 kids absolutely loved the pirate ship, dump bucket, and most of all the waterslide! The room was great, as we were traveling with our 3 children and a sitter and there was plenty of room for all 6 of us...the kids and sitter shared the 2 bed bedroom, while my husband and I had the king bedroom. The washer and dryer in the room was a life saver, as we were able to take only 2 suitecases for a family of 5. They had a children's program, Pirates and Princesses, where are kids were able to spend some time away from us, with other kids, and we were able to enjoy some couple time by the pool. That was great for all of us and very reasonable...$15 each kid and it included lunch. It was an awesome facility and the location to Disney was great too! The only down thing was the timeshare presentation. We were told a 90 minute presentation, which turned into a 2 hour and 15 minute presentation, and would not have been too bad but we told our sitter we would be back in a little over 90 minutes. Also, we found out our sales rep was new, so we should be patient with her. Again, that was just a little hiccup, but overall the place was great!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for Kids!”
Reviews.Author: 4BAILEYS
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel and was very pleased with all it had to offer. I was hesitant when we got stuck in the room with the balcony facing the security gate because I thought it would be loud, but the room was quiest, clean, spacious and very comfortable for the 4 of us. I slept as good as I sleep at home here. The kitchen was clean, well stocked, roomy. Had a great eating area. Great big living area for the kids to sleep with their own flat screen tv. Spacious deck. Master bathroom was spacious and master bedroom was good size with comfortable blankets and pillows. The pool was excellent and so was the food at the grill. The mini golf course was fun and the employees were all friendly. We would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Its ok, but definitely overrated on Tripadvisor.”
Reviews.Author: sachgarris
Reviews.Content: I picked this resort after doing extensive research on other properties and we chose this over Disney Vacation Club properties because of the excellent reviews. I was a little dissappointed to say the least. I guess if you stayed in one of the new buildings with the flat screen TVs then maybe it was great. However, our room was old, showing wear and tear, and had old non-flat screen TVs. The resort is located very close to the interstate and you can hear the hum of the traffic throughout the entire resort, even the buildings that were furthest away. We stayed in building 15 (oldest and closest to interstate) with kids ages 2, 4, and 7 and could hear the traffic at night when we were trying to get to sleep. The 2 bedroom was spacious enough, but the room in general was not very clean. There was a huge roach in the kitchen that disappeared under the dishwasher and was never seen again. There was rust on the stove, dishwasher, and fridge. The shower head in the 2nd bedroom shower feel off and hit my 4 year old on the foot when we turned it on for the first time. I reported this to maintenance and they promptly came up and replaced it and said "sorry". Luckily after my son cried for about 1/2 hour, he was ok. The staff at the front desk were not very helpful and the maid service wanted to clean your room by 9 am!! Definitely put up your do not disturb sign so they won't knock so early and wake you up. The one positive is the kids loved the pirate ship pool alot and it looked like the kids activites were fun even though we didnt participate in them. Also, it was very close to Sea World and not far from Disney. The sales people tried their hardest to get us to take a tour, but we firmly told them no and they left us alone. We have been thinking about buying into a timeshare for awhile and hoping this would be the one we like best, unfortunately, not the case. Why would we spend thousands of dollars on an aging timeshare when we got an excellent rate on the internet? This is our 3rd Marriott timeshare we have tried and I think it will be the last! Hilton is much nicer for sure. Marriott needs to step up its service if they want people to buy into their timeshares.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS! CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK NEXT YEAR!”
Reviews.Author: Chicago_ILKristine
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and the grounds were great! The family activities that the hotel offers are wonderful! We didn't even need to leave the hotel, because the kids were having a blast! I highly reccommend staying in a villa with a kitchen. It's not worth going out to dinner everynight (it's too expensive) and the hotel provides outdoor grills to cook on...which we used! Our children are 6 and 2 and they just loved it! Older kids will love it too, they actually have teen nights for them! The food was great and they even offered free popcorn for everyone everday in the lobby! Sea World is right across the street! You can go to the park and then go back to the hotel for a nap. Then return for the fireworks at night. Although you can see them from your hotel too! We can't wait to go back next year! I promise you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but disappointed with food and cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: sdew01
Reviews.Content: After reading all the fab reviews on this site I was expecting a gorgeous room and an outstanding holiday. However I was disappointed on arrival - the check in staff could not be be that bothered with us - handed over the room key and did not tell us where the nearest restaurant or supermarket was. Two days later we asked the barman - Mark who went running off to reception and came back with a map. He was super helpful. The bath had dead flies in so the children refused to shower - sorted out though the following day and the whole room was recleaned which was great as normally only one clean a week which was not too impressive. Pool facilities were fantastic though for the children with waterslides and loads of sunbeds. All bar staff were great but food was cold and not a great choice. There is no where walkable for eating out so we made use of the kitchen facilities and ate in most nights. Close to the interstate for easy access to DIsney and close to Seaworld too.

Reviews.Title: “Best vaca bar none! Great 4 all ages, Perfect lay out, Great pools. Tons to do”
Reviews.Author: famkidstravel
Reviews.Content: Just got back from one wk stay. It was a slice of heaven! Kids did not want to leave. Pool(s)/water areas (the whole place) was clean and very fun. Great staff. The tall water slide (plunge) is perfect for all ages, and the pirate pool is a great area to relax w/ toddlers or older kids (multiple kiddie water slides, canons, etc). It's amazing to me that no matter what bldg you are in, it takes no time to get where you want to be -- the lay out is perfect -- the place is not too big, but still tons to do and never seems crowded-- mini golf, 3 pool areas, hot tub, table tennis, play area, raquet ct, grill/bar, arcade, fitness ctr and huge fishing/sitting area off of the lake. The villas were also very clean, large & contemporary (3 flat screens in the 2 bdrm units). Super comfortable mattresses, feather pillows and comforters with covers -- no ugly bedspreads. The coolest shower head in master bath. Washer/dryer in every unit. Tiled kitchen/bath. All amenities you could possibly need. Great flexible activities for all ages (kids, teen, adult). E.g. pool exercise class, cane pole fishing, scooter racing, scavenger hunts, parents' night out, ice cream socials, mixed drink class. Marriott owned so always reliable service. You call, they answer your need. 10-15 min from Disney parks depending on traffic. Next door to SeaWorld. Highly recommend it; it was our best family vacation bar none. Great security too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family resort...amazing!”
Reviews.Author: sunnyCA28
Reviews.Content: We loved every aspect of the Marriott Harbour Lake! The rooms are incredibly spacious! We were traveling with both young children and grandparents and all 6 of us were comfortable in the suite. The kitchens are very well stocked with dishes, cookware, etc. and we grilled a few nights. Going to the super Wal Mart down the road saved us a lot (vs. eating out) and it was nice to have breakfasts and some dinners in the room. For Marriott Rewards Visa cardholders...buy your Disney park tickets from the concierge and you can get points for the purchase! We have the black signature card so we get 5 points per dollar spent with Marriott and so buying our 5 day park tickets from the desk meant we got a lot of points! This hotel is wonderful--I would highly recommend this to all families with kids. The pools, activities, and spacious rooms make for a fun and comfortable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort/ great for families”
Reviews.Author: mv68
Reviews.Content: My mother, 7 yo daughter and myself stayed at Marriott Harbour Lake from May 24th to May 31. We are Marriott timeshare owners had received a bonus week for giving up a unit in Aruba and after reading the reviews we decided for Marriott Harbour Lake. And I am very glad we did. iIt is a wonderful resort with great layout, not too big not too small and most of all it is great for children. We stayed in building 29 in a one bedroom. it is probably one of the older buildings ( I heard from the staff that building #31 opened about a month ago), but it was big, clean, with everything you need in the kitchen. There are two pools with great waterpark and slides. The "Captain's crew" does the children activites, and they do an oustanding job. My best regards to Sarah, Amelia and all of them. My daughter never wanted to participate at any activities on previous vacations, but this time was the opposite; they did painting, water games, can pole fishing, tye dye shirts, karaoke and many more. I will probably repeat what other people wrote, since I read almost all the reviews before we left, but let me tell you, the resort is even better then the reviews. There is a pool grill with good food, drinks, not pricey, good service, nice staff. We enjoyed having full access to the minigolf course for 25 $/ wk. There are basketball courts, ping pong tables, biliard table, grills. The resort has a great atmosphere, people are so nice and friendly. We had a complimetary picture taken by the photographer, Robyn; she saw my daughter singing karaoke and took a picture and gave it to us. It is a great place for sun, relaxation in Orlando. We'll go back !

Reviews.Title: “Great, Great , Great!! Cant wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: valdan19881988
Reviews.Content: My children (17 and 14) and I arrived at Harbor Lakes on Friday, May 22 at around 2:00 pm. My husdand and parents arrived later that night. Our check in was quick and painless. We requested the new building with the lockoff. We stayed in rooms 3136 and 3137 on the third floor of Sunken Treasue. We had a wonderful view of the fireworks at Sea World. Our room was clean and very well kept. This issue always a huge issue with my mom and I so we were so relieved to find everything so clean. The resort seemed crowded but we never heard a sound from above or below us. The beds were so wonderful. I just melted into it every night. The rooms were so dark when the drapes were drawn. Great for sleeping. My family enjoyed the putt putt every day. This was a plus because we didnt have to pay for it and it was just as nice a Pirates Cove that \would have cost us $30. The pool was also great for us. It was lobcated close to a game area with a pool table, ping pong and bbq grills. It was a great layout. The resort is locate only a few minutes from the parks. Close enough that we came back to our room to eat lunch every day. We are making plans to return next summer.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing resort - we will definitely stay here again! 5 Stars!”
Reviews.Author: ECWS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 2 children, age 4 1/2 and 1 1/2, and my mother-in-law to Orlando for a week long stay at the Harbour Lake Resort. We stayed in a 2 BR 2 bath room with a full kitchen, washer/dryer, 3 flat screens, 3 DVD players and plenty of room for all of us. I requested a pack-n-play and high chair before our arrival and they were in the room when we arrived. The beds were VERY comfortable and the showers were great. My son LOVED the pirate pool, the water slide, and the play equipment. We could have skipped a couple days at Disney all together and just stayed at the hotel. Speaking of Disney, the resort was a little over 10 minutes away and Seaworld is right around the corner. We are already planning our trip next year and we will stay at this resort again. AND we are bringing a bunch of friends (and their little ones) with us. I have done alot of traveling and for a family with young children this is an amazing resort!

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect for Families”
Reviews.Author: j9lach
Reviews.Content: "Ditto" regarding the most recent reviews. We just got back from a 5 day stay and Marriott Harbor Lake exceeded our expectations. Great location and always something to do. My kids (5, 9, 10) actually enjoyed the home-made pirate skits that the staff created for viewing on the hotel TV channel. My 5 year old loved meeting them and seeing them at the activites and collecting tokens that they could turn in for a prizes. We will be back. (Nest time will spend more time at the hotel instead of only at the theme parks. Thanks for a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste you time on the karaoke”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixsunPhoenix
Reviews.Content: Same karaoke guy as the one that they use at Marriott Cypress Harbour. Show was same ole, same ole as Cypress. Guess they use the same activities manager. The sales staff tells you how everthing is top of the line and world class. Guess they didn't watch their own karaoke show. Save you money and time and go see a professional show out in town.

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous resort......”
Reviews.Author: mikeg33
Reviews.Content: Before arriving, we had read all the resorts so we were expecting it to be great. However, it was even better than we had imagined. We arrived very late on Friday night, and were greated by a very friendly individual. We were amazed that check-in took less than 5 minutes. The location of the resort we felt was great. It is right near Sea World, and only a 10 minute drive to either Disney or Universal Studios. There is a 711 right up the road for any essentials. We We had previously requested the newest section of the resort, which is 30 and 31. The room itself was beautiful. A full kitchen, nice eating area, and a balcony all greeted us. The master bedroom had a king size bed, and an amazing shower. 2nd bedroom had two queen beds and a nice size bathroom as well. As for the resort, all I can say it is a children's paradise. My wife and I traveled with 3 kids, a 10, 4, and 2 year old. They were thoroughly entertained the entire week. There were activities for both age groups. The activity staff does an amazing job. The pool areas were great. They have a pirate ship with slides for kids of all ages, even my wife and I went down. All the pools have a shallow entry point, which was good for the kids. There was also a kiddie pool and jacuzzi all near by. The other pool had a large slide for older kids and adults. This was fun as well. We must have gone down it 30 times each. The staff we found to be very friendly. As I had previously said, the entertainment group was friendly. The staff at the Bar and Grill by the pirate ship pool were so friendly, and made the best Margueritas and Bloody Mary's for those that were interested. As for the time share, they really did not bother us. We had swapped out our week in las Vegas for this week. We received one call from the, and when we said we were not interested, that was it. The resort was so much fun, that we wound up only going to Disney one day. We had planned to go more, but the kids were having so much fun, that they did not want to go. Would definetely recommend to anyone with children of any age.....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort - Why even go to Disney??”
Reviews.Author: Momma_Lisa
Reviews.Content: Once again TripAdvisor reviewers came through. This WAS the best resort outside Disney. Stayed April 17 - 24th. Building 12 - 5th floor overlooking the lake. Room had 2 spacious bedrooms and baths. Master with king overlooked the lake with an attached spa shower/sink and good size closet. The safe was only a key entry. Comode in a separate closet. 2nd bedroom had two queens and a spacious closet. Spacious kitchen with washer/dryer unit, stove, dishwasher. Pros: Large spacious, clean, well stocked room. +++New pirate pool and slide pools. +++shaded children's pool. There must be 5 pool areas. + Outside pool bar. +++Friendly and helpful staff. Can not say enough about the staff! Joanne Mitchell @ the slide pool found a purse. Apparently, gave it to security who returned to an airline employee 'guest'. I witnessed the guest only thanking her for 'saving' the purse with all it's credit cards and cash. But not even giving her a tip or asking who her boss was. Really commendable in my opinion. +Recreational itinerary for every day and every age. Even the parents! Our son didn't want to go to Disney. Can you beilive it & neither did we!? + Pool snack bar at each pool. + campfire and games at night +pingpong ++ the lake ++ the boardwalk along the lake +++ the boats and skiers on the lake ++close proximity to Sea World +++ Resort plans to expand ++ Place is immaculate and well maintained from the areas we went to. ++ the Pirate came to our room for my hubby's birthday. ++tiedie tshirts for our son. ++Resort photo - but we missed it since I was sick and forgot. Got a cold Cons: - You can't tip the staff. ? Maybe its a plus to some people. - No real blankets for us northerners. - Safe with no digital lock - key lock. - Be forewarned. Heavy time share sales pitch. We love the resort and really were interested in buying in. Marriott Sales Group would NOT extend the quoted price of chicken scratch for a week so that we could investigate the resorts in the time share community. They use worse than car salesmen tactics and no firm prices printed on paper. Very disappointing and therefore they didn't get a sale from us. We had to sign a waiver saying we lose the 10% discount by not buying that day. Amazing!!!! Left a very poor taste for Marriott timeshares hence the negative review. Otherwise they would get 5 stars.
