Lovely resort and well worth the money. Don't take too many days at Disney. We thought SeaWorld was the better venue. Buy 1 day - 2nd day free.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!!!”
Reviews.Author: glbkge
Reviews.Content: Three families (six adults & four kids, aged 4 to 10) stayed in three units in Building 31. The units were meticulously clean & beatifully appointed. We were on the 5th floor & the balconies faced a small lake with a fountain. Beds were very comfortable & units very quiet. We were a short walk from one of the two themed pools. One pool has a water slide & the other a pirate ship. In addition there are hot tubs & splash pads. I can't imagine a better set-up for groups with children. There is a kids' activity program & recreational equipment available.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families”
Reviews.Author: abbyamy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our third stay at this resort and were not disappointed. Our room had two bedrooms, two baths, washer/dryer, screened deck and a full kitchen. Located very near to many attractions, but you don't have to leave the resort to have fun. Resort has two full-sized pools with slides, plus two kiddie pools and three hot tubs, mini golf, ping pong and basketball, play scape, game room, fitness room, swings by the water, grills. Everything is clean and comfortable. Plenty of activities to get involved in, but no one will bother you if you just want to relax and do your own thing. Staff is friendly but some could be a little more helpful with special requests.

Reviews.Title: “Kids had the time of their life”
Reviews.Author: Clyone
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Marriott's Harbor Lake (Horizons) and we had a blast. The kids enjoyed the pools and played until they were exhausted. The Pirate ship was a tremendous hit and enjoyed by mom and dad as well. Lots of activities: putt putt, tie dying, arcade and ice cream sundaes. Minutes from Sea World and Disney. Rooms were excellent and so was the entire resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great activities”
Reviews.Author: FDFromNJ
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at this resort, where we own a week. Our kids are 10 and 15 and both enjoyed activities at the resort quite a bit. It's also located well as a jump-off point for theme parks, Kennedy Space Center, etc. It appears that this year the resort has started to change some things around, particularly having activities for teenagers as well as younger kids. This is a great change for us and we look forward to more of the same.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: Freezin_in_WI
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 split a two bedroom with another family of 3. We had plenty of room and enjoyed having the full kitchen to save lots of money on dining out. Our room was clean and invitingly decorated. This is the 4th Marriott Vacation Club location we have stayed at and have been very pleased with every one of them. Our kids were the perfect ages (two 4 yr olds and an 8 yr old). They loved the pools, slides and mini golf. It was nice to have 3 hot tubs, too. There was a schedule of activities they could participate in and had lots to do. If you have teenagers, they even have activities for them. We stayed an entire week and they were perfectly happy to spend time at the hotel. We only left to go to Sea World twice which was the shortest and easiest drive ever. Grocery shopping was very close by too. I would highly recommend this resort for families. If you do not like children, I would not recommend scheduling your visit during peak family vacation times (summer and holidays) because there are kids everywhere. That could easily be remedied with an adult only pool. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. They always went out of their way to smile and say hello. The only complaint I can think of is that the WiFi was on the fritz the first half of our stay. We weren't bothered too much by them trying to sell us membership into the vacation club. They are not overly pushy or rude in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, super clean place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Rigson
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at the Marriott Horizon's (now Harbour Lake) and had a great time. I was very impressed with the cleanliness of the condo, it really was immaculate. It was in the newest building and overlooked the pond/lake w/ fountain and the entrance to the resort. No pool view but we were very pleased. The unit was very comfortable and slept 7 (5 adults/2 kids) without a problem. The bedrooms were large and the beds & bedding were the most comfortable I have slept in. We had FREE Wi-Fi, 3 plasma TV's (one in the living room and every bedroom). The shower in the master was a dual shower head. Everything was well stocked, with extra paper towels, soaps, dish soap, etc.... We had a washer & dryer in our unit which was very handy. The staff was helpful and the kids loved the mini golf, pools, water slide and jungle gym area. The location was a few miles from a Publix Grocery store & the Premium outlet mall. Very nice & I would definitely stay again. Travel to Disney was about 15 minutes & it was located conveniently off of I-4, very close to Sea World & Discovery Cove. I recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Pools, activites and minigolf made kids like it better than Disney Villas”
Reviews.Author: Cindy_Louer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort for a week during March Break and didn't find it crowded at all. Our villa was not luxurious, but was very pleasantly decorated and the screened balcony was great for the two dinners we had in. The pools were excellent, as all the other reviews indicate. The kids - ages 5 and 8 - loved them. Ditto for the mini golf. It's a beautifully landscaped course and a relaxing diversion for the whole family. There was also a decent games pavillion by the small lake, which we used only briefly once to play pool and pingpong since we were on the go so much. Only drawback is the food at the pool bar, which just wasn't very good, and the lack of any other food services on site. A decent snack bar or restaurant would make a big difference. This is the 3rd place we've stayed in Orlando. We've also stayed at Animal Kingdom and the villas at Wilderness Lodge, and the kids preferred the Marriott hands down. My husband and I like all three of them equally for different reasons. All excellent choices in our book. Some of the activities we did while in the area were Discovery Cove and the Kennedy Space Centre. Both highly recommended. We also went to Sea World, where the shows were very good, but the park itself pales next to the likes of Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for anything more!”
Reviews.Author: Travelco1400
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from our 8 day stay at Horizons (now Harbour Lake). There is no shortage of activities for kids (ours are 11 & 13). The entertainment staff gears many activities for various ages. The teen functions were a big hit (dodge-ball, BB, capture the flag). As we planned our days, the kids always wanted to be back by a certain time so they didn't miss anything! We stayed in Building 15 (facing the lake & closest to the highway). Wouldn't be my 1st choice, but the highway noise sounds like "white noise". No horns or screeching cars. Overall, it sounded like an A/C constantly running and never kept us awake. +We were never called or asked about timeshares. +Kids would have been happy passing one day at parks to stay at resort. -Very early check-out (10 am). Couldn't extend to desired time because of spring break. -Bring your own hair-dryer. One provided was like standing in a cool breeze. Our family would love to return...a GREAT vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place in every way!!”
Reviews.Author: Nofibgb
Reviews.Content: We had seven people staying in a two bedroom villa. Myself, wife, 3 year old and 3 month old. My father and my sister and her husband. We were a bit concerned about the sleeping arrangements but my family slept in one room with the two beds and my sister and husband took the master. My dad took one for the team and slept on the pull out sleeper and was ok. We REALLY enjoyed this place. The pools are great for kids. One of the pools is zero depth in part of it and gradually gets deeper but there's a large area that smaller kids can play in by the pirate ship and you don't need to worry. The other pool is probably geared toward older kids and adults, as it has the water slide that you must be 42" tall to go on. The spray park was being maintained when we were there but looks like it would be a lot of fun for the kids. There's enough to do at the resort that you don't need to spend 5 days at Disney. Mini golf, basketball courts with hoops that lower, game room, ping pong, etc. The grounds were very well maintained and the staff was very helpful and always said hi as you passed them. We stayed in building 15 that overlooked the lake and was close to the pools. I heard it was one of the older builldings but it was built in 2001 and the units were in very good shape. It was nice to have a view of the water instead of facing another building. There is a Super Wal-Mart and a Publix close so you can stock up when you get there. I'd highly recommend this place for anyone with kids and even if you don't, you'll enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back:)”
Reviews.Author: Maine2002
Reviews.Content: I traded for this resort through interval. My 4 year old is into pirates so when I heard this place was pirate themed I booked it. From the pirate water slide pool for youngsters, to the playground, to treasure hunts. Such a fun place for kids. All the pools worked out well...they were walk in pools, so I did not have to worry about my two year old who does not know how to swim. They also have a special water park for toddlers....it was closed for upgrading when we were there...but looked like a lot of FUN!!! There is also a pool that has a water slide (must be atleast 42 inches to go on). They also have a great mini golf course...it's actually impressive for a smaller resort. I loved how you had a smaller resort with big resort living. There is a wonderful opportunity to have a free 5x7 family photo taken. If you want they can sell you a package aswell....NO high pressure sales though. We did enjoy the Family karyoke one night...that was a lot of fun. There is also a great little area to grill out or play some pool while the kids are on enclosed playground. My kids enjoyed this place so much, I had to bribe them to leave to go to Disney. Overall just a great Family friendly place...I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “My kids favorite place to stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: djschwar
Reviews.Content: We bought a week at Horizons back in Jan '2002 while we still living in the Orlando area. Unfortunately all we could afford at the time was to buy it for every other year. But this has become my children's absolute favorite place to stay. Activities are planned throughout the week. A couple of the favorites of my kids were the miniature golf course and the afternoon ice cream sundae parties. For a relatively small price the family can have unlimited use of the miniature golf during the week. We always have a two bedroom unit and it's comfortable, though perhaps a bit smaller than other timeshare resorts. The staff is friendly and always willing to help out with any problems. Also a plus is having the washer/dryer in the unit. It's working overtime with my kids constantly using up towels for swimming. We were unfortunate for 2008 in that by the time we figured out what week during the summer we could all get away, Horizon's was fully booked, so we had to stay at another Marriott resort (which was also beautiful, but didn't have as many activities for the kids). I would highly recommend this as either a time share purchase or just for a week (or weekend) getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families with kids!”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravelerBuffalo
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 1 week stay @ Horizons Orlando in a 1 bedroom villa with our (2) kids, ages 6 and 3 1/2. We are Interval owners and exchanged a week for our stay. We had a great week and would recommend this resort to others with kids. I would not recommend Horizons to anyone who wants a quiet, adult experience. There are kids all over the place, in a good way. Lots of fun and new friends for little ones. Overall Positives: 1. Very, very clean from the grounds to the villas to pool areas. Grounds/Housekeeping are very present and constant. 2. Great staff, very attentive and accommodating. 3. Resort is a nice managable size, not sprawling. easy to walk around to all areas/buildings. 4. Beautifully laid out, lots of places to relax outside of pool areas. Nice dock on the lake, lots of swing chairs. All Key West style buildings. Big firepit, grill area. 5. Great pools. Both pools were open for use during our stay. 6. Lots of non-swim stuff for kids to do (Captain's Quarters/Supervised craft area, Pool/Fooseball/Ping-pong/Video Games area, Great playground). Saw members of Captain's Crew (like camp counselors) attached to kids all the time. 7. Resort location close to everything (shopping, dining, theme parks). No more than a 10 minute drive to most places you would want/need. But you definitely need a car, not really walking distance to anything. There is a public bus that runs on Westwood to I-Drive, but it's inconvenient for shopping, etc. Overall Negatives: 1. Too close to I-4. The ever-present traffic noise is kind of a bummer. Eventually, you don't hear it, but you always know it's there. 2. We learned that they tend to do resort maintenance during Jan/Feb, their "down" months. As such, Pirate Ship pool was closed first 3 days we were there for repainting. However, the Pirate's Plunge pool was open and operating. In addition, they had set up (2) bounce houses for the kids to play on while the pirate ship pool was closed. Nice, considering they didn't have to. Management committed to have Pirate Ship pool open by Monday of our stay and they met their commitment, so we were able to enjoy it. As we were leaving, they had closed the Spash area in the Pirate's Plunge pool area so that they could paint it as well. I guess the price of cleanliness and beautiful grounds is constant maintenance. In the end, it didn't spoil our fun, though. Villa positives: 1. We were in Bldg 31, which faces Westwood Road (Main Entrance), 6th floor, in a 1 bedroom lock-off unit. Kids slept on pull-out queen sofa bed that was actually not too bad to sleep on. Overall OK location. Not the best but not the worst in the resort. If I were to pick a location, I would get a room overlooking the Pirate Ship pool. Nicest view. 2. Lovely interior decor. Key West style. Nice bright colors. Our building was opened in Dec 08, so the room was brand new and felt like it. Again, clean! clean! clean! 3. Large flat panel LG TVs in Master and Living Rooms. Separate DVD players for each as well. Helpful with little kids... 4. Nice kitchen area. Large enough to prepare a family meal with ease. Also, very well stocked with utensils, cooking equipment. Villa negatives: 1. They should consider upgrading the appointments in the villas. We have stayed in villas in other nearby resorts and they usually have things like granite/stone countertops in kitchen and bath areas, jetted tubs in Master bath. Our Horizons villa had formica counters...just not as nice (it's minor, but I noticed). Bathroom, while perfectly OK, felt like a plain old hotel bathroom, not a villa bathroom. Final tip: For those who don't want the timeshare people calling at 8am during their stay: don't pick up the "welcome package" they offer you when you check-in. It is the loss-leader for the timeshare folks to lure you in. Once you accept that package, they have free license to call you and hound you 'til you give in to the timeshare tour. If you don't pick it up, they don't ever call. You're not missing anything big if you don't pick up the package. Hope you have as much fun as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, but No pool”
Reviews.Author: KSP-HHI
Reviews.Content: We just stayed for the weekend at the Horizons by Marriott. The room was nice and new. The location was good as well. We did not get hounded by the sales staff. The only problem, and it was a big one, was that the main attraction for the kids was out of commision. The pirate pool was closed. This was why we picked this location and would have stayed elsewhere had we known. There was nothing mentioned when this reservation was made about the pool being closed. Marriott is usually good about noting problems or construction at locations, but they missed it on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: sdmiller95
Reviews.Content: My family (2 adults, 2 kids) stayed in an efficiency (much like a regular hotel room, but a bit more space, small kitchenette and a screened in porch) we bought through Interval (getaway). Overall, the efficiency worked for us, though by the end of the week, we were ready for more space! Really like the Horizon- Pro's: - Great family pool area and play area (you could easily have spent the whole day there if you weren't going to the parks) - OK food on site - Clean - Felt very secure on site - Very attractive property...nice to walk around - For an efficiency, the room (especially bathroom) was nice sized - Great amount of storage if you unpack - Easy to get to the resort from I-4 (but away from all of the hubub of 192), and easy to get to the parks by just hopping onto I-4. Con's: - Bedspread on the bed was very annoying...blanket inside of bedspread kept falling down in the night...hard to explain until you experience it! - No laundry available (there was a place for one in our building, but it was out of order...and even then, it was the only one in the whole building...though I assume the 1 and 2 bedroom units each have their own laundry) - Kind of a pushy sales staff...but they did give us $100 for going through the 90 minute preview...and we were out of there in 90 minutes! - These cons are petty I realize...but that's all we could come up with. We loved the place. FYI - I love going to Orlando in January and February. Weather is overall nice (much better than northern Indiana!), and the parks are not busy at all.

Reviews.Title: “winter trip”
Reviews.Author: wintertraveler1
Reviews.Content: jan.9-jan.16 Off season is great time in Orlando. Parks not crowded. weather was 50-60's. Kennedy space center very nice. universal lines 5-20 min. Stayed at horizons for a week. Bed very soft my back took a little to adjust. No hot tub in room but by the pool nice and warm. pool was warm also. POOL RENOVATIONS TAKING PLACE ONE POOL AND ONE HOT TUB AREA CLOSED. Kids a little upset. It was a little further from room not sure how much use any way, looked nice. Stayed in room 2054 very nice room. 4 people plenty of room, flat screens nice.Walmart 5 minutes away movie rentals $1. In the summer when kids could use the pools more this would be very nice. Nice slide if stayed open. We liked the basketball courts, pool tables and ping-pong. Bar/grill not used. My only real complaint was pool and hot tub was closed. free put-putt would have been nice. $24 a week was pretty high I thought unless you play several games.

Reviews.Title: “great choice for families”
Reviews.Author: mjhelmkamp
Reviews.Content: We own a time share at the Horizons but had never stayed there until earlier this month. We (husband, myself and 2 kids ages 4 and 7) stayed in a large, attractive, and very comfortable 2 bedrm/2 bath with full (and well equipped) kitchen. The staff responded to small problems immediately and competently. In fact every employee from check in to check out was friendly and accommodating. Special kudos to the childrens' entertainment staff; the events for kids (mostly geared to the pre teen and teen crowd actually) were engaging, especially the poolside ones. Location is great for Sea World, farther to the Disney resorts. The pools were great though one was closed for refurbishment; it was a bit chilly most of our days there so no loss. Would need a car definitely. There is a bar/grill on site but no real restaurant; we had a decent if expensive meal at the grill one day but mostly ate in. Overall a top notch vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific for families”
Reviews.Author: jlp879
Reviews.Content: This Marriott timeshare property certainly met and exceeded our expectations. Our family of 5 stayed in a two bedroom/two bathroom unit the week of Thanksgiving. The unit was large enough that we could spread out and not be in each other’s way and offered many conveniences of home. The combined kitchen/dining/living room area was roomy and led to a large screened in porch that held a table and chairs for four. The kitchen contained everything we needed to cook in our unit if we so desired. There were enough dishes and utensils for eight people. This Marriott property felt like a summer family camp. The resort had so many amenities we could not even make use of them all. Most of them were geared to kids, and our kids liked them so much that they wanted to spend more time at the resort instead of going to the Disney parks. First off, there were two separate pool areas. The Horizons Harbour pool area was right below our balcony in building 13. This was a pool with a pirate ship water play area built in. The pool was a nice temperature, and though the pirate ship looked to me as if it would only appeal to toddlers, my 11 and 9 year olds loved it as well. The other pool area, Pirate Plunge, was across the “street” from our building, and because of this, we spent less time at it. Also, it had a twisty water slide entering it that had a 42” height requirement. The Pirate Plunge area also had a water playground area, but this water was not heated like the pools, so it wasn’t attracting any kids in November. As well as the pools, which our kids could not get enough of, there was miniature golf, ping pong tables, fooze ball, and a sport court. There was also an outdoor firepit which we never used. The resort was centrally located to all tourist attractions in Orlando. It was especially close to Sea World. A five minute drive had you to a grocery store and drug store. The resort complex was big, but not so big that you felt you were walking great distances from one area to another. Our kids loved the place so much, they really did not care about all the Orlando area attractions. However, for parents, I would have like to see a real restaurant on-site. Sure there was the Harborside pool bar and grill that we ate at because it was convenient, but it didn’t have a very diverse menu. This resort is clearly geared to families with young kids. Marriott has done a lot of things right to appeal to this target audience and as a result, the resort was full of multi-generational families. It is a great retreat for kids, but slightly less relaxing for adults.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect...”
Reviews.Author: godzuki24
Reviews.Content: Marriott knows their stuff. Clearly you can see from the other reviews that this place is great. I'm an owner at the new Myrtle Beach location and found the Horizon's to be top notch. Here are my thoughts, relative to my other Vacation Club experiences and Marriott/Marriott level resort experiences. Front Desk Staff (Checkin)- Super friendly and excited to see you. They could do a better job of explaining things for new visitors, but this isn't a big deal. Rooms- well appointed and spacious. You can fit as many people and more. GREAT kitchen layout and appliances. BRs are nice and there are enough TVs to keep any family happy. Balconies are a nice touch and safe for the kids. Pool- great, pool staff was great. Food/Dining- standard fare with professional and friendly staff. Always a Marriott trademark and they hit the nail on the head here. Activities- There are two types here and this was a bit of a problem. You had retirees/adult staff who took pride in their work and really went out of their way to make you feel welcome. They did a phenomenal job. Then there were the "kids" who seemed to be there because they had to. Not a care in the world other than where they were going to party this coming weekend. Simply put, they might as well have been paintings on the wall. Sad, but I guess not everything can be perfect. Concierge- BIG let down. In a town like Orlando I would have expected a professional who knew what to do, where to do it and be able to get me some sort of discount. None of this happened. The week we stayed there were three young ladies who seldom smiled, didn't ask how things went the night before, nor took initiative to help out with future planning. Suprised, and saddened as a seasoned business traveler I count on concierge's and other industry professionals to guide me- and reward them handsomely for it. Misc- The BBQ grills on property need to be updated. Either bring in new gas grills or clean up/replace the existing ones. This may seem trivial, but the MB property has top notch Weber(like) gas grills emacculately cleaned daily and ready for use, not to mention very strategically located throughout the property. The directions that they provide you with to go places are pretty weak. Overall, the place is great. Its down the block from Seaworld- which is my favorite, and a short drive to Disney as well as many other attractions on International Blvd. We'll be back whether they make changes or not. Which means Horizon's is THAT great or I'm a sucker.

Reviews.Title: “We WILL be back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: FunintheSunJenn
Reviews.Content: My husband, my 3yr son and myself stayed here in October. We have been to Florida a few times and this time even went to Clearwater Beach before making it to this resort. I love the beach but once getting here I wish we had spent the hole time here. We had an amazing time. The staff were great. The rooms were HUGE and clean and were way to big for just the 3 of us, which is a good thing. The pools...ohhh the pools...just amazing...We could safely sit by and watch our son splash and run around and not have to worry about him falling in, running off, etc... all the pools have the gradual walk in which is key. We even got into it, going down the slides and such, good times. My son of course LOVED the little pools which was fine with us as the bar with drinks and food were right there. We did do some Disney parks and realize that next year we will stay longer so we can fit the parks and the resort in. This has been the best family vacation BY FAR, cause if my son is amuzed by day and past out good at night it is a good trip for us:):) Bottom line is 3 months later my 3 year old son can STILL remember it and still asks "Can we go to Florida now"

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: kmh73
Reviews.Content: My family took our first Disney trip the week after Christmas. After tons of research, we decided to stay here vs. a Disney resort based on the fact that we could get a two bedroom villa, kitchen, etc., for way less than a Disney basic room with not even a mini fridge or microwave. We arrived in the area 3 hours before check-in and were thrilled that our room was ready, in a brand new building that just opened 2 weeks prior. The villa was spacious and immaculate. A nice Publix is minutes away, so stocking the fridge was the first order of business. (Paper towels, toilet paper, dish detergent, sponge, dishwasher detergent, soap, shampoo, and laundry detergent for one load are provided). The amenities to entertain children are great-mini golf, pools, game room, outdoor ping pong, pool table, playground. Likewise, the 2 pool bars kept the parents happy, one of which serves food and take-out. Everything within the resort is within a 2-3 minute walking distance. When researching other resorts, many seemed so massive; I didn't want to have to get in a car to drive to the pool. While the location is right off of I-4, I don't believe any of the balconies faced the Interstate. I didn't notice any highway noise, even with doors open. Didn't get to check out the gym due to our long days at the park, but there are plenty of jogging/walking friendly paths. If there were any cons, it would be the maid service, which was very sporradic. This wasn't an issue for us, as we took out our own trash and had plenty of towels. We got fresh towels and our beds made every other day. Coffee was never replenished, so be sure to pick up your own when grocery shopping. Also, be sure to take some towels to the pool-there are none provided at the pool areas. We will most likely stay here on our next trip to Disney. As we visited during a peak-week, it was nice to be away from the Disney crowds and not have to drag tired kids out to equally crowded restaurants. And the washer/dryer was put to use-kids were fithy by the end of the day, plus it allowed us to pack lighter.

Reviews.Title: “Don't pass this place up”
Reviews.Author: 4SABUNCH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Horizons Nov 15 - 20 with a group of three adults and two children (both 4 yrs old). The Horizons exceeded our expectations. I'd highly recommend this resort to anyone with a group of four or more and kids younger than teen years. I'll go through the positives first: *Great location for parks. SeaWorld is literally down the road, just a short 2 min drive. All of the Disney parks are just 2 exits south and about 10 mins to any of them. Didn't make it to Universal so can't comment on distance to them. *Close to necessities. A safe Wal Mart supercenter open 24 hrs is about 5 min drive away. A Publix grocery is also a couple of minutes away as well. Close to International drive and lost of eating/gas station options. *Security. Really nice to know that the only access into the resort was through a guarded entrance. You either have to be staying there or have your name on their list. Never once had to worry about belongings being stolen or broken into. We came back from one day at the parks to realize we hadn't fully latched the door and anyone could've walked right in.....nothing was missing. *Tremendously courteous staff. Extremely helpful staff. Have a concierge service that provides tix to all of the parks and are the same prices the parks offer. *Wonderful rooms. You are basically getting a 2BR/2BA condo. The master BR has a king, the guest has 2 queens. Pictures don't do the suites justice; you'll have TONS of space. The BRs are one half of the unit. The other half has a living room area, dining area and a full kitchen (microwave, stove, dishwasher, etc) including washer/dryer. They stock everything for you from place settings (dishes, silverware, cups, etc) and eating utensils down to laundry and dish soap. You don't need to go finding those things as they'll already have it for you. *Nice to have amenities. Each BR room has its own closet, bathroom facilities and TV. There is also a TV in the living area that has a dvd player. That was really handy to have for the kids. A safe was located in the master BR closet. *Cleanliness. Upon arrival, everything was clean and ready to use from dishes down to sheets and bathrooms. *Quiet. We were on the 3rd floor. Only heard our neighbors or those above us maybe a couple of times. Possible negatives: *Really soft beds and pillows. Can only speak for the king beds. Kind of sank into the mattress and the pillows were down-filled. We were so tired it didn't matter. *Safe isn't big enough. The in-room safe was too small to really hold anything of value other than maybe a wallet or cell phone. You won't be able to fit gaming systems or portable dvd players in it. *Hard water. You'll definitely want to get bottled water to drink and maybe even make food with. It's fine for showering or washing things but that's about it. *Possibly Dirty Carpet. We were in building 13 which may be one of the older units. In some cases, the carpets may need some cleaning. I'm sure with using the pools, they can accumulate some dirt. Plan ahead and bring some sandals or something to wear around if needed. Items you may want to know: *The Horizons is a time share resort. Expect one to two time share invitations or calls. That said, they were NEVER pushy, and took a no for a no. We only had two calls, and they were both extremely pleasant to deal with. *May have to do some self cleaning. We didn't sign up for the extra daily cleaning (charge for that), so you may need to empty trash, wash dishes, make beds yourself. Not a big deal to us. *Room entrances and hallways are exposed to, or on the outside. It's not like your typical resort where there are enclosed hallways leading to your rooms. *It was too cold for us to use the pools during our stay, but they had several to chose from and seemed to look like a lot of fun. *Read prior reviews about slow elevators. Never seemed to be an issue with us, but being on the 3rd floor may have had something to do with it. Since it was so cold, it actually felt nice to be in a somewhat warmer elevator. Overall, if you have young children and need space.... look no further. If we ever have another Disney trip planned, we'll be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Orlando Vacation”
Reviews.Author: MichelleReno_NV
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 11/7-11/14 on an exchange from Interval. The staff was more than helpful from beginning to end. This is a wonderful place to stay when traveling to Oralndo for a family vacation. Location: it does not get much better than this really. 10 min from the airport (there is really only 1 hwy, and it is a toll road. expect 2 stops for .75 cents each, $1.25 total) Sea World/Discovery Cover litterally right around the corner. .5 mile to the I-4, where you are: 2 exits from the Disney World parks (granted once off the exit Disney has you driving a couple more miles to get to the specific park you want) 1 exit from International Drive Walmart is about 5 min away. Publix (the major grocery store) about 7 min for the exploring type familis, only 1 hr to Daytona, or Kenedy Space Center. The front desk staff automatically provide a list of directions to about 10 desitnations (parks, shopping, airport, etc). Nice to have. The resort itself was fantastic. We took our daughter (6 yrs) and she had a blast. She loved the waterslide (open until 10 pm most nights), as well as the pirate ship (open until 11pm most nights). The staff coordinating the children's activities were genuinley happy to play with the kids and had lots of activities for them. They would play games to include all ages, and every child received a "wooden token". Once the kids collected 6 or 10 of these tokens, they could trade them in for prizes at the front desk. We did have a room next to the water slide, so I was a bit concerned there was going to be a lot of noise in the morning, but this was not the case at all. Not sure if it was because most families left the resort to visit the parks, but all was well, and there were no unexpected wake up noises to be had. We had a 1 bedroom and it was very spacious. Kitchen was very large and comfortable, full size refrigerator and dishwasher. It did come with pots/pans to cook, but would have been nice if it had a cookie sheet as well. The unit also had a washer/dryer so that we could wash some of our clothing. It came with one package of Tide soap, but we bought more at the Wal-Mart. The room was a good size, with lots of pillows. Since we were on an exchange we had to clean the room ourselves during our stay, but the hotel does offer a "Tidy Service" if you want them to do it for you. No idea how much it costs as we opted to clean up after ourselves. The one bathroom was a good size as well. though I would have liked an option to not have the fan on all the time the light was on. It was a bit noisy, but not unbearable. The food on site was priced a little high, but that was to be expected, as you pay for convenience. Nice to know that it was open until 11 pm, for those late night munchies. As for the timeshare call,, yes we did receive one. But we only received one call, and they were not as pushy as I have seen at other places. They try to lure you in to give you a deal on Disney tix, but we declined and they never asked again. We did receive a call for a complimentary 5x7 photo of the family, but we never had time to make the appointment and take advantage of it. A tip: Be sure to bring your own DVD's with you. The hotel does have a small selection, but charges $8 per night to rent them. If you have a membership with Blockbuster, that would be a better option. There is a Blockbuster about 8 min away, and this is a better deal. Hope this info helps!

Reviews.Title: “Huge Expectations Met and Exceeded”
Reviews.Author: GeNioS
Reviews.Content: Spent the past week 11/8 -11/15/08 at Horizons Orlando. I had gone back and forth between Horizons and Cypress Harbour for days before the reviews pushed me towards Horizons. I had high expectations and was hoping to have a good trip, but was confident I'd be let down because of such high hopes. Not a chance. Amazing stay. If you have a family, this place is awesome. And if you have children between the ages of 5 and 12, it is the best place to stay in Orlando. We are not into the typical smily-faced overly-happy "resort activity" family, but the staff makes everything so great that you can't help but want to get involved. Pools, kiddie pools (both zero-entry), hot tubs, pool tables, ping pong tables, basketball (including full size and slamball), playground, volleyball, minature golf (nice course, too), soccer field, poolside bar, campire.... If you have children between the ages are 5 and 12 and you are wondering how to fill a week in Orlando, here you go. Have your whole week planned? Cancel a couple of days and stay here. Oh yeah, and ever been on vacation and wished you could get out for dinner? Send the kids to a pirates night out and off you go..... There are places where families stay....this is a family place. We will call this home every time we go to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Family Fun”
Reviews.Author: tandmgroup
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with our 4 kids, ages 17,15,13 and 7 spent the week there the last week of October. The weather was a bit on the cool side for using the pools, but nevertheless, the kids used them anyways while mom and dad sat in the hot tubs near the pool. This is the perfect resort for families with kids. the two pools are awesome with pirate ships, slides, waterguns, water spilling everywhere for them to run through. There is a putt-putt course that you can pay 25.00 per room for unlimited play. We had a 2 bedroom and the accomodations were great. We were at the theme parks everyday so did not spend much time there. The grounds are beautiful, staff is very friendly and I would recommend this resort to anyone that has kids.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Very Nice with Room for Improvement”
Reviews.Author: jrtlab
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Horizons on an exchange week with Interval International. It is a wonderful family friendly place and could be a destination in itself. There is a 24 hour guard at the gate entering the facility and 24 hour front desk person. We really packed a lot into our trip of 8 days and 7 nights with 5 day Walt Disney World Tickets and 2 day Sea World Tickets so we did not spend a lot of time at our accomodations. However, every night without fail our three children would beg to do something at the condo - swim in the two pools or play ping pong, mostly. The grounds were wonderful as were the onsite amenities. I do have a few areas for improvement, though. My husband asked for a lake view on the sixth (top) floor so it would be quiet and relaxing. We were put on the top floor end unit of bldg 15 - the unit/bldg closest to State Route 4 - a very busy and loud highway that could even be heard inside our bedroom when trying to sleep at night and forget about spending any time on the balcony overlooking the lake. It would have been nice if they would have really listened to our request of "quiet and relaxing". It was a very nice layout in the condo, however, there was no door on the shower area of the master bath. For a condo that can sleep 8, and was sleeping 5 in our case, there really needs to be a door on the shower room. The interior of the condo was not maintained as nicely as the grounds of the facility. There was a very large stain on the carpet in the main living room and some smaller stains in the master bedroom, the carpet was visibly dirty on the outline areas, it had very visible traffic patterns worn into the carpet, and the duvet cover on the beds kept coming apart and sliding off of the comforter. All in all - the interior of the condo was nice, but had passed its prime; it needed some attention, (and sound proofing). I was also disappointed that there was a charge on some of the onsite entertainment such as a charge to get a ping pong ball and a charge to play minature golf. We were relentlessly pursued to come to the 90 minute presentation to buy a time share even though they knew we were there on an exchange week, we told them immediately that we were too heavily booked everyday with the theme parks, and that we had no interest in buying a time share there. Horizons is right around the corner from Sea World, but a good 15 minutes from the Walt Disney World Parks.

Reviews.Title: “As good as Disney's Beach Club Villas!”
Reviews.Author: SpunkyPrimate
Reviews.Content: We received a mailer from Marriot advertising a 5 day, 4 night stay at any Marriot timeshare in Orlando for $200. (A 90 minute on-site presentation is required.) We were skeptical, but did our research and eventually booked it...man, were we glad we did!! We'd stayed at Disney's Beach Club Villas our last trip, and we assumed this would be a "downgrade" comparatively. We were wrong! The pools were much more parent/child friendly, with tons of interative splash play, and a better waterslide. The kids enjoyed the Marriot "Pirate Night" way better than their evening at the BCV kid's club the year before. (The chaperones were much more kid oriented and attentive at the Marriot.) The condo itself was fantastic--the only thing we missed compared to the BVC was the whirlpool tub. They did have a deep soaking tub in the second bath, but the master bath has a generous shower. The kitchen was huge and well furnished, we had a full sized refrigerator, and the eating area and den were way more spacious than our Disney version. The location was easily accessible from 4, or International Drive. It was approximately 15 minutes into DIsneyworld each day. The one drawback we saw compared to the BVC was paying for parking, and missing the Extra Magic Hours. Granted, it is convenient to stay on Disney property, but for the price and amenities, we felt like royalty! As far as the standard pricing of Horizons, I believe rack rate is $250 a night. You probably can rent points from owners for a reduced rate. Also, the 90 minute info session ended up being less than an hour, as they understood we were not interested at all. We made it clear upfront that we had no itention of investing in a time share, and in return I think they wanted us out of there! As it is, I don't think we'll be invited back to sample their wonderful place for practically free. ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort!”
Reviews.Author: cnstiefel
Reviews.Content: We loved the Horizons. The pools were great. Next time we will plan more relaxing time just hanging out by the pools. We spent our days at the various parks and the kids could not wait to get back and swim each night. One of the pools is right next to the outdoor bar/grill so we could socialize and watch sports on the flat screens while the kids swam, so everyone had a good time. Our room overlooked one of the pools and each morning we would sit on our balcony enjoying our coffee listening to the various water features. We will definitely go back to the Horizons.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not the best”
Reviews.Author: hopesicle
Reviews.Content: The Horizons by Marriott Vacation Club is the newest of the nearby Marriott properties, but is my least favorite of the three. While everything was clean and well-maintained, the living space was smaller than the other properties. However, the two pool and recreation areas were amazing, complete with a waterslide, water play area for kids and very cute decor and appointments. They offer an arcade, outdoor volleyball, ping pong, billiards and several outdoor seating areas. We weren't traveling with children but it seemed like there were ample activiites set up for kids to enjoy, as well as family bingo and other family-oriented activities. This is a nice place to stay, don't get me wrong. The screened-in porch is clean and comfortable, the showers are good, the kitchen is well-stocked and the front desk staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Horizons was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: hckymom
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our trip to Orlando (8/23-8/30/08) where we stayed at Horizons. Before making the exchange thru Interval, I checked this site out for reviews. I agree with everyone who loved this place. I have a family of 5, hubby & myself, 11yo son, 2 daughters 4 & 5. We all loved it. The pools are wonderful for kids. Since there's 2 we really didn't feel crowded. We hung out at the pirate ship pool which is geared for younger kids but my son had fun also. When it got crowded we went to the other pool with the big slide. This was also perfect for all ages since they had a zero depth entry. The activities were nice and the staff was very nice to all of us. The room was very spacious. 2 bedrooms and a nice size kitchen & living room. The master bath was great very big and the 2 shower heads was nice. The kids only wanted to take a shower in ours. We had a great view of the pirate pool and the screened in balcony w/ a ceiling fan was nice since the temp was over 95 degrees. The location was very convenient to get to the parks. Seaworld & Aquatica were very close and Disney was between 10-15mins. We had no complaints everything was perfect. We usually stay on Disney grounds but this became my family's favorite backup if we can't get on grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pools”
Reviews.Author: ace4you
Reviews.Content: We swapped a week from our marriott in las Vegas to visit Horizions. Our stay was from 7/17 - 7/24 and we had a wonderful time. We had already visted the theme parks so, we spent the majority of our week at the resort. The kids (8 and 11) loved the activites, mini golf and the arts and crafts. The pirate play areas were great for adults and kids. Rooms were clean, we had a lake view which was excellent. Bathrooms were small compared to Marriott Grande Vista where we stayed the week before but, we chose this resort for the kid activities not for the rooms. I had requested an early check-in as were were moving from another Marriott 1 mile away (Grande Vista), they had a room ready for us at 8 a.m. which allowed a seemless relocation from one resort to another. The staff was very friendly, and the concierge called two days before our visit to see if we had any special needs they could assist with. The activities were excellent for adults and kids, we would visit this resort again. Once again, Marriott has a resort which is very kid friendly and with a helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good!”
Reviews.Author: JackieTripper
Reviews.Content: After reading pretty good reviews here on TA set up a last minute time share exchange here and got a nice 2 bed suite with a balcony. the room was nicely appointed and spacious, very clean. staff was helpful and friendly. seems the best rooms are those facing "lake" where you have privacy, we were on main drag but it wasn't noisy or anything. Time To Be ReFurbished Pirate Pools were crawling with kids, as was the whole place. If you don't like kids do not go here! Not much space to relax with all the kids everywhere. Kids seemed to love the place, and it felt very safe for them to explore a bit after being watched like hawks at the parks. I would reccomend this for familys with kids and larger parties.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: lcf-guy
Reviews.Content: This is a big step down from other Marriott vacation club properties, so beware. It is good for kids, close to Sea World, and has pretty good activities on site. Unfortunately it is filthy (they do not clean carpets) and in need of renovations (2009). You should pay for housekeeping, though they don't do much. If I were to do it over, I would just stay across the street at one of the better Marriotts and get a week pass for sea world/ aquatica. Management was supportive, but they don't seem to have much budget for service and upkeep.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: zanne1175
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Horizons during our recent trip to Disney. We stayed in a 2br, 2 bath with 4 adults and a 2 year old. The unit was plenty big for the 5 of us. With a 2 year old, having a kitchen, washer and dryer is priceless. My 2 year old ABSOLUTELY loved the slides on the pirate ship and the pool in general. She keeps asking when we are going back to our "Disney house." The proximity to all the Disney parks and SeaWorld is ideal. We spent some days at the pool and then headed over to the parks in the late afternoon/evening. Being pregnant, this gave me a nice break from all the walking while feeling like I was at a resort, sitting by the pool. I would recommend this timeshare to everyone but especially to families with young children!!

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get any better!”
Reviews.Author: chas83
Reviews.Content: This was the highlight of our big Georgia, Florida vacation. Everything about this place is great. I have three teens and a four year old. The Disney Hotels don't cater to families larger than 4 people, this place filled our need perfectly. The teens loved the big slide pool and my four year old told me she didn't want to ever go home after playing on the pirate ship. The pool bar kept Mom and Dad very relaxed and happy. All employees were extremely friendly and went out of their way to keep us happy. The room was large and very clean. The in-room washer and dryers came in handy. Everyone had their own plasma TV's! The view of the lake from the balcony was beautiful and it's screened so the bugs can't get to you while outside watching the lightning storms. If you are a family of 5+ and looking for a place to stay close to the amusement parks in Orlando, this is the place for you! They get a perfect score for a perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location for families”
Reviews.Author: CanJam94
Reviews.Content: Well, first let me say we never used the pools or other amenities because we were only there for the July 4 wknd and spent most of our time at Disney. But, I totally loved having a two bedroom, two bath villa with full kitchen and all flatware, cookware, and tableware for 8 at my disposal. And a combo washer/dryer, even if I never used it. I actually got a great deal due to my Marriott membership (one night free with purchase of two nights) and the total price was less than two nights at Disney Animal Kingdom standard room (which I've also reviewed). Positives: - Lots of room - Very clean and nice decor - Up-to-date appliances (stove is newer than mine at home) - Great view (Villa # 1243) - Great A/C (My husband is always stuffy at Disney, but no trouble here and it kept 70-75F easily) - Literally seconds from I4 exit (great for getting to Disney). - One block from SeaWorld (almost walkable but not with toddlers) Negatives: - No real serious ones - Our rooms were limited with outdoor light (small windows) so needed electric light even during the day in the bedrooms). Recommendations for travelers: - Shop at nearby Publix (2 blocks East on Central Florida Parkway) and have breakfast or snacks in house - If you're going to be on property for a while, they have lots of kiddie activities and the waterplay areas looked great. - Don't travel on Central Florida Parkway after 8:30 am or late afternoon. SeaWorld traffic is ridiculous. Shortcut that may help is to take a right on SeaWorld Drive from Westwood and then you have the right-of way to turn right on CFP. - If you get a room/villa with a balcony facing north, you have a great view of the SeaWorld and Universal Studios fireworks at 9pm nightly. Our balcony faced South, so we stood in front of our door on the fourth floor of bldg 12. Recommendations for Hotel: - Do housekeeping earlier in the day. The two days we were there they came at 5:30pm. - Elevators seem slow and are very hot. The corridors aren't that visually appealing either but that may be a factor of them being outdoors. Overall, our 3yo son loved it, as did my inlaws. As for the distance, I've stayed on Disney and driven almost as long to get to the park so offsite is fine for me.

Reviews.Title: “Take this with a grain of salt”
Reviews.Author: sithdent
Reviews.Content: My wife and 2 year old just returned from a week at the Horizons and had a pretty good stay. Let me state right from the start that we stayed in a studio and we have recently stayed at the Ko Olina Beach Club on Oahu and the Surf Club in Aruba - both are very nice. So we had those two resorts to compare to, which isn't fair for the Horizons, especially when staying in the studio. I looked at a 2 bedroom unit and it's definitely smaller and not as nice as the Ko Olina (or the Grande Vista, where my in-laws were staying on this same trip). Anyway, the Horizons is definitely aimed at families who are not looking for a luxurious resort experience. Decor was nice but not over the top - to compare, Ko Olina had granite counter tops in the kitchen and both baths! The pools were great. The bigger version with the pirate ship had an area bigger than most resort's entire pool where my 2 year old could walk around easily. Lots of slides and spouts to play with. There is also a kiddy pool. The location was great for Sea World and just off the freeway for about a 8-10 mile journey to WDW. It was nice to have the exit right off of the freeway. As an aside, I noticed some people talk about freeway noise in other posts. We stayed in building 29 which was a bit further away from the road, but not much. I never heard the freeway. There was construction and we did receive 3 calls at around 9.20am regarding various sales pitches. We were gone by then anyway, so it didn't bother us at all. My in-laws told us that the pools were very busy at Grande Vista, and found it difficult to get a chair one day. We only spent about 3 part days at the pool, but never had any difficulty getting a spot. The negative to the resort is probably the food/restaurants or lack thereof. I only found one restaurant, near the pirate ship/bigger pool. It was more like a casual take out from the bar type place, and was fine. I would've like more choices. But there are plenty of restaurants within easy driving distance, so it's really not a big deal. I would highly recommend NOT staying in a studio!! Especially if you're used to the one bedroom type place. We had the lockout portion to "use up" as I like to say, and felt like this room was jammed in a corner. I won't do that again!! I really felt like I was slummin' it! :) It was better than a regular hotel room, though, in that we had a toaster :) Lastly, I was expecting laundry as other studios at mariott properties have had it, and this one did not.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay with your family”
Reviews.Author: sapamire
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to stay with your family, this is the only place to look. My wife and I took our 11 and 9 year olds to this Marriott. It is fantastic. We've stayed in many places and this is the first place where we have really only positive things to say. Here's an overview of what we liked about the place. The location is right next to SeaWorld. Out of the front door, we could see the fireworks a little after 10pm. We were in building 12 and had a clear view of it. From our back patio, we could see the Disney fireworks. The 2 swimming pools there are great. One has a pirate ship and the other is almost like a water park. It has a 16 foot high slide and a play area with 2 dunking water tanks that drops hundreds of gallons of water on you. The rooms are well kept and very clean. The room has a screened in back patio. There are plenty of BBQ places, a miniature putt-putt course, arcade and a snack bar. Here's an overview of what we did: We went to the Kennedy Space Center and took the tour there. It's a great place to show the kids how our space program evolved over the years. We went to Universal Studios for 2 days -- Universal and Island Adventure. I preferred Island Adventure because I thought the rides were more fun. However, the Simpsons ride in Universal is excellent. The simulation of that ride makes you feel like you are actually free falling and riding on a rollercoaster -- well worth the visit and the wait in line. If you are going this summer, go online and get the 2 park 7 day pass for $89. It's a great deal. We also went to the Animal Kingdom. The safari ride is very good and worth the price of admission. Just make sure you get there early so you can take that tour. That is when you can see the most amount of active animals in the safari. We went to Siesta Key, south of Tampa and about 1 hour 40 minutes from the hotel. However, if you want to visit the best sandy beach in Florida, this is the place to go. The sand is ultra fine and the water is warm -- 80 degrees. The crowds are minimal, parking is easy and they have a snack shack there with all the beach food you would want. Overall, this was a fantastic family vacation. The hotel and location is excellent. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel and fully understand why this is one of the top rated hotels in the Orlando area. My kids told me already they want to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place, But A Few Drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: jbird5150
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Horizons in early June and were very impressed. We had originally booked for 4 nights at Floridays, but I kept reading how rude the employees were there so I switched (and paid more) to stay at Horizons. Plus, after seeing the Pirate Pool area on the website, I knew my kids would have a blast there! Check in was a breeze and we got a 5th floor 2 BR condo overlooking the Pirate Pool. Very clean, very well maintained, and larger than we expected. I especially liked the screened in balcony area. The timeshare folks did leave a couple of messages on our phone, but we weren't interested in a tour. I didn't feel pressured at all. There's actually two separate pool areas--one with the Pirate Ship, the other with the water slide. Both are within easy walking distance of each other. There's also an outdoor bar and grill where you can get breakfast, lunch and dinner, but no indoor seating. We never took advantage of the mini golf or basketball courts. They do have a beautiful boardwalk and dock area for fishing though--just watch out for gators! Just a few minutes from Seaworld, Discovery Cove, Aquatica so very convenient. Our stay here was fabulous, and we would definitely consider coming back. My only drawbacks were: --The king size mattress we had in our bedroom was unusually soft. We got used to it eventually, but the first morning my wife and I both woke up a little stiff and achy. --The resort is in desperate need of some sort of transportation option. I prefer not to rent cars, so all of our back and forths to theme parks, dinner shows, Publix store, even a walk in clinic (swimmer's ear) had to be done by cab. It really added up over 5 days. I would think they would at least have something complimentary for theme park transportation like the other resorts. Other than those 2 things, I really don't have a complaint about Horizons. A high recommendation, especially if you have pre-teen children.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous vacation, loved this resort”
Reviews.Author: ReneeFlorida
Reviews.Content: My family and I absolutely loved our Orlando vacation! My sister and I took 6 kids, my nieces and nephews, and I could not tear them away from the resort. My 7-year old niece said this was her new home, I could go to work everyday and she would find a babysitter to watch her while I was at work, she would call her parents and let them know. My 12-year old nephew said this was the best "real" vacation that he had ever had. We visited Universal and Islands of Adventure (twice), and if the kids had their way, we would still be there. The unit was large and very comfortable. I would absolutely recommend this resort to anyone, we had such a fantastic time there, and the staff is to be commended, they were all wonderful and pleasant. Everyone is ready to go back, and my family and I have nothing but rave reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: bruiserjohnson
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked great from tripadvisor. We got there and the pool was dirty and the room felt dirty. The straw that broke the camels back was the 8:00 a.m. wake up call asking if I wanted to buy a timeshare!! I was on vacation wanting to sleep in. We checked out and went to another resort we stayed at last year, Floridays.

Reviews.Title: “Horizons by Marriott”
Reviews.Author: mkrall3897x
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Horizons from June 23, 2007 through June 30, 2007. We had a great time. We went to Disney for 4 of the days. We spent the other 3 days doing other various excussions and spending time around the Horizons facility. My 8 year old wished he was back at the Pool at Horizons. during those hot days and long lines at Disney. I could not belive that an 8 year old would rather be at a Hotel than at Disney World!!! The property has lots to do if you have young children. From minature golf, billards ping pong, video games, basketball courts, and some big open fields me an my son had a catch on. The Property is located very close to Disney, only about 8 miles away. Sea World is less than 1 mile away. Universal was very close to I am not sure about the milage for that one. The propety was well manicured and the rooms were kept spotless. The rooms were great. Plenty of room for a big family or if you want to bring your extended family. The kitchen comes in handy with 3 kids because you don't have to go out to eat for every meal which can get expensive. We are planning our next trip for April 2009 and my family can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Horizons great for kids”
Reviews.Author: Happy_away
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Horizons Resort for a week while traveling back and forth to Disney World with two children. Horizons was a good choice. Rooms are bigger than some apartments that we rented. Two bedrooms, two baths, kitchen, living room, dining area, washer and dryer, and screened in porch. The resort has two pools, one with a pirate ship in it for younger kids, and the other has a two story water slide. Basketball courts, soccer field, and putt putt golf are also at resort. (fee for the golf, but $5 per person, or $25 for the whole week) Resort is geared towards kids and staff is constantly having activities for them. Staff is pleasant. There is a gentle push for time share meeting, but not overbearing. Would go back again. Also, its only about 15 minutes to Disney World, so very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific family place to stay, 4th time for me”
Reviews.Author: OnMyMind
Reviews.Content: Horizon's By Marriott Orlando never seems to disappoint. This is the 4th time I have rented one of their condos, and it is always great. Excellent family environment with minature golf, two water parks and other activities. The grounds are secure (carded gate access) and are beautiful. Staff are friendly and helpful. Horizons was especially important on this trip, after we originally tried another establishment where we had problems. After day two at the bad place, we checked into our old reliable paradise. Why did we ever try anywhere else, trying to save a few bucks did not pay off as this is one of the more expensive resorts, but well worth it. I cannot say enough good things about this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: tar151
Reviews.Content: We took our 5 year old for his Birthday as a surprise to him and what it happened was a surprise to us! We LOVED IT! We had just recently vacationed in Aruba as a family for the second time and I wasnt sure that anything could beat that. When we arrived there was a bit of a mix up, first name last and last name first but it was handled nicely. Our room was spotless and I am very particular about that. The pools were perfect for our son. One day on the water slide he went up and down over 75 times! He also slept very late the next day. We took him to Magic Kingdom on his actual Birthday yet he really just wanted to get back to the pool at Horizons! If we didn't go out for dinner we brought dinner down to the pool. Would I go back? In a heart beat!!! We have had a bit of a problem aclimating back to Massachusetts weather and not still being on vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Hartman02
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Horizon's by Marriott Orlando May 13-17, 2008. I can't say enough about this resort. First off, the property is beautiful. The security is great. We were always greeted at the gate by security who watched us use our key card to access the property. Our room was wonderful, 2 bed/ 2 bath that slept our family, two adults and three kids perfectly. We had room to spare. Next time, we'll be sure to bring someone with us. Our room had a view of the pirate ship pool. I never once heard the noise of the air conditioner or I-4. The acitivities for the kids were great and the staff was amazing. My kids were in a hula hoop contest, limbo contest and water balloon toss. There was so much to do. My kids actually cried at Disney because they wanted to go to the Pirate ship pool. Close to disney, maybe 10 minutes. Easy acess off of I-4. Staff was very attentive to make sure our stay was great. We had a minor problem with our sliding screen door, we called the front desk and they called maintence. They had it fixed and working great in no time at all. The separate baths were nice too. Once again, I can't say enough about the great time we had at this resort. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great if you plan to cook your own food.”
Reviews.Author: irishzim
Reviews.Content: Perfect for families if your cooking your own food, as there is NO roomservice and very basic pub fare onsite.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't possibly stay anywhere else but Hoizons”
Reviews.Author: travelin-junkie-0722
Reviews.Content: We were at Horizons April 24-30th. Completely satisfied with everything. All aspects of this place were right on the money. The room fabulous, the activities, pool, putt putt, basketball court and playground were all top notch. Check in great. I have a 3 and 5 year old and my five year old had to be coaxed out of the hotel to the Disney Parks. We stayed in a two bedroom overlooking lake. Patio was screened in so no bugs. Kitchen was stocked perfect and the washer and dryer in the room had me coming home with no dirty clothes! I loved the parents night out activities so alone time was possible. (Must be 5yo on some activities.) Absolutely loved this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: phaneuf36
Reviews.Content: I just arrived home from a week at Horizons. My kids are 5, 6 and 7 and I couldn't have asked for a more kid/family oriented facility. It was perfect. 1. The check in process was flawless and friendly. I made an advanced request to have an upper floor, firework view villa. We were put on the 3rd floor, building 15 which was perfect. Great views of the Magic Kingdom Wishes fireworks and the lake. 2. The 2 bedroom villa was immaculate and extremely spacious. (1 King, 2 Queens). There is TONS of closet space. The screened in porch was very child friendly. It is cement half way up with a guard rail type border so there is no way a toddler could fall through the screen. 3. The pools are fantastic. One has the pirate ship and the other a larger, traditional water slide. There is also an adjoining 'splash park' which the kids loved. It's full of sprinklers, water cannons, buckets dumping out water, etc. There is even a special faucet to fill your squirt guns! All pools have atleast 2 hot tubs. For adults, there is a great pool bar which is fairly priced. Also, all pools have gates with locks shoulder level high so there's no chance of an escaping youngster. 4. There are more activities than you will have time for (mini golf, pirate camp, arcade, vollyball, etc.). You could spend 2 or 3 days just at the resort without even going to any parks. 5. Kitchens in the room are well equipped. We saved tons by going to the local market and cooking 2 meals per day. Purchase water ahead of time and freeze it overnight. That alone will save you $$. 6. We got to the parks at 8:30, stayed until 1:00 or so and returned to the resort for the afternoon. We returned to the parks after dinner and a rest which was a saving grace for my kids. This plan worked perfectly. There were no tears, overtired, crabby kids. I recommend it highly! 7. One major thing we loved is that almost everyone here had kids. When we've traveled in the past, we always were trying to hush the kids and worried about typical noise. Here, everyone was understanding and friendly as we're all in the same boat. Kids could be kids and were courteous but not paranoid about our kids being kids. 8. The housekeeping was great, fresh towels, clean dishes, empty trash,etc. every day. It was nice to come home to after a long, hot morning at the parks. I would recommend Horizons to any family. It was short drives to Disney and Sea World. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: fireslayrr
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here in October 07. We truly enjoyed our stay. We were giving a two bedroom villa that over looked the pool with the pirate ship. As other members have stated the pool was a huge hit with my children, as soon as we left one of the parks the pool is all they wanted to do. The villas are well equip and roomy for 5 people. The kitchens helped cut the price of food out as we were able to have breakfast in the unit every morning prior to hitting the parks. Sea World is 3 minuets away (6 if you hit the red light lol) Universal is 10 minuets away and Disney about 15 – 20 depending on which park you are visiting. Food shopping is close by and the ramp to the interstate is really close, this is wonderful for going to Disney, but there is no ramp to the East bound if you are visiting Universal. I would definitely stay here again, the staff was friendly, and house keeping brought extra towels mid week even though there is a washer and dryer in the unit. We ate some appetizers at the pool side bar one night and they were good for what you would expect for bar food. The grounds were clean and well kept and there is a guard house at the entrance which is nice, so that only the people staying at the resort are allowed in. Two other tips for your visit, the first if you come down early and stay on the Disney property like we did, they will give you a free parking pass while you are staying on property. I forgot to remove the pass and when we arrived at Animal Kingdom the next day after checking into the villas at Horizons we were waved through and not charged for parking, the same thing happed all week, I guess they don’t check the dates just the pass. The second things is that I noticed a lot of stores and restaurants in Florida now require you show ID to use a credit card and that the name on the ID must be the same as the credit card, just a info thing if you are going to let your son or daughter barrow your credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Kids Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: chad44
Reviews.Content: If you have kids under 10............Stay here if you can! My 8 year old daughter wanted to stay at the hotel rather than go to Disney! The slide.....the pools.....the putt-putt course were the best! Only thing....stay in a bigger room than a studio if you can.....we had 3 in our room and it was bigger than a regular hotel room but if you have a choice get a bigger room!......

Reviews.Title: “Kid's Paradise”
Reviews.Author: sactm99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 4 adults and 2 little girls, aged 6 and 1. We booked through Interval International. We really enjoyed our stay and were very sad to have to leave. We loved the fact that this is a gated community. This made us feel very safe with our kids. This resort is very close to Sea World and short drive up Turkey Lake Drive to Universal Studios. If you have kids, this resort has it all. My girls loved the pools. One with a pirate ship and the other with a waterslide. The have a sport court with 4 basketball hoops, and also an area with 2 pool tables, 2 ping pong tables, and a foosball table. Also a mini golf course on site. There is an activity center for the kids with a few video games and lots of pirate stuff for the kids. We loved the surroundings, very laid back and were never bugged about time share things. The staff was very helpful and always had a smile and a hello for us. Keep in mind that this resort is very much themed for kids and if you are a kid in heart you will have a blast with your little ones. If not, you've been warned... there are other Marriott resorts in the area that are much more suited for the "adult" community.

Reviews.Title: “Walked the first night...”
Reviews.Author: CTSirTravelsAlot
Reviews.Content: I am a Platinum Member of Marriott Rewards and know my Marriott properties well. I booked this vacation for my family (wife, 2 kids ages 3 and 7) WELL in advance. However, when I arrived on 2/17 I was told that a villa was not available due to "maintenance issues" (this was never clarified). I firmly believe that "maintenance" was equal to "overbooked" and so we were walked to the Cypress Marriott property across the street. I must properly credit the front desk manager for making sure the first night was gratis (as well as providing me a 2 night certificate for any Marriott for one year). Though the Cypress was nicer in terms of the interior quality of the villa, we we disappointed because we were unable to shop for groceries and truly settle in for the next 5 days. The next day we checked back in to the Horizons only to be put in what seems like one of the older villas which had a view of the construction across the street (Building 10, avoid it like the plague). This is the accomodation a Platinum Member gets for his loyalty to the brand???? Again, disappointing. Also, the AC when it came on for either our villa or the one near ours was ear-shattering. Interior of villa less "refined" than Cypress, but we came to this resort for the pools. The pools and grounds were very well maintained and the kids had a great time in the pool. We were credited another $200 by the Guest Experience Representative at Horizons. In summary, I was disappointed that we were walked the first night. Odd that as a Platinum Member I can get a reservation guaranteed 24 hours in advance at any Marriott. However, when I made a reservation 6 months in advance I couldn't get my reservation to be honored.

Reviews.Title: “Cute family resort”
Reviews.Author: Caniac
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott owners and booked this timeshare property through Interval World (getaways). I am writing this review from the resort. This is our last day of 7 days. My husband and I came here for the International Home Builders Show and to tour the Disney parks. The last two years we stayed at the Grande Vista via a time share trade. This year we had not used our week with Marriott in order to get 100,000 extra rewards points, which you can do every other year.(a great way to rack up points for future trips)...so we had to pay...went to the Interval World website and found a deal for a week stay...needed a 2 bdrm, as we have another couple with us....Horizons had a 2 bdrm available. I read every review before booking. Even though we have no children with us, the resort is close to the convention center and has two queen beds in the second bdrm, which would make our guests more comfortable. I called 2 wks. ahead to request a lake front villa in bldg. 12, because it is farther from the freeway. Upon arrival, a villa was not available yet in that bldg., and we had already bought groceries, and needed to ck in, so they offered us a top floor unit in bldg. 15, closest bldg. to the freeway, but told us the unit was in the center of the bldg, so we took it. The unit was really cute...beach theme throughout..Key West style casual furniture and decor. Great view of the lake from the balcony. My only complaint was that the freeway was very close by and out on the balcony, very noisy, even though we were in the center of the bldg. However, inside with the doors closed, it was quiet and could hear just a hum of muffled traffic from our bedroom window in the master. Since we were going to be gone most of every day, we thought it would be ok...But not pleasant to sit out on the balcony to read with all the noise....So, my advice to you is not to stay in this bldg. if you want peace and quiet outside. I would request bldg. 13 or 14...both have side views of the lake and face a quieter pool area. (there is another pool with a water slide across the drive in front of bldg. 29, the newest bldg....That bldg. faces the freeway, however...although set back a bit more than bldg. 15...if you are on a lower floor, you will not see the freeway. A new bldg. is underway at the entrance of the resort facing a pond with a fountain. This bldg., when completed, will be ideal for quietness and a nice view of the pond. Every bldg. is a very short walk to the pools and outdoor activities. since it is Feb., not many children here, so if you are empty nesters, as us, this is a fine resort at this time of year. On the plus side: newer bldgs. have the big screen 43 inch tv's in the livingrooms (including bldg. 15) (bldg. 12 does not). units have nicer furnishings than I thought from reading some previous reviews...and kitchens are very well stocked..and I love the Fiestaware dishes in bright colors. guest bdrm is quite large and guest bath is very roomy On the minus side: resort is a little too close to the freeway unless you are in bldgs closer to the entrance. Units are a bit worn in some carpet areas and upholstery, I guess from heavy use by families with kids.... Master bdrm bath area is not to my liking the way it is layed out...shower and vanity/sink area is open to the bdrm...so when i take a shower, I can see my husband sleeping in bed and he can hear me and watch me in the shower, which is close to the bed...toilet is in a separate water closet...vanity has only one sink in master so we had to take turns....and it is a small area. Compared to the Grande Vista, this resort does not have the luxury feel, but it is far from the Motel Six variety, as stated in a previous review...It is very delightful with all the Caribbean colors and is very clean and the pool areas are just fantastic for children.
