Next time, though, we will return to either the Grande Vista or the Cypress Harbor, as both are more quiet, further from freeway and have larger master baths with dual sinks. this little resort is geared towards the kids, for sure. As soon as I get home, I will add photos to this review.

Reviews.Title: “Kid Heaven On Earth.”
Reviews.Author: Forestree
Reviews.Content: For families with kids under 10 or so this is an awesome place. If they like Pirate type stuff, this place is unbeatable. Friendly staff, prompt service (e.g. extra pool towels brought to your room), activities for kids (and adults), large clean hotel room (we only had a hotel room not one of the villas so we had a microwave and bar fridge, toaster and plates...etc), screened in balconies, lots of trees, nice landscaping, and very little pressure from the timeshare people made this a wonderful place. The 3 hottubs, 2 tiny tot pools, one kids splash play area, 2 swimming pools-one with a 2 story waterslide, the other with a pirate ship with slides, tunnels, water-shooting cannons made this place is awesome. Construction next door to our building was not an issue at all. I-4 is visible from the rooms facing that way above 1st floor, but it is across the lake...not loud and obtrusive but a hum at night with the patio door open letting in the fresh air...we prefer that to the air conditioner that was quiet and worked well. At $25 for the week everyone in your room gets free mini-putt, or it is $5/person per day. Free outdoor (under cover) pool, ping pong and foosball. Nice small basketball court and a small soccer field were also available. For families with teenagers or couples, or anyone wanting a serene quiet vacation, look elsewhere. If you want a place for your 10 and under kids to have a blast at, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Club, Incompetant Staff”
Reviews.Author: AllieDad
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a late Jan 08 trip to Orlando. We stayed at the Marriott Horizons while there, travelling to a different Disney park each day. Overall, we had a wonderful time and the resort was great. The grounds are very nice. True I-4 is nearby, but it's across a big beautiful lake which makes for great views from most of the rooms (ours had a balcony overlooking it). Plus, having easy access to I-4 made getting to the parks each day a breeze. The rooms are wonderfully spacious and functional and the two pool/recreation areas are fantastic for the little ones and their parents. If only the great accomodations and amenities were matched by its staff. They're all actually quite friendly, but are very incompetant. It's hard to describe exactly how, but one example is that on the TV in each room there's a "Horizons" channel that lists nonstop the menu choices from their onsite grill, but with absolutely NO number to call to get that food delivered. When we looked up the number in the directory and called, no one picked up. So, we just walked down there to order. We explained to them we just tried to call and no one answered, to which they said non-chalantly, "Oh yeah. We turned the phone off so we didn't have to answer it." I just had to scratch my head. Just weird. Another example is one night I went to miniature golf with my daughter. They had told me earlier in the day that it's open until 9pm. However, when I got there at about 7:30pm, along with about 3 other parents and their kids, the teenager behind the counter told us that he was going to instead close up at 8pm because of lack of customers. Uh, hello! You're telling this to 3 guests ready to play! The customers have arrived, genious! Anyway, he "graciously" let us play for a half hour for free, but that's not the point. It was clear he was just bored and wanted to get the heck out of there. We all had to rush through and only play about 8 holes before he shut off the lights and locked up. No way to treat potential timeshare purchasers. Still, like I've already mentioned, it's a very nice property - so much so that I just have to give it 4 stars. But they really have to look into improving their staff some how if they want to give their nonstop timeshare schpiels any merit. Once they do that, it'll be an ideal place to stay in Orlando with kids and a much more appealing place to timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “Since we stayed free, it was GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: jenne1017
Reviews.Content: My friend gave my wife and I her time-share at Horizons that we used for a family vacation this past January (2008). The property is conveniently located off of I-4 (it's about a mile or so from Sea World and a 10 minute drive to Disney Theme Parks). We arrived at dusk and the signage was a bit hard to spot, but we did without passing it. It is a gated/guarded area and we were directed to check-in. Staff was friendly and we were in a room on the 6th floor of building 29. This faced the new construction (that started promptly at 8a each morning, though we hardly noticed) and off the balcony was a view of the pool area (this one closed by 10p). The room itself (a one bedroom, complete kitchen, nice bath) was very nice. The couch was a bit worn, as evidenced by the sag in the middle. But we hardly spent any time here -- we were either by the pool or at the parks. I will say that the slide in the smaller of the 2 pools was always closed. For no good reason either as the weather most days was nice and sunny. The front desk staff were helpful when we asked for delivery recommendations as well. The washer and dryer are freakishly small and we were doing laundry all vacation long because of that. Overall, I'd give this property an 8 of 10. But then again, we didn't have to pay for it!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for families!”
Reviews.Author: nifferearly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Horizons in a one bedroom for one night in January before going on a Disney cruise. We have a 3 year old and this resort was perfect for him. This is a timeshare complex but very small compared to others in Orlando. You could easily walk to everything. There was a pool with a waterslide and an area with a splash park. We did not use this part but it looked very nice. The main pool has a pirate ship with slides. My son loved it! It wasn't very warm when we were there (low 70's) but the pool was heated and he was just fine in it for a couple of hours. There was plenty of pool space for the number of people. We found it to be pretty quiet and very relaxing. The room was very nice. It had a full kitchen and washer/dryer. We were briefly offered a return deal if we signed up for a tour, but they were very polite and left us alone when we declined. The resort has an arcade/kids area that was pretty nice. There was a small restaurant and bar but we did not use it. You can go miniature golfing on the grounds for an additional charge. There was a very nice area with gas grills, basketball courts, free ping pong, foosball, and billiards. There was also a playground. If we had stayed an entire week, it would've been a very nice area to cookout for a couple of nights. I paid $200/night for this room and it was definitely worth the money (that's more than we usually pay for a room). We loved this resort and plan to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Orlando Resort”
Reviews.Author: disneydreamsnh
Reviews.Content: Our family of five recently bought a timeshare week at Horizons as we love visiting Florida as often as we can. The grounds at Horizons are beautiful, and our three children love the pirate pool, and the waterslide pool. We stayed for two weeks in July of 2007 and didn't want to leave. We have traveled to Florida every year for the last 7 years and this is by far the best resort we have stayed in and we have stayed at many, often two or more resorts per visit, including Disney resorts. Horizons tops them all. We would recommend Horizons to families with young children and/or teens!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back, we own vacation properties also”
Reviews.Author: MyrtleBeachCondos
Reviews.Content: We have owned vacation condos in Myrtle Beach South Carolina for the past 13 yrs, so we now what it takes to provide a wonderful vacation experience. Marriott Horizons met and exceeded our expectations. You need to rent from an owner though to get a fabulous rate. The perfect place to stay and also perfect for a day away from all the parks. Use the waterpark features and sit back!! Brian ---

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mavwu
Reviews.Content: this was exactly what we needed. We were here for a week at Disney World. We have previously stayed on property and that has worked very well for us. We did miss the onsite transportation, but this was great for this trip. We brought along our 4yr old and our 1.5 yr old and my parents. Our unit had 2 bed and 2 bath. My parents did not go into the parks with us everyday so it had lots of space for us to hang out and relax. It was super clean and has free wireless internet. A huge plus. We were about a 10min drive from an of the Disney parks. We didn't get house keeping everyday b/c we bought this week off of someone else. The weather wasn't very warm so we didn't get to use the pool, but our room was on the ground floor and it was facing the pool! There is a nice playground, tennis courts and b-ball courts. There is a puttputt course and for $26 for the week your whole unit could have unlimited puttputt. We did not take advantage of this. The unit was clean and we ate in or had take out when we were here. We have annual passes, but my parents do not, so that is why they stayed back some with our youngest. This was not our "hard core" trip, that we like to do sometimes, so we didn't go hard into the parks all day. After staying on property, we have really missed the buses. The buses are nice b/c when you get off the buses you get to the park right away. here we had to drive ourselves and then get on the tram and then the monorail. What is nice is there is a "drop off " lane in all parks, so my dad would drop off us at the park in the morning and then come back and pick us up when we were ready. This resort is located "within a stone's throw" from Sea World and right off International Drive, which has every restaurant you can think of and there is a grocery store and drug store about 1.5miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: triploverz
Reviews.Content: So we booked this stay and weren't expecting much at all--right?! Well, we were surprised. The room (2 bdrm) was great. It was clean and had a great layout. The housekeeping called us to let us know we could call anytime if we needed something. The staff at the bar and grill and the coffee shack were very friendly. There was a staff member, Don, who was very helpful and gave us tips on beaches that were nice and was just very friendly. He threw out the "pirate coins" into the pool for kids to find and then on check out redeem for free gifts. There were plenty of activities--my girls loved karaoke night and band night. We didn't do any kids activities, but everyday something was going on. They have free table tennis, pool tables, basketball, volleyball...There are 2 pools--one with a big slide and it is a zero entry pool and then right next to that is a big splash area--reminds me of the Great Wolf Lodges--but outside. Then across the "street" there is another pool with the pirate ship (4 slides on that) and lots of squirting things and then the pool is attached to that. It was just awesome. I did have a two "negatives". First when we checked in Chris from concierge was not aware of what the word means, I guess, because we had a package to include the Sea World tickets but he couldn't find it in the system and told us to call Marriott to get the tickets added on. We paid for this trip back in July and were convinced that we pd for tickets so I had to have the front desk help me get on a computer (b/c I was not going to pay to use one) and I was able to show that we did pay for this thru the Sea World package. He had to be asked to do things--he wasnot willing to offer himself. We called down later and had him call S.W. to make sure the tickets were there so we didn't get over there and have problems. Second, we asked for towels from housekeeping b/c we had used up all our towels and had not washed them yet. It was late in the afternoon, however, to give them the benefit of the doubt and so we did not get new towels until the next day when the came in and cleaned our room--that was partially our fault though, b/c we didn't have them cleaning our rooms every day. Overall, this was the BEST vacation that our family has had so far. We thought the girls would want to just hang out at the pools on site, but they loved Sea World so much that we ended up going to Sea World for 4 whole days--yikes....Anyway, If you are thinking of this hotel I would highly recommend it. Other than concierge (who should have had the best attitude) every other staff member we met was extremely friendly and helpful and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Just back from Horizons”
Reviews.Author: LFDianne
Reviews.Content: We are owners of a Marriott timeshare unit in Park City, and were able to "split" our unit and trade our 2 bedroom for a 2 bedroom AND an efficiency at Horizons during Thanksgiving week to take the kids to Disney World. We had originally planned on taking our dd and her best friend, too, but their school plans changed and we just kept the efficiency. Anyway, we were there with our other 3 children, ages 8, 12, and 14. We thought the property was nice enough, but not quite as upscale as other Marriott Vacation Clubs we have stayed at (Park City Mountainside, Maui Beach Club, Kauai Beach Club, and Cypress Harbour). We were so busy every day doing the theme parks (7 parks in 7 days) that our kids weren't able to take advantage of the water parks or the kids program, which did look fun to young children. We were in building 29, which is right next to the construction of the new unit. Construction began every morning, except Sunday, promptly at 8am. The unit was spotless, no mold or stains. There was a big screen tv in the living room. The sheets on the beds were a bit thin, but the removeable duvet was nice to have (I have issues with hotel comforters - yuck!) We ate at the poolside bar a few times, good basic food (and the bartender makes a killer top shelf margarita). An on-site convenience store would be nice to have, but some basic items can be purchased at the front desk. The staff were very friendly. We received a "welcome" phone call, but were on our way out the door, so I had to cut the conversation short. She said she would call back with information about the "owner's presentation" but either we weren't home, or she did not leave a message. But that was fine with us. No pressure at all regarding "Vacation Club Ownership" or upgrading our "membership." I would rate the property as a 3 star in terms of quality, but it was a clean, comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the kids, but NO ROOM SERVICE FOR OUR TIMESHARE”
Reviews.Author: Balldesign
Reviews.Content: First of all, it really is a great place for the kids. The pools are awesome, the Putt Putt is a lot of fun, they have a game room (pay games), and a nice property. The room was clean for the most part (there was hair in the corner of the floor in the bathroom). The menu at the restaurant was somewhat lacking, however the food was good. Someone on the post said there are restaurants everywhere. We only went towards Disney, and there are not any restaurants at all on the way to Disney, with the exception of Ponderosa and Downtown Disney. When we checked in, our room wasn't ready, even thought it was over an hour past check-in. There was another man at the counter who's room was also not ready, and while I was waiting for them to figure something out, another man came up and his room was also not ready. They told me they could give me a different room, but when he showed it to me on the map, it was right next to the area where they are in the middle of construction on a new building. He then was able to find us a room away from the construction. However, when we were there, you could hear it very well from our balcony and in the room at times- no nice, quiet cup of coffee on the balcony. Really, it wasn't that big if a deal since we were at the Parks all day almost every day. The thing that really got us riled up was when we noticed our room had not been cleaned or towels replaced. I called the front desk and was told that they do not give complimentary cleaning service to the time share units, and that was their policy. If we wanted our room to be cleaned or needed towels, toilet paper, coffee filters, trash bags, etc., we were to call and request them. They would bring them up only when asked. We were to take the trash out to a trash chute by the elevators. I'm not by any means a snob, but when I am on vacation and am completely worn out after a day of carting the kids around a theme park, the last thing I want to do is worry about trash, towels and toilet paper. If we wanted the room to be cleaned and sheets to be changed, that would cost us $25. I have never heard of that at any hotel or timeshare I have ever stayed. I have to say that after I complained vehemently about this, they came the next day and cleaned the room and we were not charged. It's just a horrible policy and I think people have a right to know about this before they book the room. Once again, it is a great place for the kids, and we had a good time- just a couple of bumps in the road.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever at the Horizons”
Reviews.Author: TrekkerMom
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful stay at the Horizons. We were in building 12, on the second floor and the rooms had been renovated with new appliances and bedding. Parking was adjacent and it was very close to everything including the main center and the pirate ship pool, with a small walk to a larger pool area with a waterslide and waterworks area, sports recreation area and a minature golf course. The two bedroom unit we stayed in was very clean, and we enjoyed the kitchen and dining area both for a quick breakfast and to cook dinner in. My sons, 8 and 10, loved the Horizons pirate themed activites with everything from a pirate treasure hunt to a Disney trivia night. As others have stated they loved the resort so much they wanted to stay, even on days we were headed to the parks. We had weather in the 80's so that helped but used the pool on cooler days as well. The staff, especially activites staff were great. My only compliant was not being told to use the parent controls on the tv's - early morning they had an adult programming channel we stumbled upon when my youngest was up very early, wanting to go to the pools. Luckily we switched channels quickly but take note as this was a surprise to find at a family resort. This was the only glitch though in an otherwise great stay. Would highly recommend. to families ...we used Marriott points but I understand that is harder to do know as the resort is building out to more timeshare owners but I talked to a few families who got a rate around $200 which would be very reasonable per night for this resort. All and all a great stay, already hoping to return...

Reviews.Title: “For family of 5, almost too good to be true!”
Reviews.Author: snoqualmie7
Reviews.Content: My family (wife and 3 kids, aged 9, 6, and 2) and I spent six nights at Horizons in late October 2007. This was our first weeklong vacation as a family, and I had exhaustively researched dozens of properties. We decided on Horizons based on the reviews and photos here on TripAdvisor. It was fantastic. We got a five-night package (which included 2 adult one-day tickets to a Disney park) for $995 ($199/night) via Marriott's website. They let us stay an additional night for $209. I called about a month before our trip with some questions, and they emailed me their 18-page property guide with a property map and daily activities. I highly recommend calling and asking for this. Also in their email, they said to let them know if we had any requests for our room. Based on reviews I had read here on Trip Advisor, I asked for a room in the newest building, on a high floor, facing Disney's evening fireworks show. We were given room 2855, which met all of my requests; I was thrilled! The accommodations at Horizons are, in a word, fantastic. The one thing that stands out for me is this: almost all of the Disney Resorts, even Deluxe--no matter how exquisitely themed--are just nice hotel ROOMS, that is to say, a SINGLE room: bed, TV, desk, chair, bathroom, maybe a fridge/mini kitchen. Not bad, but still basically a hotel room, and the beds or the bathroom sink will always be in view. Horizons, on the other hand, is full-blown condo: 2 separate bedrooms w/ TVs, 2 separate full bathrooms, a full furnished kitchen, full dining area, additional snack/counter area with stools, washer/dryer (admittedly small), spacious living room with 40+" TV, and a screened balcony, all decorated with a very comfortable, relaxed decor. For us, a family of five accustomed to tripping over our suitcases and pull-out sofa-beds in typical hotel rooms, this was an absolute dream. It really felt like home for our stay; in fact, parts of it were even nicer than home! I know it's not on-site, but for us the accommodations were such a quantum leap above anything Disney offered--especially in this price range--we didn't think twice about staying off-site. Obviously it does take a little more time getting to and from the parks. But, it was actually nice to escape the "Disney machine" in the mornings and evenings, and again, with great accommodations, we didn't mind leaving. Plus, I was actually glad to not have to eat 3 meals a day on-site. In addition to the great rooms, Horizons has more family friendly amenities and features than any resort I have ever seen. The TWO amazing pools, game room, miniature golf, basketball court, pool tables, plus the kids' activities, all of which are well-documented in other reviews here. Aside from the pools, we didn't really take advantage of these since we wanted to get to the Disney parks ASAP each morning. Our only qualms with our stay were these: 1. The A/C unit for the villa is right next to the balcony...and since all of the balconies (and A/C units) are on the same side of the building, you hear the noise from ALL of the A/C units on your balcony, and it's pretty loud. A review here mentioned noise from I-4, and I had to laugh; I would have loved for our balcony area to be quiet enough to have heard noise from I-4 (hundreds of feet away)! This kept us from spending much time on our balcony. 2. Two of the days of our stay, we found some ants in our kitchen. If we had seen them again, we probably would have asked to be relocated, but we never saw any more. Not sure how bad this problem is. 3. For all of the kids activities offered, most are not free. The daily ice cream sundaes are $3, I believe miniature golf is $5, etc. 4. Washer/dryer is the stacked kind, and are super-small. Some additional pluses: --Free wireless internet access --Staff was super-responsive and speedy with every request we had (which were not many) --Seven channels of HBO (and Disney Channel East/West) on the TVs, plus DVD player in living room. --Kitchen was very well furnished with plates, glasses, utensils, can opener, etc. Also provided packets of laundry detergent and dishwasher detergent. One interesting note: Upon returning to our villa at the end of our first day, we saw we had received housekeeping: Beds made, bathrooms cleaned, kitchen cleaned, dishwasher loaded and run, and 8 fresh bath towels and 6 fresh beach towels provided. Our welcome brochure stated that housekeeping was $22 or $37 per day, so I called the front desk, but they said that housekeeping was included with our rate. I don't know if that's becoming standard or not. Our stay at Horizons greatly exceeded our expectations and was easily one of the best things about our entire trip. Even though we probably won't return to Disney until our daughters are a few years older, I expect we'll be back in Orlando for other activities just so we can stay at Horizons again. It's that great! (For what it's worth, I am in no way associated with Marriott or Grand Horizons or their management.)

Reviews.Title: “Great for little ones”
Reviews.Author: travellenfool
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th time to Horizons by Marriott and they have really built alot of units. They now have studios, 1 bedroom and 2 bedrooms. We stayed over Halloween and they put on a great time for kids down on Horizons Harbor. They played music, games and gave ALOT of candy to the kids. We stayed in building 29 and all of the buildings are convenient and you can't go wrong. Buildings 13, 14 and 15 have better views of a lake. But ours was nice too. We have stayed in two bedroom in buildings 14 & 15 and 29 and all the rooms are the same size exactly alike. We had dinner and breakfast at the bar area and both meals were exellent. Put Put golf is 25.00 per unit for the week for everyone...well worth it. You can't go wrong with this property!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Property!”
Reviews.Author: IslandGrll
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week long trip to Orlando. We have been going to orlando almost every 2 years of so now and have stayed at many wonderful hotels but this one takes the cake. It is really the ultimate if your traveling with children. The water features here keep the kids busy for hours. Everything is CLEAN and service is first class. Our 2 bedroom villa was always kept clean by daily maid service. The food at the poolside grill was always good too. Everything is so close it doesnt matter where your room is located. There are 2 HUGE pool areas on different sides of the complex and both have fun things to do. We walked back and forth between both of them all day long and timed it to be 2 minute walk ( at a slow pace) Since it is a timeshare they called my room ONCE and after telling them I was not interested in time share, they never called back again. On international drive, this is about a 7 minute drive to the parks. Tons of restaurants all up and down the road. Fresh pool towels left in our room all week long. Beds were super comfy, lots of extra blankets and pillows in closets. Balcony was closed in which was one less thing for me to worry about with 3 small children. Ceiling fan on balcony was a nice touch. We cant wait to go back, we will never stay anywhere else again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing complex”
Reviews.Author: laoreyes
Reviews.Content: My wife and my nephews had an excellent stay. Everything is close from parks (Sea World, Universal, World Disney) to shopping mall's. The rooms were neat and the staff were friendly. Thet also have a lot of activities, so you don't necesarily have to go out to have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: maciec
Reviews.Content: We had a blast! This place is great for kids. We were very relaxed and spent a ton of time at the resort. I'm not going to say too much more because it would all be a repeat of what everyone else has said. I am going to add a lot more pictures though. I have a lot more pictures than you can post here on tripadvisor, but you can see them at http://s231.photobucket.com/albums/ee145/maciec/?action=guestlogin .... password is horizons

Reviews.Title: “Good place for families”
Reviews.Author: tripperATL
Reviews.Content: First time staying here via good timeshare deal, with lots of experience at comparable timeshares and this place is nice, better than most. GOOD: place seemed cleaner, comfortable beds, queen beds in second bedroom, decent linens; better furnishings; location was great; pools were resort style (pirate themed) and nice; there seem to be lots of on-property activities; WiFi in room AVERAGE: our unit had corian counters, only one tub (not spa) and normal shower, so that was a little disappointing I do not really have anything bad to say about the place. It is not the more upscale style of timeshare (granite counters, spa tubs, etc.) but it is very nice. It has a great location, lots of amenities, ideal for families and compared to other timeshares in LBV and Kissimmee, Horizons does it better. And they know it, and price it accordingly. I would happily stay here again if partaking of all the resort had to offer, or if the price was right. But if looking for a big timeshare (2+ BR/BA, kitchen) just for sleeping/showering, would also consider a less nice (and less expensive) place. FWIW.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Fun”
Reviews.Author: luki13
Reviews.Content: We totally enjoyed our stay at Horizons. The grounds are very well kept. The staff were pleasant and helpful with all of our questions. Our room was showing a little wear, but it was still practical and spacious. The kids (big and small) had a lot of fun at the waterparks on site. Lots to do. We spent the monings and evenings at Disney and the afternoons at the resort. A lot of driving but well worth it. There is plenty of shopping and dining nearby. The last time we were in Orlando, we stayed at Cypress Harbor across the street, but Horizons was way better since we had the grandchildren along. I highly recommend the property for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Utopia For Kids”
Reviews.Author: CaptainAmerica
Reviews.Content: I am a Florida resident who stayed at the Horizons for the weekend to take advantage of the Low Season here. Got a 2 bedroom suite which was easily the nicest room I have ever stayed in for only $140 a nite. This is quite reasonable, seeing as Disney has the audacity to charge over $300 a nite for their theme hotels which are not any better than the Horizons. Give the mouse a pass! The rooms here are full service- kitchen, dining table, appliances, full size refrigerator, etc. There is no room service and on site dining is very limited- although International Drive nearby has a bazillion chain resturaunts to satisfy you. Oh, and Seaworld is a block away. The greatest selling point to the Horizons is the fantastic and creative Pirate Themed pools and water play areas (two!) plus two oversize hottubs. The kids had a ball. The rest of Horizons is clean and new, with a nice lakefront boardwalk, play areas, arcade, put-put golf course and planned kids activities. Awesome. The whole place has a happy, feel good aura which is contageous and the staff is super-friendly. This is a time-share deal and part of Marriott's "Vacation Club", so two disadvantages: 1. You cannot use Marriott points or other Marriott discounts and 2. Beware the pesistent time-share hawkers at the front desk trying to give you "free stuff" (annoying!). Otherwise, this place is a kids Utopia. I LOVED IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “We love Horizons in Orlando!!!”
Reviews.Author: Boys_School_TN
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Horizons by Marriott twice now. For us, it's a Marriott Timeshare exchange. I'm not sure why people are complaining about maid service. It's not typically included in any timeshare exchange. The pool areas were clean the week of Labor Day. My teenagers love the pool with the 2-story water slide, and will still go shoot the water cannons. Bar and Food Service is wonderful. The frozen drinks are to die for. You can buy a cup for $8.75 at the beginning of the week, and refill for $6.75 the rest of the week. They have a similar deal for draft beer (but cheaper). Food is good for lounge food. Decent kids meals, which they allow any age to order.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but needs some freshening up”
Reviews.Author: ULA0817
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at Horizons by Marriott at Orlando. The reviews were so great I had such high expectations and was somewhat disappointed. We had a 2 bedroom suite on the highest floor facing the pirate ship pool area. Our bedroom faced the pool area so we heard the noise until 10:30 and sometimes to 11:00pm. Fortunately, my little guys were in the 2nd bedroom facing the opposite direction. The unit is large enough for 6 people to sleep. The kitchen is fully stocked and the resort provides you with dish detergent, dishwashing detergent and some liquid laundry detergent. It is very convenient having the laundry machines in the room. I found it very surprising the next day that our room was not made and cleaned. I learned that there was no maid service and we had to do it ourselves. This is one of my big peeves. I do not like going on vacation where I need to make the beds and ask for new towels. I do this at home and want to escape the chores if you know what I mean. The resort had fast food type meals which was a disappointment to me. We noticed they had breakfast but decided not to try it since the lunches at the one grill wasn’t that great. Most reviewers raved about the pools, slides and pirate ship for the little kids to play on. But to our disappointment they looked old and in desperate or cleaning and fresh coat of paint. Obviously, the kids did not notice this and thought the pirate ship and pirates plunge slide were great. But they did get bored of it quickly and 2 days at the pool was enough for them. Fortunately, there are many things to do in Orlando as long as you are willing to spend money. We did drive out to St. Augustine for 2 days to go fishing and spend time on the beach. The ride was 1 hr and 45 min. but we like that area and did not mind the drive. However, there are other beaches closer to the resort. Sea World is around the corner from the resort so that was another great 2 days to spend with the kids. There are children activities daily where they can earn tokens and get prizes from the lobby which my kids enjoyed. One of their favorites was pole fishing. The staff members at the lobby were extremely pleasant and we appreciate them making our kids happy.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome except for using Marriott points”
Reviews.Author: casper36
Reviews.Content: Family from England visited with 2 kids 7 and 13 and 3 adults. Plenty of room, outstanding service and clean. Family kept saying "we could live here" and the kids asked "is this a 5 star"? Kids were obsessed with the pools. Almost had ro drag them away to the parks. I'm picky and a frequent traveler. Love casual elegance. This property is top notch! The only downside was that despite booking a year in advance, I was unable to use any of my Marriott points which I had saved for years with this property in mind. I even offered to use extra points. On this subject, they were snooty just for being asked. Too bad for Marriott. I spend my money elsewhere now. Incidentally, I travel with a walker and scooter. Property was disabled friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property!!”
Reviews.Author: radiology
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Horizons in a 2 bedroom. I was a little concerned since we had stayed at the Grande Vista 2 years ago, and a few reviewers said this property wasn't as luxurious at the Grande Vista. It is smaller, and not a fancy, but this resort has a LOT going for it-we came to really enjoy a smaller resort-made it very easy to get around. When you're at the pool, you didn't have to walk a mile to get a drink or something to eat. Another thing we really noticed was the staff, and more importantly, how clean the resort was. The grounds are spotless (and I'm fussy). You could get in an elevator with one of the housekeeping staff, and they would be polishing away as they spoke to you. The resort is themed after key west feel-cobblestone streets etc. There is a large lake, with rocking chairs on a large deck, 2 pools, a small game/activity room for the kids. At one of the bars you can get wraps, wings etc. We found the food very good-nice pina coladas too!! Plenty of activities for the kids-fishing, games, DJ one day at the pool, video game competition. Overall, it was a very pleasant experience. From checking in, they accomodated us with a nice view (overlooking the pool), to the staff, and great location by Seaworld. We found this location to be a very nice quiet area-2 minutes from Seaworld, 10 to Universal. I would definetely stay here again. It gave you a "comfortable" feeling staying there!! The only thing I would watch, is the resort is near I-4, next time I would request a building as you came into the resort (the main street of the resort). Although our room was very good, between the sound of the water from the water park below, and I-4 in the distance, when you sat on the balcony, we found it a little noisy. No big deal, next time I would just request a different building.

Reviews.Title: “Great & Fun place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: aceupmysleeve777
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay with a large property. When we stayed they were building a movie theatre on site. This is a top notch place to stay if you have younger kids they have a pool with a ship wreck that they play on with water canons & guns comparable to what you see at water parks. That being said we don't have kids and it was close to all the attractions of Orlando and we loved staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kawahl
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay!!! Kids loved it. Staff was awesome. They were great with the kids. They knew many children by there names. The children loved to play with the staff. Pool was great. Marriott quality at its best. Marriott isn't perfect but they are the closest thing to it in the timeshare business. If you are going to buy a timeshare. Buy Marriott! We did 3 years ago and haven't regretted one moment. You get great resorts like this one!

Reviews.Title: “The pirate ship pool area was the best!”
Reviews.Author: Lynn58
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Horizons the first week of June 2007. It was the best vacation we've had since trading our time share in the past 6 years. My children are 6 & 8 and absolutely loved it here. My parents also joined us and they couldn't stop thanking us all week for such a wonderful vacation. We had passes to SeaWorld which is literaly right around the corner. We ended up spending every day by the pools enjoying all the childrens pirate activities, dj, and ice cream sundaes and then going to Seaworld late afternoon and evening when it was cooler. To be honest, as much as we also loved SeaWorld, the kids would have had a super vacation just staying on the property. They also have programs for teens as well as mini golf, bb, karaoke etc. I would absolutely recommend this to families with children of all ages.

Reviews.Title: “It was great for families.”
Reviews.Author: cctibbetts
Reviews.Content: Property was clean, neat, and well staffed. Villas were large and beautifully decorated. Pools and slides were excellent for children. Resort is geared for children. This is the perfect property for families with children; it is not ideal for just couples.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: KathyL69
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for 8 days in late May/June. We had such a wonderful time we extended our stay (the property even honored our super cheap rate for the extra day). My kids 7 and 3 loved the pools, the putt-putt, and special daily activities. They have basketball, ping pong, pool table and fusball - all totally accessible. You don't even need to check out the balls or anything!! We were here over Memorial Day and did not have any problems with the property being too crowded even though it was at capacity. The service is outstanding. The property is friendly and welcoming. It was a breeze to get to both Disney and Universal. Our condo was very quiet. The property really is constructed well. The only VERY minor complaint I would have is the bed is a bit soft, but I did not end up on the floor like I frequently have to do with sub-par mattresses. I think the beds may be memory foam or something like that. This is the best place we've stayed for families in Orlando, cannot recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time @ Horizons”
Reviews.Author: Travelangel19
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Horizons by Marriott for a week starting April 23, 2007. I had a ground floor 2 bedroom, and my patio looked directly out onto the pool deck with the childrens pirate ship. My husband was on a business trip, so my daughter and I invited my sister and her family up to stay with us! There were 7 of us total, (3 adults & 4 kids, 12-17) and we had a great time! As another reviewer wrote, the rooms are somewhat smaller than the other Marriott's that I have stayed in, (No jacuzzi tub in the master) but everything was clean and and well decorated. The gym is great and overlooks the pool. The mini-golf course was fun! The kids loved the large pool slide, pool table, ping-pong and basketball courts! My brother-in-law fished in the lake, and we even had a cook-out one evening! This is a great resort for kids of all ages. We had a great time watching little children have fun in the pirate ship area too! Again, this property is somewhat smaller than the Mariott Grande Vista, (My Favorite) But, I give it an "Excellent" for making great use of the space it occupies!!

Reviews.Title: “The pool slide is this resort's biggest assest.”
Reviews.Author: VegasTara
Reviews.Content: This was a timeshare trade. Overall, it isn't a bad resort, but it definitely has it's downside. Overall, the staff is uninformed and you either get misinformation or "I don't know." They are nice, but definitely need some supervision or training. Even the concierge could never answer the questions I asked. The rooms were smaller than I've come to expect from Marriott resorts, but not bad. The saving grace for this resort, especially if you have kids is a fantastic pool area and a great slide. Events are marginal at best. We had a great time, but I would probably opt for a different Marriot resort in Orlando for my next trip. Last time we stayed at Cypress Harbor (across the street) and there is no comparision for the rooms and staff. If they had a pool slide, they'd be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Paumavista
Reviews.Content: Wonderful family resort - stayed in a pretty 2 bedroom, bldg 12 overlooking the lake which was very nice. Staff was always courteous and helpful. Condo was neat, clean, and well decorated/equiped. We did the parks every morning (always managed to arrive for rope drop) and returned to Horizons by about 2pm. Our 7&8 year old boys loved everything about staying here and we did too. Out of the two pool areas the boys seemed to like the pirate ship pool more (even though the other pool had a much larger slide - that was very nice; I tried it!!) An easy 10 minute ride to Disney. Highly recommend Horizons as the Orlando FAMILY resort - if you don't have children (under 12....I'd recommend staying elsewhere).

Reviews.Title: “Loved Horizons!! We will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: bulatada
Reviews.Content: I booked this resort through interval. We (my husband and I) invited my sister, her husband and their two kids (5 & 8) to tag along with us. We stayed in a two bedroom condo in the newest building. The condo was spacious for the six of us. It was very clean and the beds were extremely comfortable. The resort itself has so many fun things for the kids to do. We purchased six day hopper passes to disney, but would have been better off purchasing a 3 day pass. The kids wanted to stay at the hotel most of the time. We left them one evening for the kids night out program. They loved it! They also had breakfast with the pirates. They enjoyed several of the morning activities as well. The pools were so fun for the kids. This is a family resort. There are kids around. Don't stay here if kids bother you. We will stay here each time we come to Orlando again. It is close to Sea World, Universal and to the Disney Parks. It was nice to have a grocery store so close by. The worst part of our stay was going home!

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative to staying on Disney”
Reviews.Author: GoBucksColumbus
Reviews.Content: We have 2 youngs girls, ages 4 and 6. We went to Disney for 5 out of our 7 days and stayed at Horizons for the entire visit. We initially started out in a "lock out" room in Building 28 which was really just a double bed, a pull bed from a couch and an efficiency kitchen. We were cramped for 2 days. On the 3rd day we upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite for an additional $59 a night and it was well worth it. We stayed in building 28 which is just outside the splash pad. Our view from our balcony was great. There was a full service kitchen, a large kitchen/nook table, a living room with a pull out couch and a seperate bedroom with a king size bed. This was perfect for our family of 4. The walk to the main pool with the pirate ship was a bit of a walk for our toddler because you had to walk around the entire building to get to the pool. No big deal though. We got the pirate cups for the ice cream socials and the kids got a kick out of getting ice cream every day between 2-3 p.m. The pools are absolutely fabulous for young kids. My youngest could touch the bottom of the pool almost everywhere. My kids also liked that they had a playground. The staff also had entertainment by the pool one day including, the limbo, balloon toss, and a hula hoop game. Very cute. The staff at this resort was very nice and they seemed very accomodating. We would return to this resort again and not go to Disney. To make a long story short, this was a perfect place to return to after a day at the parks. One downfall was that there is an additional charge for housekeeping each day. I don't like taking out the trash on my vacation. Again, no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Children and parents with children will love it!”
Reviews.Author: BluEyes-TRIP
Reviews.Content: Horizons is perfect for children between the ages of 5-12! Choose another hotel if you have no young children, grandchildren, or any to borrow for the trip. The rooms are beautiful, comfortable and well appointed. The grounds are stunning and this complex is small enough that you can enjoy both pools and all activities without a car. Until I have grandchildren, I will not return to Horizons. There are two play pools, neither are swimable due to the fact that they are very crowded with very little of each pool over 4.5' in depth. I love children and it was obvious that most enjoyed their holiday here. However, children under five were often run over by out of control older children. Parents, please remember that even though you are on vacation, parenting is still required! The food was good at the bar and grill and the drinks were resonable. You must have a car as there are no shops within walking distance and no store in the complex. I stayed in building 28 overlooking the water park pool, this is a very desireable building! I wish I had stayed in the most remote building, overlooking the lake (think it is building 13). A very big negative for me was that the water park pool didn't open until 10 AM and closed at 10PM. I usally like to swim laps around 8AM before the crouds arrive and it wasn't possible here. Even the hot tubs were small pools for children. In closing, your children will love this place which will make vacations easy for parents. Do not book here if you are a couple or single looking for relaxation! One more thing, don't buy your park tickets until you get there, most children didn't want to leave the hotel to go to the parks!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: bloogirl
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and I have to say I am not sure what some of you others that have posted here were thinking. How could you have had any complaints? 2 bdrm villa was awesome, staff incredibly accomodating, beautiful grounds, loads of activities with little or no extra cost, fantastic location, and awesome pool areas. This is a place for everyone! I have stayed in tons of Orlando hotels and resorts and this tops the list

Reviews.Title: “Great for young famiilies”
Reviews.Author: membermay07
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling to Orlando with a young family - this is a great hotel. We booked in conjunction with Sea World, which got us a great package price, and stayed for 3 nights. We are used to 4-5 star hotels and this did not disappoint. The suites are large with more than enough space for 5-6 people. The only disappointment was the lack of a whirlpool tub in the master bath - a feature we have found in other Marriott timeshare locations (we don't own 1 - just like the suites). Activities were great for young kids. Two great pools, miniture golf, table tennis, kids club etc etc etc. We planned to spend most of our time at the theme parks, but frankly, our kids ended up enjoying the resort almost as much. Next time we go back to Orlando, we would definitely stay there. However, if you are a couple, obviously this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “A Trip To Remember”
Reviews.Author: RTJOPfamily
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our April vacation in Orlando at the Horizons. I have to say that initially I was disappointed because the resort is so small and very close to the road. Our last vacation was at the Marriott Grande Vista and it was so secluded and difinitely more of an upscale property. Horizons lacks the "awe factor" that the Grande Vista emulates. I have to say that I quickly changed my mind though. My husband describes the resort as having more of a comfortable and relaxing atmosphere. After giving the resort a chance I knew he was right. The rooms are very nice and the two queen beds were difinitely a hit for the children. The Staff is very young but competent and friendly. I have two boys who are 10 and 6 and they just loved both the Pirate ship pool and the slide pool. Our room overlooked the pirate ship pool and it gave a tropical setting as well as one of excitement. We set aside days to just stay at the resort and let our boys participate in the activities. They loved the hoola hoop contests, the limbo, the dancing, the kareokee, the scooter races, the music and especially the miniature golf. The bar has great drinks and good food, some very special frozen drinks for the kids. The resort is so entertaining for the children that the adults can relax and enjoy. As for the interstate 4 noise ,which was mentioned as a problem in other reviews, we never heard it even when we tried to listen. The resort has the ability to still be an oasis and the music, the activities and the splashing water sounds all cover any outside noise. And the hot tubs are the best design I've ever seen, even if they are busy you can still get a quiet corner to relax and enjoy. My only request would be to add a market place convenient store, I did miss that. Needless to say this resort is definitely worth a visit, we were all sad to leave it. As I learned first impressions aren't always right, give the resort a try. It just doesn't get any better than this for families. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Kiddieland! / Be careful when you book your room”
Reviews.Author: Steamraise
Reviews.Content: We traded a week at a Hawaii Marriott timeshare for a week here. We learned a valuable lesson - always read the fine print. Instead of booking a suite (which was pictured) we ended up in a "lock-out" room, which is just a basic room - on par with an upscale Best Western. If we had read the fine print we wouldn't have stayed here. The pirate-themed front desk staff wasn't very sympathetic. Arrr. About the "lock-out" room. It was slightly larger than an average hotel room and had a small screened-in balcony. The theme is tropical, and the walls are painted bright yellow and the drapes are blue and green. The room also boasted a basic kitchenette, featuring a microwave, a coffee maker, a small refrigerator, some dishes, and a bar sink. The mattress on our queen-sized bed was springy, thin and cheap, but at this newish stage in its life it was okay. At one point my husband tried the couch's pull-out bed, but found it to be far worse. We had a smallish (27-30") television and asked the hotel staff for a DVD player, which they eventually supplied. All the countertops were white Formica and the counter in the bathroom was very low. The bathtub was shallow. All the plumbing fixtures were comprised of white plastic. No doubt this is a nod to their main clientele - kids. Expect to receive an early morning phone call from a very enthusiastic timeshare salesperson if you are using a relative's or friend's timeshare. Kids, kids, kids! They're everywhere. This hotel is a kid's paradise. There are 2 main pools, one with a nice waterslide, and couple of large hot tubs. There is a pirate ship and some sort of tower that shoots kids with water. They lock up the pools and hot tubs around 10 PM. There is very basic miniature golf ($5 a day) course and a basketball court. I also saw a schedule for kiddy crafts and other activities. There's also a small arcade. Best of all? There's a bar! The drinks are reasonably priced. You can also order some food there, which is a relief as this complex has no room service. Frankly, if I had a small kid (and had actually gotten the room I expected), I wouldn't think twice about staying here. But there are much better options if you aren't traveling with young kids.

Reviews.Title: “Loooooooooooved Horizons”
Reviews.Author: virginiad65
Reviews.Content: For spring break this year I took my 9 year old niece to the Horizons Vacation Club. We stayed in a studio room which was a good size and nicely appointed. I thought while we were there we would go to a park but my niece would have none of it. She loved the resort, she loved the pools, the activities, she loved everything. It is a great family resort, there is a kid’s night out which my niece loved, they have entertainment around the main pool everyday. The staff was wonderful, the room was nice, the pools were great. I can’t say enough about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but way too Noisy”
Reviews.Author: ripcurled1
Reviews.Content: Stay was okay. Rooms were nice and grounds were fantastic, but there were way too many shrieking children running frantically around the grounds. I thought I was at Willy Wonka's Chocolate Factory with kids full of sugar. It was not very relaxing as I was trying to take a few days off from a stressful job.

Reviews.Title: “Horizons was great!”
Reviews.Author: LizardPa
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at Horizons and would love to return. We had a 3 1/2 year old and a 21 month old. The slides on the pirate ship were perfect for our 3 yr. old. The 21 month old could go down with an adult. The pool was a little chilly for the younger one, but fine for the 3 yr. old. One of the bedrooms has a king sized bed and the other has 2 queens. We had a screened in porch which was great for the kids to play. Overall it was just nice to have a place with slides at the pool and a separate bedroom so that when the kids went to bed, we could stay up and watch tv on the big screen tv. We booked this directly from Marriott's website. Be careful that you are definitely booking a a 2 bedroom as it seems they also have rooms more like a typical hotel room (without a kitchen, living room, etc). We joined Marriott Rewards and then searched google for a promo code for a Marriott Rewards rate, which dropped the price from $299/night to $224/night. We had a voicemail in our room to come back in the next year and do the timeshare tour for $399 for 4 nights. If you book a nightly rate like we did, try to do it on days which you will not be at the parks, so you can actually enjoy the resort. I don't know that I would pay the $ to stay here if we were going to be at the parks all day and really only use this for night time sleeping & naps. It seemed most of the scheduled resort activities were for children over 5. We can't wait to return simply for how much fun the pirate ship slides were for our 3 yr. old.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: AnnArborHillary
Reviews.Content: I'll be brief. This was a timeshare trade for us and we were very happy with it. We would stay here again! Huge suite, two bedrooms with full baths (one has a double shower). Clean, nice decor. Full kitchen with everything you need. Huge dining area that seats eight with two more kitchen bar chairs. Huge patio area with full size table and four chairs. Ours (building 15) overlooked the lake. Tons of entertainment for the kids: Pirate pools (one heated), basketball, playground, game area, arcade, and fishing pond. The food was just okay, but International Dr. (close by) has everything. This is a great resort! Close enough to Disney (about 3-5 miles) but not in the chaos. Nice place!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with the Horizons by Marriott”
Reviews.Author: gunner45
Reviews.Content: Although this property is described as "2-bedroom/2-bath villa", it is not a villa: rather, it is a self-contained apartment in a large block. It may be a condominium, quite possibly a timeshare. Nevertheless, we were very pleased with the two bedrooms, the fully-fitted kitchen which included an electric cooker (used to cook breakfast every day), a washing machine and dryer (both used every day), a dishwasher, and the living room. A bonus was that the living room and master bedroom overlooked the lake. The master bedroom had a shower as well as toilet and sink, the other bedroom had a bathroom which was also accessible from the kitchen area. Both bedrooms and the living room had a TV. The rooms were all clean and tidy, no problems there. Room service came round every day to clean the rooms. A useful service is the early checkout: you just request it and sometime in the early morning of your departure you are checked out and your bill is sent to you room - no need to go to the front desk. This was helpful as we departed at 4.15 am. You need a car to get around, but it took only minutes to get to Intenational Drive or Sea World. We didn't go to the other attractions, but they were not far away. The Orlando international airport is easy to get to as well. This property is close to exit 71 of the Eastbound Interstate 4 (but there is no exit 71 on the Westbound I-4). We British found this hard to understand. All in all, we really liked this property and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Grandchildren loved this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: lovinggramma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Horizon from Feb 8-15 and had a wonderful time. There was 4 adults and 2 children and we had a 2 bedroom villa in building 12. Had plenty of space since the master bedroom had a very comfortable king size bed. Second bedroom had 2 queen size comfy beds. The villa was nicely stocked and if we asked for anything they were very accommadating. Staff was great and everyone was professional.I wouldn't hesitate to stay here in the future. The children are still talking about the pools they were wonderful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tampa1
Reviews.Content: We just got home from a stay at the Marriott Horizons, we had 5 teens and 2 adults in a 2 bedroom unit. The unit was large and well equipped for our stay. The activities were pretty much set up for younger kids but the resort itself offered alot to do for any age group. The units are built around the pools and activities so it is safe and easy to navigate no matter which one you stay in> they have2 great pools, volleyball, basketball, miniature golf (FEE) and nightly campfires. We loved this hotel and would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: potatofeet
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Jan. 7-17. As wonderful as all of the reviews say it is. We were in building 28, the newest, as I had called ahead of time & requested a newer building, & access to the pool for older children. Suite is not as large as the Grande Vista, & no in suite jacuzzi, but we did gain an extra queen sized bed that the GV doesn't have. Well decorated, spotless, with plenty of pretty, new dishes. Comfortable beds, with fluffy duvets. Pool areas are amazing, The entire property is well maintained, cozy, & clean. Staff went out of their way to be helpful. For example, the main pool, with the pirate ship closes at 11, while the other one with the water playground & slide closes at 10. Unfortunately, the side walk to the main pool, which runs along the 2nd. pool also closes at 10(apparantly this is to be corrected with a fence in the weeks to come) so we had to walk through the parking lots to get to the main pool after 10. The security man drove & picked us up in his golf cart. Also, when we went to the 2nd. pool one night at 7, the water playground was closed, much to the diasppointment of my children. I was told it was because it was cool out. When I pointed out that it wasn't really fair- the lifegaurd for the water slide contacted maintenence, & had it turned on. The maintenence man later came to talk to us- he was also very friendly & empathetic. I expect to be treated by courteous staff, but these people can really become friends they're so nice. The only downside I encountered is that there's no walkthrough in the "L" shaped buildings, so one needs to walk around the buildings to get to the pool, main lobby, etc. However, considering the sizes of some of the properties in Orlando, & walking distances to pools in some places, this glitch pales in comparison. We took 4 children along, & I highly recommend it for families. If you're looking for a more adult atmosphere to lay by the pool, this may not be the place for you.(As a side note, although this property is only about 7 years old, apparantly the "old' buildings are currently being re-painted, & getting big screen tv's & new appliances, so it probably won't be necessary to request newer buildings. I would request access to which pool area or amenities I would want to be close to instead.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Offsite Location for Families when your Not @ the Parks!”
Reviews.Author: Jerseygirlgirlfriend
Reviews.Content: Booked for 4 nite in early Jan on the spur of the moment. Place is immaculate & a fabulous place for kids. So many activities (like you don't have enough w/ all of the parks). You would never have to leave the hotel. Luckily it was warm enough for all of the slides, waterpark type features, fishing derby, basketball, pool tables & just relaxing by the pool during our stay. Rooms had beautiful furniture, looked like a beach house out of Ethan Allen. A nice complimentary package w/ detergent, coffee, filters, etc. helped out the first day b4 we got to the market. I must say the only drawback is not staying onsite @ the parks, you don't take the opportunity to go back to the hotel & relax & return again. A great hotel, I like a Ritz Carlton, Westin, Loews (Portofino in Orlando is a favorite) & I liked Horizons. We were looking for a high class, kid friendly, nice pool resort; we got one!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Horizons”
Reviews.Author: kaykayram
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Horizons hotel. My family and I stayed at the Marriott Grande Vista last year and I was concerned Horizons would not be as nice, but I wanted to give it a try. I was really impressed by the pool area and actually liked the property better than Grande Vista. When we stayed at Grande Vista it was such a hike from our room to the main pool that we never used it. The Horizons property is much smaller and the pools are a very short walk from all of the buildings. We spent a little time at the pool and bar area and I really liked how the game room was right next to the bar / grill area. Several men were watching games at the bar while their kids played in the pool and game room. We also played basketball and minigolf. It is $25 for the mini-golf for the whole week if you don't own a timeshare here. We did not stay long enough to participate in any of the activities, but they had a lot for the kids and also for grown ups. I would return to this property for the pool area alone.

Reviews.Title: “Ho Ho Ho at Horizons!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lasoul
Reviews.Content: Visited this property December 23-27, 2006. We were contacted directly by mail by Marriott directly with a time-share presentation package. Our package was for a 2-bedroom villa for 4 nights for $199. Total? Yep, total! Awesome! So we booked. Arrived 12/23 at 7:30 a.m. Check-in is 4 p.m. so our room wasn't available. We visited Downtown Disney Marketplace and then returned to enjoy the pools until our unit was ready, which unfortunately turned out to be 4 p.m. Our unit was very nice, true typical Marriott. I was unable to download my photos because the files were too big but the photos posted by other users are very very true to what the units/ grounds and pools look like. We have 2 kids, ages 9 & 10 and go to Florida every year for Christmas and take along our Christmas tree and all the gifts. Unit was more than large enough for the tree set-up and gift opening on Christmas day. Unit: Nice and large. 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms. The master suite was large, with a comfy bed and it's own bathroom. Toilet was in it's own closet but oversized shower and sink area were open to the bedroom. Big closet with wall safe. Second bedroom very nice with two queen beds. All bedding was luxurious. Second bathroom was large and comfy and had access to kitchen and second bedroom. Lots of closet space throughout (bring some extra hangers though). Kitchen was well furnished but I always bring along my own frying pan. Dishwasher and washer/dryer (apartment size), and THREE tv's operated well. We were even able to connect the Play Station. Big sliding glass doors onto a very private balcony. Unfortunately our particular balcony was completely completely blocked by trees. There were only two balconies in the place blocked by trees and unfortunately we were one. You couldn't even see the pool. I think the trees should be trimmed a bit but .....I don't own the place and you know we only ended up paying $50/nite. Housekeeping: Daily housekeeping was included in the price. For owners this costs an additional $20/week. "Light Service" included making of beds, providing new towels and vacuuming. We had this service twice and decline it on the other days because we didn't need it. Pools: Pools were awesome. Main pool has a big pirate ship theme with water canons the kids (and husbands) can shoot, slides and varying water depths. Snack bar nearby too. Lots of tables, chaise lounges. Other pool is less interactive but has a great slide and an area just off the pool with lots of kids' interaction, including a huge bucket that dumps tons of water. It was really nice. The grounds: Marriott is a "work in progress". Although there was no construction while we were there, we were told at our time share tour that the place is only 25% built. When it's finished it's going to be a huge place, including it's own movie theatre. That work has got to start sometime, so check on that before you book. Time Share Tour: We knew before we even booked the unit that we would not be buying any timeshare. The tour required 90 minutes of our time, which was no big deal as we visit every Christmas, but we told the Marriiott rep right up front that we were not interested and stayed with that. The rep went thru the pricing but we stayed fast and kept saying no. No pressure, but we weren't interested. If they see any glimmer of interest, you will be taken on a tour of the time share which will take another hour of your time. Don't worry about being "nice", if you aren't interested you're just wasting everyone's time. We got out in 40 minutes. Overall, the resort is beautiful and I highly recommend it to anyone. We get such good deals with vacation brokers in Florida that timeshare ownership is a bad financial decision for us. We enjoyed our "rental" time at Horizons and give it a four thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families and close to parks”
Reviews.Author: dimples
Reviews.Content: My 11 year old son called this place heaven and it truely was. We went to the parks most days but on our last day, our 3 kids ages 8, 11 and 13 asked if we could just stay there for the day which we did. The staff makes you feel so at home (popcorn every afternoon for example). We loved the pools, the basketball courts, pool table, ping pong, foosball, pool table and mini-golf all by the lake. Our unit was very comfortable and well stocked with dishes etc. (my husband did all the cooking and we only ate out once). There is very little pressure to do the Time Share tour maybe because this place sells itself so easily. Horizon's was so much cheaper to stay at than other places we contacted (e.g. $1000 CDN less than the Marriott Residence next door). I just can't imagine what more you would need except for a restaurant on-site (there is now just a snack bar although the menu was varied enough).

Reviews.Title: “Horizons at Orlando, won't hesitate to return!”
Reviews.Author: perci
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Horizons the week before Christmas - mostly based on reviews from tripadvisor. It was great! The bedrooms were very comfortable. The suites were spacious and fit the 5 of us comfortably (3 adults, 2 children). It could have fit 6 easily. There was a sofa bed that we did not even use but would crowd it too much, I think. With our kids, we used the pool heavily (more the pool area with the pirate ship). This was definitely a big hit with the kids. Location-wise, we were one or two exits on the freeway from the DisneyWorld exits. It was not a big deal to drive there. Since we did this as an exchange, there was not really a lot of pressure to take a sales tour, the lady scheduling the sales tours was very nice and helpful, and was lowkey, particularly after we informed her that we will pass on the discount offers they were offering if we attended a 90-minute sales tour.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: geeitsme
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week stay at Horizons. We traded into the property for a 2 bedroom villa and then booked another 2 bedroom to accomodate all the people we had with us. We were pleasantly surprised. Marriott sells this property as more kid friendly and more economical than some of its other timeshare resorts. Althought the villas were slightly smaller in size than some of its other Orlando resort counterparts, they were still spacious, well equipped and nicely decorated. Marriott didn't disappoint again! Both pools were nice, heated and easily accessible. My kids loved the pirate pool especially. The staff was very nice, accomodating and informed. We would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: rozhah
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the week of Halloween. The resort is a great place for families with kids. They have activities all day everyday for kids and adults. Our room was clean and nicely decorated. We were very happy during our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Your kids will fall in love”
Reviews.Author: Paul-From-NY
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Horizon’s at Orlando is terrific. Clean grounds are comforting and even though the property is only half complete there is so much to do. We enjoyed a mere “tip of the ice berg by playing great miniature golf, ping pong and foosball. We didn’t even get to the soccer, volleyball, basketball, video games and lovely fire pit with benches all around. The real stars are the pools though. One has a sprinkler system that’s as good as many theme parks and a slide that flows into the pool. The other is A+ for the little kids with the popular pirate ship complete with mini-slides and water cannons. Both are heated for easy entry. The suites are fully equipped and large enough to serve as a home away from home. When Marriott completes the Movie Theater and a couple of the restaurants they have planned this place will be paradise. Good for anyone but if you have kids don’t miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent For Families!!!”
Reviews.Author: mandyka76
Reviews.Content: This place is simply AWESOME! EXCELLENT for families! If you're looking for fun, this is the place to stay. The best mini golf course I've seen in a long time! Wonderful pools for the kids (of any age) and parents to play in. The grill & bar had an excellent menu. I'm a picky eater, and must say that the Turkey Panini (of which was my first to try) was great! The prices were okay too (not too expensive). Our 2 BR villa was very spacious and casually elegant. The colors were very vibrant and everything at the resort made you feel like you were in the Caribbean. The theme throughout the resort was a pirate theme, which was a hit with the kids. One of the managers there told us that they were in the process of building 20 more buildings and a movie theater... This place is going to be HUGE when it's complete! A nice touch at the end was that the kids got to trade in their tokens they had received from various games played during the week for prizes in the treasure chest. I definitely would LOVE to stay here again and would HIGHLY RECOMMEND this place to any future travelers & their family. The only negative thing I have to say about this place, is that the Front Desk didn't have stamps (to mail post cards). We had to travel to a local grocery store and had to buy a book of stamps (couldn't buy just 1 stamp!).

Reviews.Title: “Most Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: krisr
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed ourselves in a 2 bedroom/2 bath villa. In building 13 we were able to overlook the pirate pool. We did not find it noisy at all. Our room was great and very comfortable...the kitchen with washer and dryer is a great way to go! Just a hint we brought a soft sided cooler to the pool, since drinks are a bit expensive. Although we did enjoy some the fruity drinks once in a while...

Reviews.Title: “Great Place For Families”
Reviews.Author: reg3sdaddy
Reviews.Content: I guess when you are a timeshare exchanger, the best way to go is to stick to the names you can trust.. Marrioot, Disney, Hyatt, etc.. Thats what I did and I was rewarded. I went for 4 nights with two childhood friends, my wife and 9 month old son. This was my first time traveling with my son and it was a daunting task to say the least.. We had to rent a minivan just to accomodate all of his stuff!!! However, once we arrived, I knew I had made the right choice. Everything at this resort seemed to cater to families. At first, I thought my son was still too young to enjoy the resort. BOY WAS I WRONG. With the help of an infant inflatable ring, he was able to kick and oush his way through the pool. HIS FIRST TIME!!! He enjoyed the pirate ship, the colors, the water cannojns.. I wouldve probably given this place a 5 just based on the smile on his face. However, I found the resort cozy and had some great times at the poolside bar with my buddies. We did the usual thing, hit IOA and Unioversal Stidios.. a bit of a waste with a 9 month old in all honesty. Then again, I had to show my friends a good time and thats the park they chose. You cant really go wrong with Horizons. Other than the bartenders, who were gerat and very sociable, I didnt need to interact with any of the staff. I fully reccommend this place whether you are a family or just a group of friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, poor customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Gemstate
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Horizons from 7/30 to 8/5/2006 and liked most things about the resort. Nice rooms with balconies but our refridgerator was not working properly and we had made 4 calls to have it checked during our 1st 4 days there. Maintainance answered all calls quickly but never knew what to do. The 1st 3 visits the person that came had no clue. The last one to come set the controls to what he said would work but again no luck. We had many of our food items go bad. Also, don't try the miniature golf at night... the lighting is terrible.. you can't see the hole you are putting at most of the time. I left a comment card with these concerns and the front desk manager called promptly and said they would replace the fridge and look at the lighting but when I spoke with him said he couldn't do anything about the fridge items going bad after the fact. Overall a nice resort but not happy with how manager handled situation.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jimbee
Reviews.Content: We just got home from our week-long stay at Horizons. Overall, it was a nice experience. The rooms were spacious and clean, however, we did find two cockroaches during our stay. Hotel staff promptly contacted pest control who came to our room the next day (we were offered pest control services that same night but we declined, as we had already settled in for the evening). Horizons staff was friendly, courteous, and accommodating, however, the concierge was not extremely knowledgeable. Horizons offers an endless amount of activities for the kids (although mostly for kids 5 years and older), and the pool area is fun and clean. The rooms at Horizons apparently vary, so I was told to call a week before my arrival to make any requests. Although I did not call a week prior to our arrival, at check in I requested a newly renovated lake view room near the pool which we did indeed receive. Check out is at 10:00 am, although we were provided a late check out upon request. The pool hours are limited, and by the time we normally arrived back at Horizons, it was already closed. The overall location of Horizons is convenient to Disney, Universal, the 2 major malls, and of course, SeaWorld. While this is not a luxury resort, we enjoyed our stay and may return to Horizons in the future. If not for the kids, however, we would likely choose a different resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for kids and families”
Reviews.Author: Chipper'sMom
Reviews.Content: Our group of two moms and four children under age 11 had a terriffic time at the resort. We live about an hour away and were looking for a resort where we could park the car once and let the kids have a great time, without having to go to a theme park. With a little advance planning, (a grocery stop before we arrived) we gave the kids a great time and never left the property. We checked in early and stayed late the next day - a perfect way to end the summer with a "last blast" of fun before school started! There were plenty of varied activities for each of the kids, the pools were clean and entertaining, and the room set-up was perfect for our group. The kitchen was well-equipped, we were able to cook dinner for the kids, provide snacks and let them watch a movie, then we relaxed on the screened porch, overlooking the lake. The washer and dryer turned out to be convenient to have, even with such a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for anyone but especially for families”
Reviews.Author: JHokie
Reviews.Content: This place was perfect for a trip to Orlando. It is more or less in between Disney and Universal and almost walking distance to Sea World. The Villas are perfect for a long stay with great kitchens and washer/dryer. They provide you with everything from Coffee filters to dish washing detergent. But it's the activities and outdoor facilities that make this place. The two pool complexes are awesome from the Pirate ship to the mini water park. Above average mini golf course, basketball courts, pool tables, ping pong and quality exercise/fitness center it is a vacation on it's even if you never go to the parks. Add in the kid's club with a game room and you'll ask yourself why you dropped all that money on theme park tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Villas!”
