Reviews.Author: alantill
Reviews.Content: This was a great vacation destination! The villa we stayed in was HUGE and new. Decor was perefect for the location. The villa had 2 bedrooms one with 2 Queen Beds and a bathroom with a shower/tub and sink. The Master had a King Bed, and a bathroom with a shower stall. Kitchen was HUGE and perfect for cooking, the dining area was cozy, and could easily fit 8 people. The living room featured a big screen TV. The resort also featured a large pool area that had 1 pool with a waterslide and another with a Pirate Ship play area. It would be great for kids and adults alike. The pool area also had 2 or 3 jacuzzis. Horizons Mariott Villas had a location close to the Disney Theme Parks, and quality dining. It also featured children's programs. We found nothing negative during our stay here. This is the perefect place for all ages, so book at the Horizon Mariott Villas and have the most relaxing but fun vacation you've ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: Wild4Orlando
Reviews.Content: Just recently returned from our trip from June 30 - July 5 and had a really great time. We stayed at Cypress Harbour last summer and have also stayed at Sheraton Vistana as well as many of the deluxe Disney resorts and the Universal Lowe's resorts. While you can't beat the theming and "feel" of Disney and Universal resorts, this resort is a wonderful family resort that every member of your family, regardless of age can enjoy. We love Cypress Harbour, too, but I really liked the small town feel of Horizons over the sprawling Cypress Harbour complex. I was unsure of what building to request as I had them fax me a resort map a week before and it was hard to see the building numbers. So, I called a few days before and told the clerk I would like to be near the basketball courts/large pool (Pirate's Plunge) and she recommended building 14. Upon check in, they put me in building 29, said it was their newest building and I would like it better so I agreed. The room did seem pretty new as it was in excellent condition and was technically close to everything, however, the way they have the buildings situated makes you have to walk farther. The entrance to the rooms is on the far side, away from all the common areas and there isn't a typical middle walk through hallway so you have to walk completely around the buildings which was the biggest pain. When you enter the property, that drive is the main drive of the whole complex. On the right hand side is building 29 & 28 which are connected. After passing the buildings on the same side of the road is Pirates Plunge with large slide, the miniture golf course, basketball courts, pavillon where they have pool table, ping pong and foosball tables (and where they have many events) and a small snack stand (just chips and sodas). Directly across the little street is the Lobby with a large fitness center on the second floor, the only restaurant, Horizons Harbour with Pirate Ship, large jacuzzi and the dock/large lake. Building 14 faces towards Horizon Harbour but you can see the basketball courts from them as well (if we go back I would definitly stay in this building). The only restaurant is outdoors so if it's raining they close up. The food was surprisingly good...mostly salads, chicken wings and fingers, sandwiches and the like. They usually featured an off the menu entree item every night. It is located right next to Horizons Harbour so its nice to have a decent meal while lounging by the pool. They have a bar with stools and probably about 10 tables or you can eat by the pool. There is also a room for kids with a handful of video games and some small tables for arts and crafts. It was geared more towards kids under 10 and the small selection of video games don't really classify it as a gameroom (compared to the gamerooms we are used to). Upon check in they will give you an itinerary of all the events going on everyday. They have competitions for the kids like Treasure Dive in the pool, ping pong tournament, foosball tournament, 3 point basketball shoot out, etc. These are fun for kids of all ages. Kids receive pirate tokens for each event they participate in and can trade them in at the end of the stay for a prize. There is plenty to do if you just want to hang out at the resort and take a break from the parks. Location is in the middle of everything...10 minute drive to Universal, Disney, I-Drive and practically right next door to Sea World. You can see Sea World's fireworks every night from the resort. On the 4th we went up to the 6th floor and could see tons of fireworks way off in the distance all around. All in all, in was a great resort and my 11 year old son loved the basketball courts, which many resorts lack. There were kids of all ages around and almost always something to do. I highly recommend to families.

Reviews.Title: “Way above my expecatations!!”
Reviews.Author: 2boys
Reviews.Content: We have 2 boys ages 4 & 6. My family went to orlando May 16-22 and stayed at Horizons. There are not enough words to describe how happy my family was here. We arrived at 11:00 pm, so my boys were tired, but couldn't wait to go to disney. The minute they looked out our balcony, they immediately said"can we stay here tomorrow?" Needless to say, we stayed at Horizons our entire 1st day, which by the way, was good because we did horizons every other day, and , disney the other-every other day. we stayed in bldg 13 which is directly overlooking the pirate ship pool. This is the building that I recommend for parents with children up to around 6 yearsold. If your kids are much older than that, I would probably stay overlooking the other pool. It is awesome too, and my 6 yr old really wanted to go over there alot (its only about a 2 min walk)_. It has a bigger twisting slide and it also has a great water park literally connected to the pool with water cannons and water sprouts everywhere. So fun. Anyway, the pirate ship is incredible and pictures do not do it justice. 4 slides, 4 chutes, come out of the ship. the food was great. the drinks were great, especially the bahama mama. do not need beach towels, they provide plenty and you can just leave them in towel drops at the pool area or take them back to your room. kids activities everyday, all day long. when you check in, they give you these coin pirate chips and the kids collect them all week by participating the the kids games and at the end of your stay, they cash them in for some really cool prizes! mine got a stuffed daulphin and a pirate kit (eye patch, hook, ect) EACH of them. But, one thing is for sure, this is definately a place for families with kids. i don't think i saw any couples without kids. feel free to ask any questions, it was awesome. the rooms were great. we had 2 br. very big and comfy. the 2nd br had 2 queens so both boys had a queen. maid service day.tks, 2boys -----

Reviews.Title: “I'm so glad we stayed here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading review about the Lake Orange Country Club and how big it was and the trouble people had with thier timeshare, I decided to switch and ended up at the Horizons. And I couldn't have been happier. We stayed in a 2 bedroom with 2 families, so it was 4 adults and 4 children. Although I wouldn't recommend this, it would have been perfect for 1 family. But the complex was amazing and we never had time to do any of the activities that were offered. The pools and water parks were awesome for our 3 year olds and 1 1/2 year olds. The pirate ship was fantastic for all ages! ! We couldn't pull the girls away from it. The kiddie pools in both areas were great as well. Even though we didn't go to the activities, some examples were pool parties, sundae making, Texas Hold'em, dance party, and live entertainment. It was also about 10-15 min. from Disney and a quick drive to I-4. Overall, I would stay here again in a heartbeat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We traded a week using Interval International for a weeks stay at the Marriot Horizons. I thought it looked wonderful from the pictures and the reviews I read made me even more excited. Location: My first impression was that the property is a good deal spaced out from other facilities which was nice considering how large the Orlando area is. Now of course there are Marriot properties across Westwood Rd from our location and another on the other side, but you never hear anyone or are bothered in the least by it. I was expecting a normal stay somewhere where it’s one business on top of another, and the Marriot Horizons was nothing of the sort. When you come across the quaint little bridge at the entrance and there’s a duck crossing sign, you can’t help but smile because you feel safe and like you are coming into this wonderful place. The hotel is situated on Lake Willis which is very beautiful and relaxing. It’s lovely to be able to stop what you are doing and enjoy the scenic nature around you. Our balcony had a wonderful view of the lake and for those less fortunate, there were always available chairs and swings to sit in along the walkway and enjoy the facilities of the lake. Which is of course a very nice luxury. Room Description: The room keys that they provide have the Captain Horizon on the front posing by the swimming pool and I thought this is a perfect little room key because it just started off my vacation that much better to get something so much better then what I was expecting. I traveled to the resort with a two boys ages 2 and 5 and my sister and we all completely loved it. The boys loved the Captain key and were always wanting to use that one because it was so much better then the replacement one we received when my sister lost her key. I absolutely died for the shower that I had in the Master Bedroom, it had two showerheads and they both would work at the same time so it was nice to be able to stand under a steady one and then take the other one and move it around to wash whatever I was needing to at the moment, and the bathtub in the other room was absolutely fabulous. Of course it wasn’t a Whirlpool by any means, but it was deep enough that it could have been and that to me was almost as nice. All of the beds were so squishy and comfortable when you first laid down, you didn’t want to move an inch after that because then everything might not be as perfect. It was like heaven right there in the comfort of your beautiful room. We were on the Sixth floor which is of course the top floor at the Horizons and it was very reassuring knowing that the entire balcony is screened in so there is no danger with the children throwing anything off or them injuring themselves out on the balcony. Communications with Resort: We were never bothered with offers of time share presentations or anything of that sort, of course here we were two young ladies with two young children, so we probably weren‘t the large scale family that they generally attempt to sell to. Although it was wonderful having enough utensils and towels for a much larger group, because it just made everything that much easier, extra towels and such. The only calls received during our stay from the staff were regarding a brush fire in the area and they were reassuring us via the voicemail system that everything was ok and we are in no danger according to the Orlando Fire Department who had the fire under control. They left a total of three voicemails informing us of this fact, I would have enjoyed if the phone actually beeped to let you know that they had left a message rather then actually call all of the rooms individually, but the little light on the phone seemed to be able to catch my attention enough to actually check the messages. And they called us once to inform us about the Guest Relations person and she gave us her name and extension in case we needed anything during our stay. Pools: The pools were great and often a big hit with the boys. I wasn’t a big fan of the Waterworks part because it never seemed crowded and the water was just so cold. It’s not much fun to aim a cannon at nothing because there is no one playing in the area due to the cold water temp (in May!!). The long water slide was great for older kids but I felt like it beat me up and slammed me into the walls as I was sliding down holding the boys. The whirlpool tubs around the hotel are absolutely amazing, they seat 15 people and have palm trees in the middle and reminded me of a lazy river due to the design. I was really impressed with these because I have never seen hot tubs designed so impressively. It was great being able to ask the boys if they would like to head to the waterpark, and they would get really excited no matter where we where or what we were doing. This made trips back to the hotel really easy because we weren't having to fight with the children to get them to leave Disney or shopping. Cool Stuff: One of the great things about the stay was the souvenir cup at the bar which was a little over 8 dollars originally and could be used for any type of frozen alcoholic beverage imaginable and then refills were only 5 dollars each for the rest of your stay. Which seems like a pretty sweet deal when you count on spending almost 7 dollars per drink without that cup. I also really enjoyed the Turkey Panini it was a wonderful sandwich and looked as good as it tasted. Activities: There were always activities going on at the hotel from pirate scavenger hunts, to dives for treasure, eat out activities with the pirates and even karaoke. The boys would get tokens when they participate in the activities at the hotel and at checkout would be issued some prizes in accordance with the number of tokens they had. My opinion of the Activities: The only disappoint I had was when we went to the Pirate Treasure Dive and there were so many kids, they didn’t do a good job of letting the little ones head out first and my son who is two had everyone snatching the treasure away from him and trying to push him around even though I was standing next to him and I was just shocked at the way these children were behaving. The children are told to get as many as possible and then they get free sundaes or free tokens to be used for prizes at checkout and I had to bug the people just to give my son a token for participating because he couldn’t actually get any treasure because according to the rules, I couldn’t help and pick anything up for him and there were all these 7-10 year old kids pushing everyone else out of the way so they could get more prizes. I felt there should have been a better division of ages and of course that they should have taken a time break between releasing the 5 and under group and the older group because all of the children playing on the same structure is just asking from problems. We also chose to do the Pirate Lunch, the parents drop off their children and don’t go with them which seems a little odd to myself seeing as how there is only one counselor, or at least there was when we did our lunch and one would have to be VERY trusting to drop off their children with a complete stranger for an hour or so not knowing where they are and in which building they are located (maybe there is more staff if there are more children?). Also for this one program, it's the only one that doesn't have a set time the other dinners are all from 5-7 or 4-9 or something completely set. When I asked the front desk about this, they just said from 30 minutes to an hour depending on the number of children there, yet all other meals and activities like this have set schedules no matter how many people sign up. The fact that there isn’t more then one person sitting there supervising the other in case of situations of false accusations was unusual to me. Now like I said, I did go along with the group and this activity was the only one that didn't start for 5 and up, it said under 5 must have an adult come with them for the luncheon. So I felt this was the only one I was welcome to go with the kids and that both boys could enjoy. Our group ended up being 4 young girls and my two boys in the group along with the one male counselor. We were taken to a room upstairs above the lobby in a totally different building then where we started and they were fed their lunch and they got to watch Spongebob, I know not exactly what the parents pay for, but it was the beginning. I really felt that our going to the lunch was totally worth the money (it was 10 dollars per child but my 2 year old and I just tagged along, so we only paid for one lunch/child). The lunch they are given is pre-selected by the parents and his chicken fingers would have been 5.95 regularly and then the lunch also comes with a free sundae during the ice cream hour between 2-3pm everyday, which is regularly 3 dollars. So basically I came out one dollar behind, although they entertain your child and it’s an amazing way to get tokens for the checkout and at the end they received real tokens to be used in the arcade games back in the Horizons Hall (they guy even gave my son and I tokens also, so all three of us got some tokens to play with), we ended up getting over 19 tokens for the prizes for the two boys just at this one lunch (keep in mind they only need 6 or 10 to trade in for the prizes and of course they cut the kids some slack if they don’t quite have enough). The lunch also comes with your choice of chocolate or regular milk (but for some reason they didn't ask me when I signed us up and Noah ended up getting Chocolate Milk and he hates anything Chocolate but I had just juice with us so it was ok) and some little goodies for the kids, we received captain hook type hands, a coloring book with crayons, pirate necklaces (basic mardi gras beads), and many other things. Like I said, I completely felt like this was worth my money and then some, but was worried about the amount of trust that the other parents had in a complete stranger with a Captains Crew shirt on. The Captain himself made an appearance at our luncheon and the children got to ask him questions but the Captain never answered, it was always the gentleman watching the group that answered for him. I really thought the reason that the Captain has the eye patch was cute, apparently since his ship is now the water slide, he was climbing up the slide and a child was going down it and the kid's foot poked him in the eye and so now he has the dreaded eye patch. So I thought that was cute and a good way to teach the kids not to climb the slides, although they should make a little sign stating that and post it at the pool. As a cute little thing to read about the Captains history. Summary: Anyways so that’s about all I have to say about our stay, a wonderful location although the interstate situation is a little odd, you can get on going west really close to the hotel but have to drive a few miles to get on the interstate going east and the same with getting off the interstate from the east. Although it is nice in the fact that the hotel is on the same street that was the exit ramp, so you can’t really get too lost. It was just a little difficult when they shut down all of the roads near the hotel due to the fire. I loved the room and the size of it, the table to eat at was amazing. The couch wasn’t very comfortable but we used it anyways. The balcony was great along with the beds and showers. Bar drinks are good, pools are cool, I always felt safe at this location which is of course a very important thing. I guess it’s important to mention that the building we were staying in was being painted and therefore there were a few workers around every day, but they didn’t bother anyone that I know of and always seemed to keep to themselves, so it wasn’t any sort of problem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and facilities, understaffed”
Reviews.Author: Tripp'sDad
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 5 days at this resort. We are a family of 4 with 7 and 8 year old kids. Arrival started a bit rough. We arrived at 3pm and were told our room wouldn't be ready till the check-in time of 4pm. We went shopping for food and returned at 4pm. The room was not ready till almost 5pm. The room was very nice. Spacious living area and well stocked with kitchenware. There are two wonderful pools; one with a great pirate ship and the other with a really fun, BIG water slide. The location was about 15 minutes to Disney and only a couple of miles to SeaWorld. Food poolside was adequate, although the bar tender was alone and found it difficult to service both the bar and poolside tables. Calls to the front desk seemed to consistently ring forever. Minimal pressure to take a tour of the facility accompanied by an offer of $200 off our room costs to take the tour. We didn't take them up on the offer so I can't comment on the sales pitch. Clean, comfortable, convenient. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “No better resort for families with young children”
Reviews.Author: HLIW
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort with my daughter in March 2006 and could not have been happier with the staff responsiveness, level of service, quality of the accommodations, etc. We had a top floor room in bldg. 29 (had been open for about a month) with a view of the waterpark and one of the pools. The unit was clean, and well maintained. The television in the guest room went out on our second day and they replaced it within 2 hours of my call. As I said, staff responsiveness was tremendous. The property has two pools. One pool has a slide and an adjacent water park. The other has a pirate ship in the center with smaller slides, water cannons, etc. Most of the younger children preferred the pirate ship pool. There was a solid activity schedule for the week, which included put put golf (on site), cane pole fishing, pool games, arts and crafts, etc. etc. Nearly all of the activities were family oriented. Our daughter is 3, so we did not go to Disney World this trip, but did go to Sea World a few times (1 mile away) after securing a discounted pass for the week through the consierge. She was perfectly happy to spend the week at the resort given all of the activities offered, plus the pirate ship pool (big hit). I travel extensively for work and try to stay at Marriott properties whenever possible. Marriott has never let me down on business and they far surpassed my expectations (which were pretty high) on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Horizons was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: 5luvcaribe
Reviews.Content: We are a family with 3 young children ages 8,5,and 2 and I have to say Horizons was incredible for our stay. If you have young children this really is the place to be. We have stayed at Disney Beach Club before and Marriott World Center but I have to say we will definitely be coming back here. We stayed in building 10 which I don't believe is a newer unit but it certainly was very clean and in excellent condition. It was very close to all the pools. The pirate ship pool was a blast for all our children. (unfortunately the weather was only warm enough for them to swim 1 day but they are heated.)We are thinking about buying a timeshare in Aruba since we are a family of 5 now and we were coming to Disney on spring break so that's why we decided to give this villa stay a try. I'm so glad we chose Horizons over Cypress Harbour because we had a hard time deciding but Thanks to all the reviews we decided to give Horizons a try (mainly because of the kid friendly aspect)and it really was the best decision we made. Cypress Harbour is right across the street from Horizons so we drove through but we thought it was too big and didnt seem to be the place to stay with young children. I can't say enough about this place it had basketball courts, soccer fields, waterworks play area, a two story waterslide, mini golf, and the staff does a great job of entertaining the kids at the pirate pool with games. This really is the place to stay -We loved it and you will too!!

Reviews.Title: “Great week at Horizons”
Reviews.Author: PartyOfFive_Grandma
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this resort for a week with grandma, and three kids 2,4,7. The kids had a great time. This place was so fun, we only went to the parks two days and had three pools day. The two pools are awesome. Lots of hot tubs. The kids program was fun. From our balcony, we could see the Magic Kingdom fireworks every evening. Close to everything. Easy drive to Disney. We went to the timeshare presentation...no high presure. Great place for kids...if I was going without kids, I would chose another Marriott location. This place is geared for kids. In addition to two pools, there is foosball, ping pong, pool table, play ground, basketball, Mini-golf $5, and a good resturant menu, somewhat reasonably priced on site. The room was very comfortable, with two queens and a king, as well as a pull-out. The kitchen was a good size, and the table was great, with bench seating for kids on half of the large table. We stayed at the Sheridan Vistana Village last year and had a good time. I think this place, with the awesome pools, is better for kids, but both were great. They are continuing to add new buildings and ammenities. And they DO have wireless internet, contrary to what the website says. Overall, a great week. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hot Tubs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort from March 3, 2006- March 9,2006. I was leary to stay here after reading the reviews about how kid friendly the resort was. Our trip did not inclde children and I wanted a relaxing vacation. This resort was wonderful! There was plenty of children but all were so entertained by the Pirate Ship and water slides that they never were under foot. We stayed in building 15 last room near I-4. The trafic on I-4 was heavy but we never heard the traffic in the room. After long days at Disney and Universal...... THE HOT TUBS WERE GREAT! We chose not to go on a Resort Presentation as we had no intention of buying a second time share. Why should we when we stayed here for $98.00/week by trading the one we own in Vermont? We had stayed at the Marriott Grande Vista 2 years ago and this resort was equally as nice. We would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Keeps getting better!!!”
Reviews.Author: 637palmer
Reviews.Content: We've spent a week's vacation at Horizons's each winter now for the past 5 years. Grandparents own several Marriott timeshares and trade a week for this location for us and the kids. Great place for kids and families! This year, another pool area opened near the Waterpark. This new area includes a 2 story water slide that was lots of fun for our kids! Each day their big decision was which pool area to go to! They still love the Pirate Ship area too! We stayed in a new building #14, the room was nice as always. No complaints, checking in and out was quick. We played mini-golf 2 times - it's a fun little course. Would recommend Horizon's to any family!!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: lkirk4
Reviews.Content: We just spent four nights at this property in conjunction with a timeshare presentation package. Hard to leave! We were in building 13, overlooking the pool with the pirate ship. We have 3 kids, ranging in age from 1 to 10, and it suited us perfectly. The pools are great - our kids LOVED the pirate ship and the larger water slide. Stayed in a 2 bedroom/2 bath villa. It was spacious and the kitchen was nicely appointed - glad to have service for 6! We cooked dinner twice and had all the tools we needed. Our kids loved having 2 queen beds and their own TV in their room. Washer/dryer were great to have - although remember to bring your own detergent and Bounce. Room was clean. A newer property but the furniture in our unit was really showing wear and tear. Sheets on bed were worn but towels were in good condition. I requested early check-in. When we got there (around 1pm), there were no rooms available but the front desk took my cell phone number and promised to call when a room was available. Lo and behold, they did actually call and we got in the room around 3pm. Location is good - about 2 minutes to SeaWorld and an easy drive to Disney. Timeshare presentation was fine but ran long. Don't believe the claims that it'll only last 90 minutes - 150 is more accurate. Our salesperson was good and not high pressure. We also stayed at the Hilton Tuscany timeshare property. It is newer and more posh but less kid friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort, especially for kids”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort just last week (2/28/06-3/3/06) -three adults and two kids, ages 10 months and 5 years. The resort is beautiful -from the well-done villas (we stayed in the new building, #28) to the gorgeous lakes and boardwalk. As many people mentioned before, the pools (which are more like water parks) are the main attractions, for the kids and adults alike. They even had kiddie pool areas where my 10 month-old loved crawling and splashing. One of the things that stands out the most about this resort is how nice and accommodating staff are. Everything we asked for was at our door within 15 minutes. We called the front desk numerous times with questions -and were always answered promptly. Timeshare prez was not bad -not too much pressure, we refused and weren't bothered again, but Disney dollars came in handy. The one thing that's important to notice is that the resort is under construction. Thus, between 10 am-4 pm, you may be hearing noise. It only bothered me once, on a day I tried to sleep in and could hear the noise even with closed windows. But this is to be expected and they warn you about it. Overall, it was a great place to stay and we hope to be back (my five year old wishes she never left!!).

HotelInfo.Name: Marriott's Harbour Lake
HotelInfo.Address: 7102 Grand Horizons Boulevard, Orlando, FL 32821
